loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio works as an artisan making shoes and his wife has a guesthouse near the bus stop for minibus 248 green.

His house is located in the Obispo Bosque zone of La Paz city. This is the third time he has asked for a credit. The money requested will be used to buy leather and lining in order to make shoes.

His working record has permitted him to apply for this credit as he already has experience as an artisan and this employment provides income in order to cover the loan repayments.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Julio trabaja como artesano donde elabora calzados y su esposa tiene una pensión en la parada del minibús 248 verde.

Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona obispo bosque de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito. El monto solicitado será destinado la compra de cuero y forro para elaborar calzados.

Sus antecedentes de trabajo le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia como artesano y esta actividad le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of leather and linings in order to make shoes

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando lives in the house of his godparents in the San Cristobal street of Tacagua area in the city of La Paz. He sells straw and brush brooms, he also sells woman's footwear. The loan will be use to increase his working capital since the income from this activity is his only means subsistence. His precedent record qualifies him as a good client and he can gain access to a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Fernando vive en casa de los padrinos en la calle San Cristóbal de la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que realiza es la venta de escobas de paja y de cepillo, también vende calzados de mujer. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital ya que con esta actividad genera sus ingresos y es su único medio de subsistencia. Su antecedente histórico lo califica como buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Buy straw to make brooms.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Mr Antonio M. lives with his wife and his two children at his own house in the German Busch area of the City of El Alto . Mr Antonio works as doorman of a private building in the city of La Paz. His wife sells cosmetic products in a stand at the Ceja area in the city of El Alto. The requested loan will be use to used to build the framing for four rooms in two floors in the field of his property. This is the first time that he has requested a loan and the socioeconomic analysis made, qualifies him favorably and he can gain access to a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Antonio M. vive en casa propia en la zona German Busch de la Ciudad de EL Alto con su esposa y sus dos hijos. El señor Antonio trabaja como portero de un edificio particular de la ciudad de La Paz y su esposa vende productos cosméticos en un puesto en vía pública del sector de la ceja en la ciudad de El Alto. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de cuatro habitaciones en obra gruesa y en dos plantas en el terreno de su propiedad. Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Build framing for four bedrooms.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima lives in a small place, Litve, near the town Živinice. She is married and she has one son, 13 years old. He goes to primary school. Her husband is a self-employed driver. Their monthly income is about US$ 750, as they have a shop selling mixed goods and she owns some livestock. Their income is not enough to maintain the shop and feed their livestock, however.

Fatima has requested her first loan at MCO WWI in the amount of US$ 600 and she is going to invest in her shop by buying more goods. She is hoping that this loan will improve her business activity and thus she will improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her small store

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo has a sewing workshop at home where he makes leather jackets. He has three children and one is in university. This is the fifth time that he has requested a loan. His record in our institution qualifies him as client “1”, meaning good repayment of his loans. This loan will be use to buy raw materials (leather, lining, brooches and thread). His loan records and work allow him to gain access to this loan since he has experience in sewing and he has sufficient income to cover both the loan and his personal needs and those of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Ricardo tiene un taller de costura en su domicilio donde elabora chamarras de cuero tiene tres hijos y una esta en la universidad. Es la quinta vez que solicita un crédito. Su historial en nuestra institución lo califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de materia prima ( cuero, forro, broches e hilo). Sus antecedentes crediticios y trabajo le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en el rubro de costura y tiene ingresos suficientes para cubrir tanto el préstamo como sus necesidades personales y las de su familia.

loans.use: Buy leather, lining, brooches and thread to make leather jackets.

loans.name: Yawo Mawuéna

texts.fr:
Mr. Yawo Mawuéna A., 26, is married and the breadwinner for four persons. His primary business activity is selling gasoline. This is where most of his income comes from. Known by his customers for his patience and reasonableness, he purchases gasoline at a service station and comes back to sell it by the liter in his village. Since he lacks the financial means to expand his business, he is seeking a loan in the amount of US$ 300 so that he will be able to buy a larger quantity of gasoline. The increased income will allow him to better support his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agé de 26, monsieur A. Yawo Mawuéna est marié et compte à sa charge quatre (04) personnes. La vente du pétrole est son activité principale. C’est d’ailleurs de cette activité qu’il tire plus de revenus. Reconnu par ses clients pour sa patience et sa clémence, il achète le pétrole à la station d’essence et revient le vendre en détail dans son village. Aujourd’hui, faute de moyens, il sollicite un apport financier de $300 afin d’acheter en grande quantité le pétrole. Le revenu lui servira de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use:
Purchase and re-sale of gasoline

Achat et vente de pétrole

loans.name: Amavi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Amavi E. was born on April 20, 1980 in Kouvé in the prefecture of Yoto and is now living in Tsévié with her two children and two servants. Her husband is working in Lomé and, with only a meager salary, he has difficulty supporting his family, so she is responsible for providing for their needs. Dynamic and entrepreneurial, she supports her family using income from her various sales. She has invested previous loans wisely and has repaid them in a timely manner.

She is currently requesting a loan of US$ 400 which she will use to buy some sacks of rice and tins of oil, etc. to expand her little business. This will allow her to do more to improve the financial situation of her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame E. Amavi est née le 20 avril 1980 à Kouvé dans la préfecture de Yoto actuellement, elle vit à Tsévié avec ses deux (02) enfants et deux (2) domestiques. Son mari employé à Lomé et avec un maigre salaire il arrive difficilement à couvrir les charges de la famille, ce qui fait que toutes les charges du foyer sont assurées par elle. Dynamique et entreprenante, elle subvient aux besoins de sa famille grâce aux revenus que la procure ses diverses ventes. Elle a su bien gérer les précédents crédits obtenus et les a remboursé convenablement. A présent, elle sollicite un crédit de $400 qui servira à l’achat des sacs de riz et des bidons d’huile et autres pour renforcer son petit commerce. Ainsi pourra-t-elle participer davantage à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use:
purchasing sacks of rice and tins of oil

Achat de sacs de riz et bidons d'huile

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Born in 1961, Kokou L. is married and counts among his responsibilities a total of eight people. Having a 10th grade education, he took very quickly to agriculture, and this has come to earn him respect. Having over-worked his soil, which has gotten poor, he wants to take advantage of a loan of $400 to buy fertilizer, insecticides, and other work-related supplies. He will then be able to increase his yields and to meet the needs of his family better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Né en 1961, Monsieur L. Kokou est marié et compte à sa charge un total de huit (08) personnes. Instruit de niveau secondaire, il renoua très vite l’agriculture qui fait de lui aujourd’hui une personne respectée. Ayant trop exploité ses terres qui sont devenus pauvres, Monsieur L. veut bénéficier d’un financement de $400 pour acheter de l’engrais, d’insecticides et d’autres matériels de travail. C’est ainsi qu’il pourra augmenter son rendement et mieux satisfaire les charges de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Rosa Irene

texts.es:
Rosa Irene P. is a lady who has been selling vegetables at the market La Terminal in León, Nicaragua for 5 years now. She also sells clothes and cosmetics, but at a lesser quantity. Since she was young, she has been known to be very hard working. In addition, she is a mother of two little ones and holds the responsibility of providing them with health, education and a decent home where they can live.

She started her business with a sum of C$2,000 (Two thousand córdobas, or $110 USD) contributed by her husband. These days, she has been able to better her financial situation, but still needs to further invest in her business. To do this, she has taken loans from Ceprodel (3 loans) which according to her, have greatly helped in the acquisition of products and supporting her family.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa Irene P. es una dama que desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de verduras en el sector del mercado la Terminal en León Nicaragua. También se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos pero en menor cantidad. Desde muy joven se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora y además, es madre de dos pequeños que tiene la responsabilidad de brindarles salud, educación y un techo digno donde habitar.

Inició su actividad con un monto de C$ 2,000 (Dos mil córdobas) obtenidos por aporte de sus esposo, hoy en día, ha logrado mejorar su situación económica pero aun necesita invertir mas en su negocio y para esto ha realizado créditos con Ceprodel (3 créditos) y según cuenta le han beneficiado grandemente en la adquisición de los productos y además en la manutención de su núcleo familiar.

loans.use: Purchase vegetables

loans.name: Antoine

texts.fr:
Antoine K., age 36, resides in Agomé-Glozou. After finishing grade school, he joined his parents in working the earth. Today, he is a father of a family of nine, and agriculture continues to be his daily work. Since he is well-known by his neighbors for his enthusiastic work ethic, he is requesting a loan of $400 to buy fertilizer in order to improve his plots, which he has been cultivating for about 20 years. The loan will enable him to increase his yields and to meet customer demand. The resulting income will allow him to provide for his family better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Agé de 36 ans, Monsieur K. Antoine réside à Agomé-Glozou. Après ses études primaires, il rejoint ses parents au travail de la terre. Aujourd’hui devenu père d’une famille de neuf (09) personnes, son travail quotidien demeure l’agriculture. Bien connu de ses voisins par son ardeur au travail, Monsieur K. sollicite un financement de $400 pour acheter de l’engrais afin d’enrichir ses sols qu’il cultive depuis près de 20 ans. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter le rendement de sa production et être à la hauteur de la demande de sa clientèle. Les revenus lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux charges de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
Ms. Nicolasa lives in her own house in Los Pinos street Nº 509 in the Pasankeri area of the city of La Paz. She is 59 years old and lives with her husband and son. She is a domestic employee, her husband works as bricklayer. The loan will be use to pay the cost to join a transportation company called “Linea Trufi” for his son. This way, he will be able to work as a driver of one of the taxis that are part of the “Linea trufi”. Her record qualifies her as a good client and can gain access to a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Nicolasa vive en casa propia la calle Los Pinos Nº 509 de la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene 59 años y vive con su esposo e hijo, la actividad que realiza es la de empleada domestica en un domicilio particular, su esposo trabaja como albañil. El crédito que solicita es para pagar el costo de ingreso a una línea de trufi para su hijo, quien de esta manera podrá trabajar como chofer de uno de los taxis que forman parte de la línea de trufi. El antecedente histórico la califica como buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Pago de cuota de ingreso a una linea de trufi para que su hijo trabaje como chofer

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr:
Born on April 4, 1978 in Lomé, Adjovi S. dropped out of grade school and began an apprenticeship in hairdressing. Despite financial difficulties, she completed her training and was able to open her own hair salon. She is single, and she has a child, as well as her parents and her apprentices, to take care of. Ms. S. is energetic and manages her salon well. She is requesting a loan of $600 to buy hair dryers and hairdressing supplies in order to strengthen her business. This is how she will be able to increase her income and to improve living conditions at home.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Née le 04 avril 1978 à Lomé, Mademoiselle S. Adjovi a abandonné ses études au cours primaire et est rentrée en apprentissage de coiffure. Malgré les difficultés financières, elle a terminé son apprentissage et a pu ouvrir son propre salon de coiffure. Célibataire avec un enfant, elle a à sa charge et ses parents et ses apprenties. Elle est dynamique et gère bien son atelier. Elle sollicite un crédit de $600 pour acheter des séchoirs et des articles de coiffure afin de renforcer ses activités. Ainsi elle pourra augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy hair dryers and hair dressing supplies

loans.name: Eva Mercedes

texts.es:
Mrs. Eva H. is a woman worthy if emulation. Seven years ago she started her business selling cough drops, chewing gum, cookies and cigarettes outside the Terminal market in Leon. Despite the difficult circumstances she has been going through for a long time, she decided to apply for a sales stall inside the market and persevered until she had successfully acquired one. She has been fighting for years to support her two small children and give them all the support she can for their educations.

It's extremely important to point out that during the past 3 years, Eva has received 64 loans from Ceprodel, and has known how to very wisely take advantage of investment in her business. As a result, her sales have increased and her earnings, as well. Her greatest wish is that her children finish school and go on to graduate from college.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Eva H. es una mujer digna de imitar, desde hace 7 años inició su negocio de venta de bisuterías (pastillas, chicles, galletas, cigarrillos, etc.) en las afueras del mercado la Terminal en León. Sin embargo a pesar de las difíciles circunstancias que por mucho tiempo ha atravesado, decide solicitar un local en el interior del mercado hasta obtenerlo. Ha venido luchando por muchos años para mantener a sus dos pequeños hijos y brindarle todo su apoyo en sus estudios.

Es de muchísima importancia destacar que desde hace tres años, ha obtenido con Ceprodel 64 créditos que los ha sabido aprovechar sabiamente en la inversión de su negocio por lo que ha aumentado sus ventas y por ende sus utilidades. Su mayor anhelo es que sus hijos se preparen y coronen una carrera universitaria.

loans.use: Purchase the snack items she sells

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es:
Mr. Ronald lives with his in-laws in San Cristobal Street Nº 50B in the Tacagua area, of the city of La Paz. He is 38 years old and lives with her wife and children. He works making unisex jackets and vests of polar fabric (warmer than regular fabric). His workshop is located at his house. He supports his wife and meets their needs with this business. He will use the loan to buy fabric, threads, etc. His record qualifies him as a good client and he can gain access to a new loan. He is a client of IMPRO since 2002.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Ronald vive en casa de sus suegros en la calle San Cristóbal Nº 50B de la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene 38 años y vive con su esposa he hijos. La actividad que realiza es la confección de chamarras y chalecos de tela polar (que abriga más que la tela regular) para ambos sexos y su taller lo tiene ubicado en la misma casa; con esta actividad mantiene a su esposa y cubre sus necesidades. El crédito que solicita es para comprar tela, hilos y otros. Su antecedente histórico lo califica como buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2002.

loans.use: Buy polar fabric, thread, etc.

loans.name: Mibialodo

texts.fr:
Born in 1958, Mibialodo L. currently lives in Agomé-Glozou with her spouse. Her primary business is the production of beignets (a kind of doughnut). And due to the income from it, she manages to help meet household expenses. Today, she anxiously seizes this chance to request a loan of $250 to buy sacks of wheat and some oil in order to produce her beignets. She will be better able to meet the expectations of her customers and to increase her bottom line.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Née en 1958, Madame L. Mibialodo vit actuellement à Agomé-Glozou avec son époux. Son activité principale est la production de beignets et c’est grâce à ces revenus qu’elle arrive à contribuer aux charges du ménage. Aujourd’hui, elle compte saisir cette opportunité pour solliciter un financement de $250 pour acheter des sacs de blé, de l’huile afin de produire ses beignets. Elle pourra mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et augmenter son chiffre d’affaire.

loans.use: To buy flour and oil for making beignets

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Born on July 23, 1980 in Agoè (Golfe prefecture), Kossi A. finished middle school before he started his own business selling soap, sugar, milk and other goods. But because he lacks sufficient funds, his business is stagnant, and he is often faced with inventory shortages. This is why, in order to better equip his shop with other items and to increase his income, he is requesting a loan of $800 to buy cartons of soap, milk, and other canned goods at cheaper rates. He will then be able to maximize his income and to help to improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Née le 23 juillet 1980 à Agoè dans la préfecture du Golfe, Monsieur A. Kossi a fait ses études jusqu’au collège, avant de se lancer dans le petit commerce de vente de savons, sucres, laits et autres pour son propre compte. Mais l’insuffisance de fonds fait que son commerce n’évolue pas et il est très souvent confronté à la rupture de stock. C’est ainsi que pour pouvoir mieux équiper sa boutique d’autre article, afin d’augmenter ses revenus, il sollicite un crédit de $800 qui servira à acheter des cartons de savons, laits et autres boites de conserves, ce qui lui revient moins cher. Ainsi pourra-t-elle avoir le maximum de revenus pour contribuer plus à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To stock cartons of soap, milk, sugar, and canned goods

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel  cría ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche la comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche).
 
Vive en la Comunidad de Nina Chiri  sector Laja a  tres horas  y media de la ciudad de La Paz., El es soltero vive junto a su abuela y a sus tres hermanos menores a quienes colabora económicamente por ser el hermano mayor.
 
El crédito lo destinara para la compra de ganado de raza mejorada y así incrementar la producción de leche.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Compra de una vaca lechera para aumentar su produccion de leche.

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Born in Djita in 1972, Kokou A. is married and the father of five. An excellent tailor in his neighborhood, he receives customer orders from just about everywhere. He continuously adds apprentices to his shop. Faced with this situation, his only sewing machine prevents him from serving his customers on a timely basis and from doing a good job training his apprentices. To resolve this problem, he had the idea to buy sewing machines, but this requires financing. Finding himself at a disadvantage, he is here to request a loan of $600, which will enable him to realize his dream of making more from his line of work.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Né à Djita en 1972, Monsieur A. Kokou est marié et père de cinq (05) enfants. Excellent couturier de sa localité, il reçoit des commandes d’un peu partout. Le nombre de ses apprentis ne cesse d’augmenter. Face à cette situation, sa seule machine ne lui permet pas de servir les clients à temps et de bien former ses apprentis. Pour résoudre ce problème, il a eu l’idée de s’acheter des machines mais cette réalisation nécessite des moyens financiers. Ce trouvant dans cette incapacité, il vient solliciter un financement de $600. Ceci lui permettra de réaliser son rêve en vue de mieux profiter de son métier.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines

loans.name: Kouamivi

texts.fr:
Born in 1963 in Assomé in the Zio region, Mr L. Kouamivi is married and takes care of four children. He completed his primary education and then continued his education with a masonry apprenticeship. Without a job, he travelled to Nigeria to find work. Having returned to his country, he would like to buy a motor bike for transportation. His wife resells various products, but earns little income to help with the family's needs. Dynamic and honest, he works very hard in order to meet the needs of his family. He is asking for a loan of $1000 which will enable him to buy a motor bike for transport, which will in turn help him earn more money and take better care of himself and his family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Né en 1963 à Assomé dans la préfecture du Zio, Monsieur L. Kouamivi est marié et a en charge quatre enfants. Il a fait les études primaires, avant de suivre une formation en maçonnerie. Ne trouvant pas de marché, il a voyagé sur Nigeria pour exercer son métier. De retour dans son pays, il souhaite acquérir des motos pour le transport. Sa femme revendeuse de produits divers, gagne très peu pour l’aider dans les charges de la famille. Dynamique et de bonne moralité, il fait beaucoup d’effort pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Pour permettre à la famille de subvenir à leurs besoins, il sollicite un crédit de $1000 qui va lui permettre d’acheter une moto pour le transport. Il pourra ainsi avoir plus de revenu et s’occuper plus de lui-même et de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase of motorcycle for transport

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana works breeding dairy cattle, she commercializes milk to Andina PIL (Milk Possessing Plant). She lives with her two small children and husband in the Community of Ninachiri, Laca areathree and three an half hours from the city of La Paz. Her husband is a baker in their community and his income helps to support their family. The loan will use to buy improved race dairy cattle and this way increase the milk production. This is the second loan with Impro. The evaluation made qualifies her to grant her the loan. The previous loan was completely repaid.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Juana se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). Vive en la Comunidad de Ninachiri sector Laja a tres horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz, junto a sus dos pequeños hijos y su esposo el cual es panadero de la comunidad con cuyos ingresos ayuda en el sostenimiento de la familia. El crédito lo destinara para la compra de ganado de raza mejorada y así incrementar la producción de leche. Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo. El préstamo anterior fue cancelado en su totalidad.

loans.use: Buy improved race dairy cattle.

loans.name: Sotowou

texts.fr:
Mr V. Sotowou is a 33 year-old honest farmer in his region. Married and a father of five children, he has great difficulty in managing to support his family with his poor income. The main reason for this is the lack of means to work adequately in order to increase the output of his crops. He would thus need to buy manure and requests a financial contribution of $500, which will enable him to profit from his crops and to better provide for the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Agé de 33 ans, Monsieur V. Sotowou est un brave cultivateur de sa localité. Marié et père de cinq (5) enfants, il arrive difficilement à supporter les charges de sa famille avec son maigre revenu. Cette insuffisance de revenu est due au manque de moyen de travail adéquat pour avoir un meilleur rendement de ses cultures. Pour y remédier, il voudrais acheter des engrais et sollicite un apport financier de $500. Ce qui lui permettra de mieux rentabiliser ses rendements et mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase of manure

loans.name: Dosseh

texts.fr:
Born in 1963, Mr A. Dosseh is married and a father of seven (7) children. Being an excellent poultry breeder in his area, he works with the best poultry saleswomen in his region. However, since he does not have a barn, the poultry is left free for robbers to take each night. To put an end to this problem, he would like to build a barn and buy more poultry, but lacks the financial means. He thus asks for a contribution of $500 which will help him make this project a reality. He would thus be able to meet his customers' needs, have a very good income and improve the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Né en 1963, Monsieur A. Dosseh est marié et père de sept (7) enfants. Excellent éleveur de volailles de son milieu, il est sollicité par les bonnes femmes commerçantes de volailles de sa localité. Mais faute d’enclos, ses volailles sont laissées à la merci des voleurs chaque nuit. Pour mettre fin à ce problème, il décide de construire un enclos et s’acheter d’autres volailles mais faute de moyens financiers, il sollicite cet apport de $500 qui va lui servir à la réalisation de ce projet. Ainsi, il pourra satisfaire sa clientèle et avoir un très bon revenu afin d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Construction of barn and purchase of poultry

loans.name: Ceila

texts.es:
Ceila lives on Rafael Pavon Street in the area of July 16th, located in the city of El Alto. She lives with her husband and her 5 year old son. She works alongside her husband in the fabrication of jackets and coats, which they distribute at wholesale in various fairs within the city. The loan will be used in the purchase of work material, such as fabrics, leathers and linings. This is the first loan request with Impro and the evaluation made has qualified her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Wendy Wise

Ceila vive en la calle Rafael Pavón de la zona 16 de Julio, ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto. Vive junto a su esposo y su pequeño hijo de 5 años. Trabaja junto a su esposo en la confección de chamarras, sacones los cuales distribuye al por mayor en las diferentes ferias de la ciudad. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de material de trabajo (telas, cuero, forros, etc.). Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics, leathers and linings for the making of coats and jackets.   Compra de telas, cueros, forros para la confección de chamarras y sacones.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr:
Mrs A. Kossiwa is 28 years old and was born in Djita in the Vo region. Married and a mother of six children, she is an honest farmer who would like to do better than men. Despite of courage and dynamic personality, her income never manages to meet her family's needs because her farm's production is poor and is only sufficient for their consumption. Now, she wants to improve the production in order to be able to market the produce, but lacks the financial means to do so. It is for that reason that she asks for a loan of $500 to buy manure and some work materials. In doing so, Mrs A. will be financially more independent.

Translated by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Agée de 28 ans, Madame A. Kossiwa est née à Djita dans la préfecture de Vo. Mariée et mère de six (6) enfants, elle est une brave cultivatrice qui cherche à mieux faire que les hommes. Malgré son dynamisme et son courage, son revenu n’arrive jamais à satisfaire sa famille car le rendement de ses terres est médiocre et seulement destiné à la consommation. Aujourd’hui, elle veut améliorer son rendement afin de pouvoir la commercialiser mais les moyens financiers lui manquent cruellement. C’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite ce financement de $500 pour s’acheter de l’engrais et quelques matériels de travail. Par cette réalisation Madame A. aura une autonomie financière plus indépendante.

loans.use: Purchase of manure and work tools

loans.name: Zenobia

texts.es:
Zenobia works breeding dairy cattle, she commercializes the milk to PIL Andina (Milk Possessing Plant). She lives with her two small children and her husband in the Community of Kallutaca, Laca sector; three and a half hours from the city of La Paz. Her husband works as bricklayer in the city of El Alto; his income helps to support their family. The loan will be use to buy improved race cattle and this way increase the milk production. This is the first loan with Impro. The evaluation made qualifies her to grant herthe loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Zenobia se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). Vive en la Comunidad de Kallutaca sector Laja a tres horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz, junto a sus dos pequeños hijos y su esposo el cual trabaja como albañil en la ciudad de El Alto con cuyos ingresos ayuda en el sostenimiento de la familia. El crédito lo destinara para la compra de ganado de raza mejorada y así incrementar la producción de leche. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Buy improved race dairy cattle

loans.name: Afi Mawussi

texts.fr:
Born on December 7, 1984 in Hahotoé in the Vo region, Mrs S. Afi Mawussi is married and a mother of three (3) children and takes care of another child. She sells loincloths in the town of Tsévié Wémé, and has been happily running her business for the past several years. With only a primary education she manages to run her business and support her dependents. Her husband works in Lomé, and is not able to take care of the family due to his insufficient income. To improve her living conditions, she had requested and obtained a loan which she managed and refunded well. In order to build her business and improve her profits, she is asking for a new loan of $800 which will consist in buying various types of cloths and fabrics to be resold in the surrounding markets. This way, she will be to contribute to the improvement of the living conditions of all the family.

Translated by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Née le 07 Décembre 1984 à Hahotoé dans la préfecture de Vo, Madame S. Afi Mawussi est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants et a en charge un autre. Revendeuse de pagne, elle s’est établie à Tsévié Wémé pour son activité. Elle exerce son métier avec joie depuis plusieurs années. Ayant seulement fait le cours primaire, elle se débrouille pour gérer au mieux son activité et pour supporter les charges de la famille. Son mari commerçant à Lomé, n’arrive pas à s’occuper seul de la famille car son revenu ne lui permettait pas réellement de le faire. Pour faire face au coût de la vie, elle avait sollicité et obtenu un crédit qu’elle avait bien géré et avait bien remboursé. Pour renforcer donc son activité et mieux la rentabiliser, elle sollicite un nouveau crédit de $800 qui va consister à acheter différentes sortes de pagnes et des tissus à revendre dans les marchés environnants. Elle pourra ainsi contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de toute la famille.

loans.use: Purchase of cloths and fabrics to resell

loans.name: Kpolinon

texts.fr:
Mr. G. Kpolinon is 35 years old and resides in Tékponou. Married and a father of six children, he sells sheep for a living. He travels from market to market to sell these animals. Though this trade is profitable, he is often confronted with financial difficulties. To improve his business, he is asking for a loan of $300 to buy more animals and satisfy the his customers' demands. This will increase his sales and therefore improve his family's future.

Translated by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Agée de 35 ans, Monsieur G. Kpolinon réside à Tékponou (P/Vo). Marié et père de six enfants, il est exerce comme activité la vente des moutons. Il se déplace de marché en marché pour vendre ses bêtes. Quoique ce commerce lui soit rentable, il est souvent confronté à des difficultés financières. Pour redynamiser cette activité, il sollicite un financement de $300 afin d’acheter plus de bêtes et satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. Ceci augmentera son chiffre d’affaire pour un meilleur devenir de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of animals

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier lives on Apure Street in the town of San Jose de Yunguyo, located in the city of El Alto. He is single and lives with his father and younger brothers. He works as a baker making empanadas, or turnovers, which he distributes in various schools. The loan that he is soliciting will be used in the purchase of flour and ingredients necessary to bake empanadas. This is his first loan petition through Impro and an evaluation done qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Wendy Wise

Javier vive en la calle Apure de la zona San Jose de Yunguyo, ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto. El es soltero vive con su padre y hermanos menores. Trabaja en la elaboración de salteñas las cuales distribuye en diferentes colegios educativos (salteñas son como empanadas, que en ingles significa “turnovers”). El crédito que ahora solicita lo destinara en la compra de harina e insumos necesaR. para la elaboración de sus salteñas.. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase flour and ingredients to bake empanadas (turnovers).  Compra de harina e insumos para elaborar salteñas

loans.name: Lomessi

texts.fr:
Born in 1963, Lomessi A. is married and the mother of six children, all of whom are in school. A very dedicated woman, she buys cassava which she transforms into "gari" flour for the market. This is very tough work, which requires more manual labor than she has the means for. So, she has to do the work all by herself. She is requesting a loan of $200 to buy more cassava and a grater in order to make her work less taxing. This will enable her to increase her production and to meet her customer expectations better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Née en 1963, Madame A. Lomessi est mariée et mère de six (6) enfants tous scolarisés. Très dévouée, elle achète du manioc qu’elle transforme en farine « gari » pour la commercialisation. C’est un travail très pénible et qui nécessite plus de main d’œuvre mais les moyens de Madame A. ne le lui permettent pas et elle est seule à faire la tâche. Elle sollicite un financement de $200 pour s’acheter plus de manioc et une râpeuse afin de rendre moins pénible le travail. Ceci lui permettre d’augmenter sa production et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use: To buy cassava and a grater

loans.name: Mélé

texts.fr:
Mêlé S. was born on December 15, 1973, in Kpomé Apéyémé (Zio prefecture). She left school very early on, so that she could start a business selling gravel and the like. Married and the mother of one child, she is also the guardian of another child. Her husband, an accountant in a local institution, earns very little. Thanks to the income from her business, Ms. S. is helping with family expenses. Given her energy and self-sacrifice, she discovered how to manage successfully her first loan, which she repaid without a problem. To increase her income, she is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy land that she can use, as well as other supplies related to her work. She will then be able to make her business profitable and to have some financial independence.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Madame S. Mêlé est née le 15 Décembre 1973 à Kpomé Apéyémé dans la préfecture du Zio. Elle a abandonné les études très tôt pour se lancer dans la vente de gravier et autres. Mariée et mère d’un (01) enfant, elle a un autre enfant à sa charge. Son mari, comptable dans une institution de la place gagne très peu pour faire face aux charges de la famille. Ainsi, grâce aux revenus de son activité, elle participe aux dépenses familiales. Par son dynamisme et son abnégation, elle a su bien gérer son premier crédit qu’elle a remboursé sans incidence. Pour accroître ses revenus, elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 qui servira à l’achat de terrains pour exploitation et autres matériels liés à ce travail. Ainsi elle pourra rentabiliser ses affaires et avoir une autonomie financière.

loans.use: To sell gravel

loans.name: Loko

texts.fr:
Loko Z., age 33, is married and is responsible for five children. Agriculture remains his primary work. He grows corn, cassava, and sweet potatoes. Since the soil is poor and not conducive to agriculture, he often brings in yields too small to enable him to meet basic family needs. To improve his income, he is requesting a loan of $300 to buy fertilizer. This will better allow him to meet customer demands and to improve his living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Agé de 33 ans, Monsieur Z. Loko est marié et a en charge cinq (5) enfants. L’agriculture reste sa principale activité. Il cultive du maïs, du manioc, et de la patate douce. Les sols étant pauvres et défavorables à l’agriculture, il enregistre souvent des rendements qui ne lui permettent pas de subvenir aux besoins fondamentaux de sa famille. Pour améliorer son revenu, il sollicite un financement de $300 pour s’acheter de l’engrais et accroître la fertilité de ses sols. Ceci lui permettra de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et améliorer ses conditions de vie.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his soil

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr:
A father with one child, Komi A. was born on April 8, 1978, in Tsévié (Zio prefecture), where he was a student through middle school. After earning his diploma, he could not continue his schooling due to a lack of money. As a result, he had to become a merchant. He manages his business well. And he did well in obtaining, managing, and repaying two loans in a row. An energetic person, he wants to strengthen his business. This is why he is requesting a loan of $800 to buy and sell new styles and patterns of pants, shirts, knitted items, and more. He could then have the additional income to improve living conditions for his wife and child.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Père d’un enfant, Monsieur A. Komi est né le 08 avril 1978 à Tsévié dans la préfecture de Zio, où il a fait ses études primaires et secondaires. Après son Baccalauréat deuxième partie, il n’a pas pu continuer les études, faute de moyens. Devenu commerçant par la force des choses, il gère bien son affaire. Il avait obtenu, géré et bien remboursé deux fois de suite du crédit. Dynamique, il veut renforcer son activité. Pour cette raison, il sollicite un crédit de $800 pour l’achat des nouveaux modèles de pantalons, de chemises, de tricots et autres pour la vente. Ainsi, il pourra avoir plus de revenus qui serviront à l’amélioration des conditions de sa femme et de son enfant.

loans.use: To buy new styles of clothing to sell

loans.name: Marisela Emma

texts.es:
Doña Marisela Emma was born in the town of El Viejo, Chinandega. For economic reasons she moved to Managua where she lives in the district of La Fuente. She has 2 daughters, 10 and 8 years old. Her husband works as a security guard in a private enterprise. For 6 years Doña Marisela has had a neighborhood store in her house and supports her husband with the family expenses.

She works hard to increase the variety of merchandise at her general store and she is requesting the loan to buy products such as soft drinks and products for home and personal care. Even if her business has been growing she still has a long way to go and therefore she wishes to continue investing in order to increase sales.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Marisela Emma nació en la ciudad de El Viejo, Chinandega. Por motivos económicos tuvo que emigrar a Managua y vive en el barrio La Fuente. Tiene 2 hijas de 10 y 8 años. Su esposo trabaja como guarda de seguridad en una empresa privada. Doña Marisela tiene una pulpería desde hace 6 años en su casa de habitación y apoya a su marido en los gastos de la casa.

Trabaja arduamente para incrementar los productos de su pulpería es por eso que solicita el crédito para comprar productos como gaseosas, productos para el aseo del hogar, productos de higiene personal. A pesar de que su negocio ha crecido todavía le queda un camino largo por recorrer, es por eso que desea seguir invirtiendo para seguir creciendo.

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks and products for home and personal care to increase sales.

loans.name: Mevleta

texts.en:
Mevleta is 43 years old and she is from Gornje Dubrave, a village near Živinice. She is a widow and she lives with her 12-year-old granddaughter. Mevleta has a daughter who is divorced and unemployed. Mevleta gets a pension and monthly stipend for her granddaughter in the amount of US$ 460. She has cows and she sells fruits and vegetables.

With this loan that Mevleta is requesting through MCO and Kiva in the amount of US$ 450, she will buy more fruits and vegetables for her business. Her wish is to increase her monthly income and thus the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: Buying fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Akoélé

texts.fr:
Born in 1969, Akoélé A. is married and the mother of seven. Making gari (cassava flour) is her primary business, and she sells second-hand clothing as well, in order to help with household obligations. To bolster her efforts, she is requesting a loan of $200 to buy more cassava and to increase her production. This would better satisfy market demand.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Née en 1969, Madame A. Akoélé est mariée et mère de sept (7) enfants. La production du gari (farine de manioc) reste son activité principale et vend également des friperies afin de mieux contribuer aux charges du ménage. Pour consolider cette activité, elle sollicite un financement de $200 pour acheter plus de manioc et augmenter sa production afin de mieux satisfaire la demande du marché.

loans.use: To buy cassava

loans.name: Martha Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Martha was born in Managua, and she works as a street vendor selling clothes and shoes in the neighborhood of her local district or in the “Zona Franca”. She has been in this line of business for 5 years and she requires a loan in order to increase her stock as she wishes to buy garments and shoes fit for school uniforms to offer to her clients as the school year is about to start.

She has two children, a 24 year-old daughter and a 17 year-old son who look after her home while she is working. She wishes to grow economically so she can count on a stable and prosperous business in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Martha es originaria de Managua, se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos, su forma de trabajo es ambulante, ya sea en los alrededores de su barrio o en la Zona Franca.Tiene 5 años de estar en este negocio, necesita el crédito porque quiere aumentar su mercadería comprando ropa y zapatos escolares y poder colocarlos entre sus clientes, aprovechando que la época escolar ya está por entrar.

Tiene dos hijos, una mujer de 24 años y un varón de 17 años, quienes se encargan del cuidado del hogar cuando ella está trabajando. Espera poder crecer económicamente y en un futuro contar con un negocio próspero y estable.

loans.use: Purchase clothes and shoes fit for school uniforms in order to increase sales.

loans.name: Yavi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Yavi A. was born on December 31, 1967 in Gamé in the county of Zio. She is married and the mother of 4 children. Her husband, a reseller like her, invests very little in the household expenses. Having completed only a few years of schooling, she started to sell corn very early, wood coal and others in Tsévié and in the neighboring markets. Dynamic and honest, she has benefited from two loans that have been reimbursed without problems. To strengthen her business, she is requesting a loan of $700, which will be used only for the resale of corn and wood coal. Thanks to the income she will be able to cope with the numerous family expenses and thus improve their living conditions.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Madame A. Yavi est née le 31 Décembre 1967 à Gamé dans la préfecture du Zio. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. Son époux revendeur comme elle, investi très peu dans les dépenses domestiques. Ayant seulement fait quelques années d’études, elle a commencé par vendre très tôt le commerce de maïs, du charbon de bois et autres à Tsévié et dans les marchés voisins. Dynamique et honnête, elle a bénéficié deux fois de suite du crédit qui sont tous remboursés sans difficulté. Pour renforcer, son activité, elle sollicite un crédit de $700 qui sera consacré uniquement à la vente de charbon de bois et du maïs. Grâce aux revenus elle pourra faire face aux nombreux dépenses de la famille d’où une amélioration de leur condition de vie.

loans.use: Sale of wood coal and corn.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto and Elide live a simple life with the basic necessities and provide for their two children, ages eight and three. As the owner of a carpentry store, Alberto specializes in designing and building beautiful pieces of furniture in his shop at home. With eight years of experience in his line of work, his business has grown and now he not only sells to his neighbors, but also to many others. Alberto works everyday to be able to pay the bills and to make sure that he is able to give his children a great education. Both he and his wife hope that their sons will graduate and become good people in the community.

For now, Alberto is asking for a loan that will help cover the costs of a small truck. This investment will allow him to transport the goods that he makes. Having the ability to cover a larger distance will also allow him to increase his clientele and the sale of his furniture..

loans.use: To invest in a small truck to transport the furniture he constructs.

loans.name: Akayi

texts.fr:
Aged 35, Madame Akayi A. is married and mother of three children. She is well-known in her village because of her small business selling general food products. Unfortunately, her expenses are greater than her income and so she is unable to maintain a decent stock of goods. Her customers are very demanding and she is unable to satisfy them in time. In order to establish customer loyalty, she is requesting a loan of $250 to increase her stock of food products to meet market demand. This will allow Madame A. to increase her revenue and better provide for her family’s essential needs.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Agée de 35 ans, Madame A. Akayi est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. Grâce à son petit commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, elle est reconnue dans son village de résidence. Mais il faut noter que ses charges financières dépassent son revenu et elle n’arrive pas à installer un étalage digne de nom. Pourtant, sa clientèle est très exigeante et elle n’arrive pas à la satisfaire à temps. Afin de pouvoir fidéliser cette clientèle, elle sollicite un financement de $250 pour augmenter sa provision en produit d’alimentaire et satisfaire la demande du marché. Ceci lui permettra d’accroître son chiffre d’affaire et mieux subvenir aux besoins vitaux de sa famille.

loans.use: To purcahse food products

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
Eleven years ago, In order to support her two children, Ana Patricia H., a single mother, started a business selling frozen water, soft drinks, carbonated drinks and baked goods outside the Terminal market.

It's important to note that this type of business is very competitive. Ana H. has many competitors located very close to her place of business. She needs to buy her inventory and raw materials in order to later market them. For this reason, Ceprodel has been supporting Mrs. H. for a year. She has received 10 loans which she has used to acquire the soft drinks she needs to satisfy her clients and support her children.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Desde hace once años, en la ciudad de León, para poder mantener a sus 2 hijos por ser madre soltera, la señora Ana Patricia H. inicia un negocio de venta de agua helada, gaseosa, bebidas suaves y tortas en las afueras del mercado la Terminal.

Es necesario destacar que este tipo de negocio es muy competitivo por el hecho de que la señora Ana H. tiene muchos competidores que se ubican a su alrededor. Su necesidad es la compra de las gaseosas y la materia prima para luego comercializarlas. Es por esta razón que desde hace un año, Ceprodel ha apoyado a la señora H. con la realización de 10 créditos los cuales los ha utilizado para adquirí las gaseosas y de esta manera poder satisfacer a sus clientes pero principalmente a sus hijos que tanto lo necesitan.

loans.use: Purchase of carbonated beverages and water

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana S. is 59 year old and the proud mother of three children. She has sacrificed much to make sure that all of her children attended school. With a great role model for a mother, all of her children have grown, graduated college, and now have professions and families of their own. Today, she lives with her husband in a house of their own in the city of Encarnación. Both she and her husband worked hard their entire lives to save and buy a piece of land and house of their own. Sadly her husband is now unable to walk and is restricted to a wheelchair. Ana has become the sole supporter of her family and has to make enough money to buy her husband’s medicine.

For many years Ana has been the owner of small dressmaking store where she makes dresses and other types of clothes for people of all ages. This has been her contribution to the income; however, today it is the only source of income. After many years in business she has formed a dedicated clientele who place orders with her for special events, or who come in on a daily basis to fix clothing.

Ana is asking for a loan in order to buy more cloth for requests that she receives. Recently there has been an increase in clientele and she does not have the necessary amounts of fabric and goods to meet the demand. She will use the loan towards buying more cloth, however, with any additional funds that is not used for cloth she hopes to use to repair and upkeep her machinery.

loans.use: To buy various cloth and to maintain her sewing machinery.

loans.name: Alusine

texts.en:
Alusine C. is married and has 4 children. He sells used clothing and has been in business for the past 15 years. Alusine has been able to send all of his 4 children to school because his business provide a good profit.

“The previous loan played a significant role in improving my family life and business capacity,” said Alusine. He would like to expand the business sell clothing in the nearby village. Therefore, he is requesting a loan for $525.00.

loans.use: To expand clothing sales to nearby village to increase profits

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama J. is 46 years old, and married with 4 children. Mariam started her business 10 years ago and with the loans from SMT, she has been able to expand her business. She sells her goods in Kabala town in Sierra Leone.

Before receiving the loans, Mariama used to purchase 2 to 5 bags of peanuts. But with the loans, she can purchase 30 bags of peanuts at a time, and sell them wholesale. Her customer base has also increased so much that Mariama is requesting a loan of $1200 to meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: Purchase more peanuts to keep up with the growing number of customers

loans.name: Silvestre

texts.es:
Silvestre is 55 years old and married. His wife has been working in Spain for more than 5 years. His two children, aged 13 and 15 years, stayed in Paraguay with him. They currently help him in the business.

Silvestre owns a sales stand in the commericial zone of the city of Encarnación; he has worked in his field for 27 years. The products he sells include handsaws, radios, telephones, calculators, sunglasses, tweezers, etc. The earnings generated in his business over the years were invested in the construction of his home and the family's household expenses.

Silvestre is requesting a loan with which to purchase inventory such as: keys, reading glasses, CD totes, screwdrivers and other products. He will also take advantage of the summer and Carnival season by buying seasonal items such as sunglasses and "lanza nieves" used by Carnival revelers to throw foam at their fellow revelers, among other products.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Silvestre tiene 55 años, está casado, su esposa se encuentra trabajando en España ya hace más de 5 años. Sus dos hijos se quedaron con él, quienes actualmente ayudan en el negocio, uno tiene 13 años y el otro de 15 años.

El mismo es propietario de un puesto de venta en la zona comercial de la Ciudad Encarnación, con una antigüedad de 27 años en el rubro. Entre los productos que vende podemos citar: serruchos, radios, teléfonos, calculadoras, antojos de sol, pinzas, etc. Los ingresos provenientes de su negocio fueron invertidos en la construcción de su casa propia y los gastos de la unidad familiar.

Esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de mercaderías como ser: llaves, lentes, cds, porta cds, destornilladores y otros, además aprovechar la época veraniega y carnaval, por la que desea comprar artículos de la temporada tanto anteojos de sol, lanza nieves entre otras cosas.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise: sun glasses, handsaws, keys, drills, calculators, knives.

loans.name: Finnah

texts.en:
Finnah S. started her innovative business in Kabala town of Sierra Leone. She is the only one running a business of selling locally made saucepans in the township. There is high demand for the saucepans because of their durability.

With previous loans, she increased her inventory and profit. As Finnah capitalizes on the saucepan market in the community, she would like to increase her inventory and, therefore, is requesting a loan of about $225.

loans.use: Purchase more saucepans to meet the growing demand in the community for her unique business

loans.name: Umu

texts.en:
Umu started her business by hawking a few cosmetics from door to door. She started the business soon after the civil war in Sierra Leone ended. After several loans from SMT, she managed to establish her business and rented a shop in Kabala town in Sierra Leone. Umu sells basic medicines and mainly cosmetics.

Umu is 28 years old and married with 2 children. With the profit from her business, she is able to take care of her two children and help her brothers and sisters meet some of their school expenses.

Uma has good business skills and would like to expand her pharmacy with all the necessary items. She is requesting a loan of $1200.

loans.use: Increase the stock in her pharmacy to include all the necessary medications

loans.name: Koudossou

texts.fr:
Born on February 21, 1978 in Lomé, Monsieur Koudossou F. is a sewing machine repairer. Single, with no children, he currently lives and works in the Gbényedji neighborhood of Lomé. Unfortunately, he has come up against financial difficulties preventing him from buying the tools he needs to practice his trade. He is therefore requesting a $400 loan to allow him to buy some pliers and other work tools. Monsieur F. is a very dynamic young man who deserves support.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Né le 21 Février 1978 à Lomé, Monsieur Koudossou F. est reparateur machine à coudre de formation. Célibataire sans enfants, il vit actuellement à Lomé au quartier Gbényedji où il exerce son métier. Malheureusement, il est confronté aux problèmes de moyens financiers pour acquérir les outils nécessaires à l’exercice de son métier. Pour ce faire, il sollicite un financement de $400 pour lui permettre de s’acheter quelques pinces et outils de travail. C’est un jeune homme très dynamique qui mérite d’être soutenu.

loans.use: To purchase work tools

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is 32 years old and married with 3 children. She sells food items in the market of Kabala town in Sierra Leone. Although the business has helped Asma generate income for the family, she could not save for expansion and for emergencies because the business is too small to generate sufficient income.

Asma would like to expand and diversify the business. She is requesting a loan of $525.

loans.use: Diversify her business by adding more items to sell

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu S. is a mother of 3 children and sells clothes, especially for women, in the town of Kabala in Sierra Leone. She used to sell used clothes by hawking.

With the help of previous loans, she established her business in the town market. She is able to rent a space for the business, and changed the business to selling fabrics, along with the clothes. Isatu is requesting a loan of $525 to expand her business.

loans.use: Bolster her new business selling fabrics, along with clothing

loans.name: Abu

texts.en:
Abu Samura is married with one child. He is 28 years old and owns a shop in Kabala town of Sierra Leone. He sells basic groceries, such as rice, sugar, and cooking oil, wholesale. Abu’s business is now steady and established, and it increased as a result of previous loans.

An ambitious man, Abu would like to run a big business in town, so he can provide more for his family. But he cannot afford the loans from the formal financial system. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of $1200 to expand his business.

loans.use: Abu would like to further diversify and expand his grocery business so that he can provide better for his family.

loans.name: Gladys Ernestina

texts.es:
Food and drink sales are very common in the city of León, especially in markets such as la Terminal. Cognizant of this, Mrs. Gladys Ernestina A. has been working in this business for 20 years in order to both cover the household expenses and pay for her children’s education.

She started her business with a capital of $200.00 USD. She has been working with Ceprodel, obtaining loans that have greatly benefited her business, causing her sales to increase by acquiring greater amounts of products to prepare her dishes and make her delicious drinks that only she can prepare.

She has obtained 18 loans from Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La venta de comida y refrescos es un negocio muy común en la ciudad de León específicamente en los mercados como la Terminal. Consiente de esto, la señora Gladys Ernestina A. se dedica desde hace 20 años a este negocio para apoyar a sus hijos en las necesidades del hogar y el pago de los estudios

Inició su negocio con un capital de U$ 200 y desde hace tres años ha trabajado con Ceprodel obteniendo créditos que han beneficiado grandemente su negocio por lo que ha aumentado sus ganancias y adquirido mayores volúmenes de materia prima para elaborar los alimentos y de igual manera para elaborar sus deliciosos refrescos que solo ella sabe preparar.

Su record crediticio actual es de 18 créditos con Ceprodel

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients to prepare food and drinks

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is married with 4 children. Before the loan, Mr. K. was an apprentice in a welding shop for 8 years. With the help of his family, and the previous loans, Musa established his own workshop in Kabala town of Sierra Leone. He recently invested the income to buy a new generator.

Musa is now requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase materials for making steel doors, windows, and other items.

loans.use: Musa is putting all his years of apprenticeship into practice and needs a loan to help develop his own welding business.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
Aged 27, Madame Yawa K. is married and mother of two children. She runs a very profitable business selling dried chillis. The income from her business goes towards her household expenses. To increase the profit from her business, Madame K. is asking for a loan of $250 to build up a substantial stock of chillis, which can be resold during times of shortage. This will allow her to increase her revenue and better provide for her family’s needs.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Agée de 27 ans, Madame K. Yawa est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. Elle exerce comme activité la vente du piment séché qui est très rentable. Les revenus de son commerce lui permettent de contribuer aux charges du foyer. Pour mieux rentabiliser son activité, Madame K. sollicite un financement de $250 pour faire un stock consistant de piment et revendre en période de pénurie. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To stock up on chillis

loans.name: Sassré

texts.fr:
Born in 1965 in Bassar in the north-west of Togo, Monsieur Sassré Binaou is single with one child. He works as a welder. He is currently based in the Tokoin-Wuiti neighborhood of Lomé. Unfortunately he cannot practice his trade to its full potential as he does not have enough suitable tools. To overcome this shortage, Monsieur Binaou is asking for a loan of $800. He is a very dedicated craftsman who is passionately fighting his way out of poverty.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Né en 1965 à Bassar dans le nord-ouest du Togo, Monsieur Sassré BINAOU est célibataire avec un (01) enfant et exerce comme activité le métier de soudeur. Il est actuellement basé à Lomé au quartier Tokoin-Wuiti. Malheureusement il n’arrive pas à exercer pleinement ses activités parce qu’il ne dispose pas suffisamment d’outils appropriés. Pour palier à cette insuffisance, il sollicite un financement de $800. C’est un artisan très dévoué qui se bat ardemment pour sortir de la pauvreté.

loans.use: To purchase work tools

loans.name: Déla

texts.fr:
Madame Déla A. was born in Lomé on May 25, 1984. Married and without children, she is a hairdresser by training – a profession that she learned having left school at a young age. She is currently trying to help her husband cover their household expenses. However, her business prevents her from doing this because she does not have a studio suitable for her work, resulting in customer disloyalty. She is therefore requesting a $400 loan in order to rent a studio and buy the necessary equipment for hairdressing.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Madame Déla A. est née à Lomé le 25 mai 1984. Mariée et sans enfant, elle est coiffeuse de formation, un métier qu’elle a appris après avoir quitté les bancs très tôt. Elle s’emploie aujourd’hui à aider son mari pour faire face aux charges familiales, mais son activité ne lui permet pas de le faire. La cause est qu’elle ne dispose pas d’un atelier approprié pour son travail obligeant ses clientes à la désertion. Elle demande donc un financement de $400 pour loyer un atelier et s’acheter les matériels et nécessaires de coiffure.

loans.use: To purchase hairdressing equipment

loans.name: Kawsara Group

texts.fr:
Our project consists in the resale of market gardening produce and fruits, depending on the season. We would like to be the suppliers in the markets of the town of Dakar, because it is difficult to get a supply at a good price. We believe we can guaranty a regular supply of produce to our clients if we can obtain a loan from Kiva through its partner SEM. This financing will allow us to create employment for the young people of our ecovillage and insure a continual supply of market gardening produce, which sell very well in our local market. This loan will also allow us to resolve our financial problems by enabling us to cope with our household responsibilities.
Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Notre projet consiste à la revente de produits maraîchers et de fruits selon la saison. Nous voulons être des fournisseurs dans les marchés de la ville de Dakar, car il est difficile de se ravitailler à bon prix et nous pensons pouvoir garantir un ravitaillement régulier des produits à nos clients si nous arrivons à obtenir un ptêt de Kiva à travers son partenaire SEM. Ce financement nous permettra de créer des emplois pour les jeunes de notre écovillage et assurer une fourniture continue de produits maraîchers qui sont très bien consommés dans le marché local. Ce prêt nous permettra aussi de résoudre nos, problèmes d'ordre pécunière en faisant face à nos obligations domestiques.

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables , site outfitting, transportation and various costs

loans.name: Agossou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Agossou A. was born in 1955. He is married and has nine children. He earns his living selling sheep and it is thanks to the income from this business that he is able to support his family. He takes the sheep on credit from the breeders, and after selling them he pays off his debts. However, this is very expensive and thus deprives him of a larger profit margin. To increase his income, Monsieur A. is asking for a $300 loan to purchase more sheep and satisfy market demand.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur A. Agossou est né en 1955, marié et père de neuf (9) enfants. Il exercer comme activité la vente des moutons. Et c’est grâce à ces revenus qu’il arrive à subvenir aux charges de sa famille. Il prend les moutons à crédit chez les éleveurs et après vente il paie ses dettes. Ce qui le prive d’une grande marge bénéficiaire car cela lui revient très cher. Pour améliorer ses revenus, il sollicite un financement de $300 pour faire plus d’achat et satisfaire la demande du marché.

loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: Darling Del Socorro

texts.es:
Mrs. Darling L., mother of two school age daughters, started her beverage business with a little wooden table in the la Terminal market of León 3 years ago.

Her greatest efforts to get ahead have caused her business to excel. Early in the morning, she heads out to her business space in the bus station on the outskirts of the market and starts her sales.

Today, her business has improved because she has acquired a small refrigerator in which to put her products. She has also replaced her old table for a better one. All these improvements are due in part to the support she has received from Ceprodel, which has given her 18 loans to date. With these loans, she has been able to purchase her products and at the same time cover her modest household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Con una mesita de madera hace 3 años en el mercado la Terminal de León inició su negocio de venta de agua, gaseosas y jugos la señora Darling L. quien es madre de dos pequeñas niñas en la edad escolar.

Sus grandes esfuerzos por salir adelante la han llevado a sobresalir en su negocio, desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana, ella se prepara para comenzar las ventas del día yendo hacia su local en las afueras del mercado la Terminal específicamente en la estación de buses.

Hoy en día, ha mejorado la situación de su negocio debido a que ha adquirido una pequeña refrigeradora donde colocar sus productos, además ha cambiado su antigua mesa y ha colocado una en mejores condiciones donde poner sus productos. Todo este desarrollo de su negocio se debe en parte al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel que le ha otorgado un total de 18 créditos hasta el momento con los cuales ha podido adquirir sus productos y a la vez llevar el sustento a su humilde hogar de habitación.

loans.use: Purchase of water, soft drinks, and juice

loans.name: Fayiza

texts.fr:
Married and the mother of three children, Mrs. Fayiza A. lives in Tékponou (in the Vo prefecture). Aged 25, she runs a small business buying and selling smoked, dried and other types of small fish. A lack of funds means she is often unable to meet the needs of her customers. She is requesting funding of $200 to create a permanent stock in order to avoid shortages and establish customer loyalty. This will increase her profit margin so she can better support the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants, Madame A. Fayiza vie à Tékponou (P/Vo). Agée de 25 ans, elle exerce son petit commerce de petits poissons fumés, séchés et divers. Le manque de moyens financiers lui impose souvent l’incapacité de satisfaire sa clientèle. Elle sollicite un financement de $200 pour faire un stock permanent afin d’éviter les ruptures de stock et de fidéliser sa clientèle. Ceci augmentera sa marge bénéficiaire en vue de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy and sell smoked fish

loans.name: Akefeimbou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Akefeimbou K. was born in Kara, northern Togo, on April 14, 1984. Single with no children, she quickly became involved in business after abandoning her studies. With her meager means, she opened a small general store in which she sells a bit of everything. Unfortunately she is unable to meet all the needs of her customers as she lacks the funds to buy a sufficient stock of merchandise. For this reason she is requesting a loan of $600 to establish a good supply of merchandise.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Akefeimbou K. est née à Kara au nord du Togo le 14 Avril 1984. Célibataire sans enfant, elle s’est vite lancée dans le commerce après avoir délaissé ses études. Avec ses moyens dérisoires, elle a ouvert une petite boutique d’alimentation générale dans lequel elle vend un peu de tout. Malheureusement elle n’arrive pas à couvrir tous les besoins de sa clientèle faute de moyens financiers pour constituer un stock suffisant de marchandises. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite un prêt de $600 pour constituer un important stock de marchandises

loans.use: Merchandise supplies

loans.name: Adiatu

texts.en:
Adiatu S. is 32 years old and married with 3 children. She has been doing well because of her good business background. Adiatu sells various groceries and household goods.

With previous loans, Adiatu was able to diversify her business and increased her income. Her business is the only source of income for the family. Adiatu’s husband is unemployed and he assists her in the shop. To increase her inventory of goods, Adiatu is requesting a loan of $700.

loans.use: Adiatu would like to increase the inventory in her store so that her husband can work with her to help generate a larger profit.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Maria Mercedes G. is a single mother with two children under her care. She is an energetic person who has been selling shoes and apparel for 8 years in the la Terminal market of the city of León.

Her greatest wish is to improve her family's living conditions. Even though she is a single mother, she finds no reason to complain; moreover, her situation serves as proof that she is a hardworking woman who struggles to give her children the best.

Ceprodel has given her a lot of support with 7 loans that have strengthened her business and improved her home, since she has purchased larger amounts of products, thus obtaining greater profits from her shoe and apparel sales.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Mercedes G. es madre soltera y con dos hijos a su cargo. Es muy esforzada ya que se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos que tiene desde hace 8 años en el mercado la Terminal en la bella ciudad de León. Inició con un total de C$ 2000 productos de sus ahorros realizados a lo largo de su vida en la ciudad de León.

Su mayor anhelo es mejorar sus condiciones de vida y el de sus dos hijos ya que a pesar de ser madre soltera no encuentra razón de porque quejarse sino mas bien le sirve para demostrar que es una mujer muy esforzada que lucha para darle lo mejor a sus hijos.

Ceprodel le ha brindado mucho apoyo con la entrega de créditos (7 créditos) que le han fortalecido su negocio y han mejorado la situación de su vivienda ya que ha obtenido mejores utilidades en la venta de los calzados y la ropa adquiriendo mayores volúmenes de productos para comercializarlos.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise from her suppliers

loans.name: Aslima

texts.es:
Mrs. Aslima T. has worked since 1999 selling prepared foods in the market of Leon Station. She prepares her food products and later distributes them in different locations in the market. She also delivers her products to some clients, while others arrive at her sales stall to buy the products as "take-away".

Aslima is a single mother supporting three adolescent children. She is the sole provider in the family. From time to time, she decides to apply for a loan from Ceprodel. Not only has Ceprodel never rejected her loan applications, but they have provided her with the capital to buy her raw materials and cover her household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Aslima T. se dedica desde el año 1999 a la actividad de venta de comida en el mercado la Estación de León. Su actividad consiste en elaborar los alimentos y luego distribuirlos en diferentes puntos del mercado hasta entregarlo a sus clientes. De igual manera, otros clientes llegan hacia su puesto y compran los alimentos para llevarlos.

Es madre soltera y con tres hijos adolescentes a los que tiene que apoyar por ser el único sustento de su hogar. En el transcurso del tiempo decide solicitar créditos en CEPRODEL, los que no le han sido negados sino que le han sido otorgados para la compra de su materia prima para la elaboración de sus alimentos, de igual manera los ha utilizado para la manutención de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for the food products

loans.name: Houndjénoko

texts.fr:
Aged 41, Mrs. Houdejénoko A. is married and has five children. Her main activity is sheep rearing and sometimes agriculture. She rears sheep according to traditional methods and has to take the sheep to pasture every day, which is laborious and not very profitable. She is requesting a loan of $300 to build an enclosure for the animals and buy feed on a regular basis. This would increase her profit.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 41 ans, Madame A. Houndjénoko est mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants. Sa principale activité demeure l’élevage de moutons et quelque fois l’agriculture. Son élevage est pratiqué de façon traditionnelle et elle doit amener les moutons au pâturage tous les jours ce qui rend l’activité pénible mais avec un rendement faible. Elle sollicite un apport financier de $300 pour construire un enclos aux bêtes et acheter régulièrement leurs nourritures. Ceci pour améliorer son rendement.

loans.use: To build an enclosure and buy feed for livestock

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex K. is 42 years old, and is married with 3 children. He started his business selling essential medicines 5 years ago on a very small scale by hawking from house to house, and also visiting his customers. With the loans, Alex opened a pharmacy in Makeni Town in Sierra Leone.

Although Alex's business is growing, he lacks the capital to purchase a variety of medicine. So he is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase more medications.

loans.use: Purchase more of the essential medications needed for his pharmacy.

loans.name: Iyebah

texts.en:
Iyebah T. lives on the outskirts of Makeni town in Sierra Leone. Iyebah inherited the business selling palm oil from her mother, who died two years ago when Iyebah was only 20 years old. Young as she is, she is now taking care of her younger brother's education and other family expenses.

Iyebah would like to expand the business, so she is requesting a loan of $225 to purchase 60 gallons of palm oil.

loans.use: Purchase more palm oil to sell to earn more to support her younger brother.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: Kadiatu C. is 39 years old and married with two children. She sells beer, soft drinks and some snacks.  Kadiatu raised her capital from selling palm oil on a small scale for the past 10 years.  With loans from SMT and income from the palm oil business, she established a bar and restaurant in the town of Makeni.  She has more customers and the income is supporting family expenses.  She plans to expand her business and meet her customers demand.  A Le.2, 000,000 loan will improve her business income.

loans.use: Kadiatu is expanding her business in an effort to meet her customer's demand for cold drinks and snacks.

loans.name: Dina Victoria's Group

texts.en:
Flor Maria, Dina, and Lucia have been members of the community bank “Musuq Wasi” for between one and two years. From their participation in bank activities, they have learned how to be responsible, punctual, and treat their children. They feel like their bank is a part of their family.

Flor Maria is 36 years old and has an 8 year old son. She has been selling guinea pigs, which are considered a delicacy, for five years. She used to sell vegetables but their price has fallen recently.

Dina is 27 and has one child. She owns land where she raises vegetables and guinea pigs. She has owned her land for one year.
