Lucia is 57 years old and has five children. Likewise, she sells vegetables and guinea pigs. She has been in this business all of her life.

Flor Maria, Dina, and Lucia need loans of 900, 600, and 300 soles ( 3 soles = $1) respectively to invest in food for their guinea pigs and seeds. The community bank emphasizes saving and each associate has an interest earning account. These three women plan to use their savings for their children’s education, medical bills, and any other emergencies that can arise. Their dream is to have successful businesses and that their children can continue moving up in the world.

loans.use: Flor Maria, Dina, and Lucia will invest in food for their guinea pigs and seeds.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: Kadiatu C. is married with 7 children.  She has been selling palm oil for five years and the income goes mainly to meeting the family’s expenses.  Her husband has irregular income and could not cope with up keep.  “To feed 7 children and provide them with education is not an easy thing to do,” said Kadiatu.  She needs to work hard to make ends meet.  She is therefore requesting a loan of Le.1, 000,000.

loans.use: Kadiatu needs to increase her stock of palm oil so that she can generate additional income to help her care for her children.

loans.name: Adjakpassi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Adjakpassi A. is 36 years old, married and the mother of four children. The cola bean business is her main activity. She is very conscientious and travels great distances to find cola beans, which are very expensive these days. However, this activity is only profitable if stock is good. To this end she is requesting funding of $300 to obtain a consistent stock of cola beans to meet market demand. This will enable her to improve her income and better support the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Adjakpassi est âgée de 36 ans, est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. Le commerce de cola reste son activité principale. Très dévouée, elle parcourt de très grandes distances pour trouver de la cola qui est aujourd’hui très chère. Mais cette activité n’est rentable que si le stock est important. Pour cela elle sollicite un financement de $300 pour faire un stock consistant de cola et satisfaire la demande du marché. Ceci lui permettra d’améliore son revenu et de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy and sell cola beans

loans.name: Justina De La Concep

texts.es:
Justina de la Concepción R. is the owner of a store in the Leon-Chinandega bus station in Leon. For 25 years she has worked as a merchant in this market, a market frequently visited by the people of Leon.

One of the challenges facing Mrs. R. is the need to invest in the infrastructure of her business; other vendors close to her in the market sell the same products but from sales stalls in better condition. To a certain point this is a problematic situation for Mrs. R., since the market's clients choose the vendors with better sales stalls.

Mrs. R. also needs to invest in the purchase of carbonated drinks, juices and water. In order to restock her inventory of these products she has turned to Ceprodel, an organization that has never denied her requests. In fact, Ceprodel has provided her with the loans she has invested in the purchase of her products and in savings to be used to remodel her home. Her credit history is 8 loans during the last year and a half.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Justina de la Concepción R. es una dama poseedora de un local propio en la estación de buses ínter locales León-Chinandega en León. Desde hace 25 años se dedica a la venta de gaseosas, jugos y agua helada en las cercanías al mercado la Terminal en León y por tal motivo, se ha venido desempeñando como comerciante en este mercado muy visitado por pobladores de la ciudad de León.

Una necesidad que atraviesa la señora R. es que necesita invertir en la infraestructura de su negocio por lo que hay otros tramos cerca de su local el cual venden los mismos productos pero el local está en mejores condiciones; hasta cierto punto esta es una situación problemita para la señora R. porque los clientes seleccionan los lugares que en mejores condiciones se encuentran.

Otra necesidad de la señora R. es que debe invertir en la compra de las gaseosas, jugos y agua. Para suplir todas estas necesidades ha recurrido a Ceprodel quien no le ha negado su petición sino que le ha otorgado créditos que los ha sabido invertir en la compra de sus productos y ahorro para la remodelación de su hogar. Su record crediticio es de 8 créditos desde hace un año y medio.

loans.use: Purchase of carbonated drinks, water and juices

loans.name: Ana Maria's Group

texts.en:
Ambrosia and Ana Maria are members of the community bank “Señor de Huarca”. They have been members for eight months and two years respectively. In that time they have learned to save and to be punctual.

Ambrosia is 43 years old and has three children. She has owned a bakery for the past four years. She gets up early in the morning and makes “chapla,” a traditional bread, as well as other types of bread. She must travel to different markets to buy grain but prefers not to travel too much.

Ana Maria is 23 years old and has three children. She is also a baker and has owned her bakery for two years. Before that she sold grains and operated a small farm. However, her farm was not producing enough.

Ambrosia and Ana Maria need loans of 600 and 1600 soles (3 soles = $1) respectively, which they will invest in buying flour, butter, yeast, and other things needed to make bread. The community bank emphasizes the importance of saving and each associate has an interest earning account. Ambrosia and Ana Maria are saving so that they have greater freedom and do not have to worry about unexpected expenses. Their dreams are to continue their progress, develop their businesses, and move out of poverty.

loans.use: The group will invest in buying flour, butter, yeast, and other things needed to make bread.

loans.name: Ablossi

texts.fr:
Born in 1950, Mrs. Ablossi D. is married and has five children. From a young age she has devoted herself to traditional medicine. Now that she no longer has the energy to work in the fields, she is concentrating on the sale of medicinal roots, which is proving very successful for her. To increase the size of her business, she is requesting funding of $250 to obtain a large supply of medicinal roots to better satisfy customer demand.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1950, Madame D. Ablossi est mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants. Depuis son jeune âge, elle s’est donnée à la médecine traditionnelle. N’ayant plus l’énergie nécessaire pour affronter les activités champêtres, elle se consacre totalement à la vente des racines médicinales qui lui réussi très bien. Pour agrandir la taille de son commerce, elle sollicite un financement de $250 pour s’approvisionner en grande quantité des racines médicinales et mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.

loans.use: To buy and sell medicinal roots

loans.name: Vincente

texts.en:
Vicente A. is a father of three children, the youngest whom he still cares for at home. His two oldest children have married and live with their families outside of the house. After years of hard work, Vicente was able to buy his own house, the same house in which he raised his three children. Over time, he also bought his own truck which he now uses as a transportation service, working with items like seed, crops, and other large articles. He makes a good living from his service and advertises his service to various farms and neighborhoods. Vicente has since gained a good reputation among the people in the area.

In order to continue running smoothly and efficiently, he needs to buy new parts and additions for his truck. These improvements will allow him to transport more goods at a time and in a shorter amount of time and gain more clientele.

loans.use: To buy car parts.

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr:
Aged 35, Mrs. Adjovi T. is the mother of four children and lives in the village of Atsansi-Djita (in the Vo prefecture). She is very dynamic and has been in the corn business for more than 15 years. However, her lack of funds means that she is unable to grow the business and meet the expectations of her customers. In order to increase the size of her business, she is requesting funding of $250 to set up a consistent supply of corn and thus avoid stock shortages.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 35 ans, Madame T. Adjovi est mère de quatre (4) enfants et vit dans le village d’Atsansi-Djita (P/Vo). Très dynamique, elle exerce le commerce de maïs depuis une quinzaine d’années. Mais le manque de financement fait qu’elle n’arrive pas à rendre florissante son activité et satisfaire les attente de sa clientèle. Pour agrandir la taille de son commerce, elle sollicite un financement de $250 pour faire un stock consistant de maïs afin d’être à l’abri de toute rupture de stock.

loans.use: Corn supplies

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor S., a forty six year old father with three daughters, lives with his wife in their own house near the city of Encarnación. All three daughters are currently in school. Victor owns a small bread bakery that is located in their house. From there he sells his goods, and also transports them to the houses around the city. While he is in charge of the baking of all the goods, his wife and oldest daughter are in charge of the sales in the store and throughout the different neighborhoods in the city.

They are a united family in the business and both children and parents have worked very hard to keep the business popular. The earnings form their business are the sole means of paying for daily expenses and sending their children to school. The work has paid off and their bakery has gained a great reputation in the city.

The loan that Victor is asking for the is to help him purchase the ingredients for a popular Paraguayan desert, sweet Christmas bread. He buys the ingredients from Argentina. This bread along with many other goods are requested by not only his customers, but to supermarkets as well.

loans.use: To buy the materials to make Christmas Sweet Bread.

loans.name: Roger Napoleón

texts.es:
Since he was very small, Roger Napoleón H. has distinguished himself as a young person very dedicated to his work. From the time he was very young he worked for a distributor in the city of Leon transporting products from one location to another for a salary too low to support his wife and two young children (a boy and a girl).

Looking to improve his situation and his family's quality of life, Roger invested 1200 cordobas (Nicaraguan currency) in the purchase of compact discs of music and movies. His current difficulty is that having started this business, he lacks a location where he can sell his products. As a result he sells outdoors, exposing his products to sun and rain. He has applied for permission to locate his business in a stall in the Terminal market, and has taken the initiative to request loans from Ceprodel with which to buy the materials for the construction of his sales stall and more inventory. His credit history is 4 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

El joven Roger Napoleón H. desde muy pequeño se ha caracterizado por ser un joven muy dedicado al trabajo. Desde muy joven se dedicó a trabajar en una distribuidora de la ciudad de León, cargando los productos de un lugar a otro y recibiendo bajos salarios para poder mantener a su esposa y dos pequeños hijos (un niño y una niña).

En busca de mejorar su condición de vida y la de los suyos realiza una inversión de C$ 1,200 (Mil Doscientos Córdobas) para la adquisición de discos compactos de música y películas (DVD). Su problemática es que al haber iniciado este negocio, no cuenta con un local propio por lo que vende a la intemperie exponiendo sus productos al sol y a la lluvia en tiempos de invierno. Ha solicitado un permiso para que se le otorgue un local en el mercado la Terminal y muy esforzadamente ha solicitado créditos en Ceprodel para adquirir materiales para la construcción de su local y además para adquirir sus productos. Su record crediticio es de 4 créditos.

loans.use: Purchase of CDs

loans.name: Paula Emelina

texts.es:
Drinking straws, cups, spoons, plates and bags: these are the disposable products that Paula Emilia S. has been marketing for 18 years in her own business in the Terminal market in Leon.

As well as selling plastic products, Paula sells carbonated beverages in the same store, but in smaller quantities. She started her business with an initial investment of 1000 cordobas (Nicaraguan currency) from her savings. Before starting the business she was a housewife.

Despite having gone through difficult situations worrying about a drop in sales in her business, she has decided to turn to Ceprodel, an organization that has brought her considerable benefits, by providing loans she uses to improve her business and to acquire products. Her credit record is 8 loans.

Translated by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Pajillas, vasos, cucharas, platos y bolsas todos estos productos descartables son los que desde hace 18 años son comercializados por la señora Paula Emilia S. en un local propio en el mercado la Terminal de León.

Ademas de vender estos productos, en el mismo local se dedica a la venta de gaseosas pero en menores cantidades. Este negocio lo inició con un capital inicial de Un mil córdobas que los obtuvo por medio de sus ahorros que logro obtener antes de tener el negocio donde se desempeñaba como ama de casa.

A pesar de pasar por situaciones complicadas ya que ha temido muchas bajas en sus ventas decide recurrir a Ceprodel que le ha beneficiado muy considerablemente con la entrega de créditos para el mejoramiento de su negocio y la adquisición de sus productos. Su record crediticio es de 8 créditos.

loans.use: Purchase of plastic products

loans.name: Veronica Asunción

texts.es:
Doña Verónica is 38 years old and was born in Managua on August 16th, 1970. Her husband is 47 years old and works as a welder in a workshop located at their home. Verónica sells food and her main clients are students from a middle school, located only 15 meters from her house.

She inherited the house from her mother and there she has raised her 5 children, three boys, 14, 10, and 8 years old, and two girls, 7 and 4 years old. This humble family requests a loan to add and extra room to their house and this way get a worthier home.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

. DoñaVerónica tiene 38 años de edad, nació en Managua el 16 de Agosto de 1970, su marido tiene 47 años de edad y se desempeña como soldador de un taller ubicado en su hogar. Verónica vende comida y sus principales clientes son estudiantes de un colegio de secundaria que se ubica a 15 metros de su casa de habitación.

Su casa la heredó de su madre y en ella han crecido sus 5 hijos tres varones de 14, 10 y 8 años y dos niñas de 7 y 4 años de edad. Esta humilde familia solicita el crédito para construir un cuarto de habitación y optar a una vivienda más digna.

loans.use: Start building an extra room to enlarge home.

loans.name: Berna Luz

texts.es:
Berna Luz was born in the city of Managua on March 10th, 1973. She is married and has 3 children, 2 boys and a girl. Doña Berna and her husband, with more than 14 years of experience, own a small hardware store where they also sell building materials.

Presently it is the family goal to finish building their own house and the loan requested will be used to add an extra room and thus have a more comfortable and fit home.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Berna Luz nació en la ciudad de Managua, el 10 de Marzo de 1973. Es casada y tiene 3 hijos, 2 varones y una mujer. Berna y su marido tienen un pequeño negocio donde comercializan productos de construcción y ferretería, tienen más de 14 años de experiencia en el negocio.

Actualmente esta familia se ha propuesto terminar de construir su casa de habitación, es por eso que solicitan el préstamo para construir un cuarto de habitación y poder tener mayor comodidad y una vivienda más digna.

loans.use: Build an extra room for more comfortable living.

loans.name: Raynaldo

texts.es:
Don Reynaldo A. and his wife have 3 children, 7, 13, and 15 years old. 4 years ago don Reynaldo and his wife opened a small neighborhood store and throughout the four years they have gained experience in proper management and therefore the business has grown as well as the variety of stock.

The store generates little income for the family and therefore they wish to invest in merchandise in order to increase sales. With the loan don Reynaldo plans to buy basic grains, soft drinks and candy to offer more variety to the customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Don Reynaldo A. y su esposa tienen 3 hijos de 7, 13 15 años. Don Reynaldo desde hace 4 años tiene una pequeña pulpería que él mismo administra con la ayuda de su esposa. En estos cuatro años ha adquirido experiencia en el manejo de este negocio y es por eso que lo ha ido sacando adelante y ha ido creciendo en artículos que ofrecer.

La pulpería genera pocos ingresos a la familia es por eso que desean invertir más en ella para poderla extender su negocio. Con el préstamo Reynaldo quiere comprar Granos Básicos, gaseosas y golosinas para poder seguir diversificando el negocio.

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, soft drinks, and candy in order to increase sales.

loans.name: “Jetypeka” Group

texts.es:
The “Jetypeka” group was formed 6 months ago. A majority of the original members of the group will continue working with the group into its next phase. The group has accumulatively saved 714,527 Paraguayan Guaranis (Est. $150 USD). Hard work and dedication help form the foundation of this group of enterprising women.

The women who form this group dedicate themselves to a diverse array of productive activities. The loan will be used as capital to assist them in purchasing additional merchandise in some instances or ingredients for those who dedicate themselves to the sale of edible goods.

Among the professions they practice we find: cosmetic sales (lotions, makeup, perfumes), clothing sales, fast food sales, sales of “chipas” (chipas: traditional Paraguayan breads; small balls of cheese bread made from tapioca starch), operating neighborhood markets and women who wash clothes.

These women desire a better future for their children. Because of this, they exert double the effort to earn sufficient income to permit them to pay for the education of their children.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva volunteer.

El comité “Jetypeka” tiene 6 meses de formación mantiene a la mayoría de las primeras integrantes aun trabajando con el grupo, pasan al 2º ciclo con capacitación realizada y un ahorro acumulado de Gs.714.527; su trabajo y dedicación son las bases mas fuertes de este grupo de mujeres emprendedoras.

Las señoras que componen este grupo se dedican a diversas actividades productivas, ellas utilizan el préstamo como capital operativo comprando mas mercaderías en algunos casos o insumos para la elaboración de productos en el caso de las señoras que se dedican a la venta de comestibles.

Entre las actividades que realizan podemos citar: venta de cosméticos (cremas, maquillajes, colonias), venta de ropas, venta de comidas rápidas, venta de chipas (comida típica paraguaya,), despensa, lavanderas (lavan ropas).

Estas mujeres anhelan un futuro mejor para sus hijos, por eso se esfuerzan el doble para generar suficiente ingresos que les permita pagar los estudios de sus hijos.

loans.use:
Purchase of fruits, vegetables, clothing, cosmetics, cheese, meats, canned goods and a washer

Compra de frutas, verduras, ropas, cosmeticos, queso, carne, productos enlatados y un lavarropas.

loans.name: Gregoria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Gregoria lives in the district of Laureles Norte in Managua. She is married and has 4 children, two are of age and independent and she is only in charge of her two younger children. Her husband is a street vendor of second-hand garments. Because of the high living costs, doña Gregoria decided to find ways to help her family get ahead and therefore started to sell food from her home, but she also sells clothing, shoes, homemade “cajeta” (caramel), and “buñuelos” (fritters).

She needs the loan to buy products such as meat and vegetables for the production of “nacatamales” and soups. Doña Gregoria is a 48 year-old lady who wishes the best for her children and she is also striving to improve their life standards.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Gregoria habita en el barrio Laureles Norte de Managua. Es casada y tiene 4 hijos, dos de los cuales ya son mayores de edad y viven independientes a ella, sólo tiene a su cargo a dos hijos menores de edad. El esposo de doña Gregoria se dedica a la venta de ropa usada ambulante.Debido a los altos costos de la vida Gregoria decidió buscar la forma de poder sacar a su familia adelante es por eso que decidió empezar a vender comida en su casa, pero también se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, cajetas y buñuelos que ella misma elabora.

Necesita el crédito para comprar productos para su negocio como lo son carnes, verduras para elaborar los nacatamales y las sopas. Gregoria es una mujer de 48 años que desea lo mejor para sus hijos, y siempre está buscando la forma de darles una mejor vida.

loans.use: Purchase raw material for the production of "nacatamales" and soups.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca T. S., 45,  is married and has 3 children. Rebecca sells peppers and has been running this business for the last 15 years.  According to Rebecca, she used to sell the peppers retail in the town of Makeni in Sierra Leone. With the loans she received from SMT, Rebecca increased her stock and began selling wholesale. She has no problem meeting her children’s school expenses. Rebecca is happy and would like to expand the business.  She proudly said, “With a loan of Le. 2,000,000 ($700) I will be better off in the future because I will make a good and fast profit."

loans.use: To buy peppers to sell wholesale

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en: Rugiatu K. is married and has 3 children.  She sells building materials in the town of Makeni in Sierra Leone.  Before her previous loans, Rugiatu used to sell her wares in the open  market. The loans made it possible for her to rent a shop, and the business has grown as a result. She has also increased her stock, and with the profits she is able to meet family expenses.  Rugiatu intends to diversify her business by expanding the range of inventory, and she is requesting a loan of Le.1,500,000 ($525) for this purpose.

loans.use: To diversify the stock in her hardware store

loans.name: Brema

texts.en: Mr. S. is married with 3 children.  He sells plastic sandals in the town of Magburaka in Sierra Leone.  His business improved after his first loan from SMT.  S. would like to diversify his business and is requesting a loan of Le.500,000 ($175) for this purpose.

loans.use: To diversify his stock of plastic sandals.

loans.name: Iye

texts.en: Twenty-three-year-old Iye G. is married and has 2 children.  She sells children’s clothing and plastic sandals.  She diversified her business with previous loans from SMT.  Iye said that the profit she made helped her solve her household's financial problems.  She would like to continue getting loans from SMT to expand her business, and is asking for a loan of   Le.500,000 ($175) for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy children's clothes and sandals for resale

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa K. is married with two children.  He sells plastic sandals and children’s clothing in Magburaka town in Sierra Leone. Musa started his business two years ago and expanded it with his first loan from SMT.  His business is the only source of income for the family.  He is requesting another loan to expand his business so that he can take better care of his family.

loans.use: To buy sandals and clothing for resale

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en: Salamatu lives in Magburaka and is married with 3 children.  She started selling palm oil 4 years ago.  Her husband helped her purchase the palm kernels, and she processed the oil.  With previous loans she increased her inventory by hiring 3 young men to do the purchasing of the palm kernels from various villages, and she devoted herself to processing the oil.  She now has a good quantity of palm oil on hand, but she intends to expand production further.  She is requesting a loan of Le.500,000 ($175)  for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy palm kernels

loans.name: Marciano

texts.en:
Marciano Gómez is the owner of Tati’s Grocery and Butcher Shop in the San Antonio district in the city of San Ignacio. There he sells goods like pasta, oil, rice, salt, sugar, and bread goods. His store also specializes in meats which used to be his father’s business before he passed away close to five years ago. His mother helps to run the shop and also contributes to the income with her produce from her vegetable garden.

This year Marciano’s younger sister finishes high school and will be able to help with the family business. However, until then Marciano is asking for a loan to help the business. With the loan he will by cattle vaccines for the animals they are raising for slaughter along with other materials to keep the cattle healthy and ready to sell.

loans.use: To buy animals, vaccinations, and feed for their butcher shop.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: Mohamed M., 29,  is married and has 3 children.  Mohamed started tailoring as an apprentice in his uncle’s shop.  After learning, he established his own shop  with one machine.  With loans from SMT, Mohamed purchased three more sewing machines and also got some apprentices to work with him.  He makes African dresses and has many customers. He also trains some interested youth.  Mohamed’s business increased his income, and he has rented a shop for his work in Kabala, Sierra Leone.  Mohamed would like to establish a tailoring training center because many youth in the town would like to learn the skill. But he doesn't have enough sewing machines to meet the demand.  He is requesting a loan of Le.2, 500,000 ($850) to purchase materials and sewing machines.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines and fabric

loans.name: Constancio

texts.en:
Constancio Giménez is a 75 year old man who is married with a son who is a student at a local university. Since 1998 his business has been in the area of construction material sales. He originally began his store with the help of Fundación Paraguaya and it has since flourished. He sells bricks, tiles, cement, quicklime, sand and other materials.

With this business he is continuing to collect income to support his family and his son’s college expenses. At this time, Constancio is in need of a loan because demand has been high for his materials and services. He will use the money to buy supplies for his construction store.

loans.use: To buy construction materials like bricks ,tiles, cement, and quicklime.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando C. is a twenty seven year old single man. He has lived in San Ignacio since 1996. He is a merchant who sells various things like bedspreads, quilts, Tupperware, etc. He worked as a collector and seller in order to make enough capital to open his own business. Now he has maintained a steady business and a good clientele. Currently he lives with his brothers; however he has bought a piece of land and has the goal of building his own house.

With this loan Rolando will continue to expand the goods he buys for his business like fans and quilts. He gives credit to the Fundación Paraguaya for encouraging him to expand his business and helping him to better the condition of his life.

loans.use: To buy merchandise like fans, blankets, Tupperware, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria Irma is married to a cattle rancher and together they have two children. The children are dependent on her and her husband because they are still attending school. In order to help pay the bills, Maria began her own drug store in 1992 with a loan she took out with her mother from Fundación Paraguaya. Quickly her pharmacy became very important and well known in the town and sales rose quickly.

She thanks the loan from the Fundación because it gave her an increase in her business, the ability to send her children to school and gave her an all around increase in the quality of life for her and her family. Now 15 years after that initial loan, she is asking for another loan to continue to increase in the size and quality of her business. With the loan she will buy more goods and medications for her drug store.

loans.use: To buy medications.

loans.name: Cleria Herlinda

texts.es:
Cleria belongs to Banco Comunal Nuevo Horizonte (Nuevo Horizonte Community Bank) located in Unión 589, Calleria district in Ucayali department. She is 55 years old and has a son who's already an adult, but who always takes care of her. She is married and her husband is a chauffeur.

With the first loan of S/. 300 Cleria got from Manuela Ramos, she invested in candies. Currently, Cleria has a food joint and sells candies as well. She gets up at 5:00 a.m. to go to the market and buy groceries to prepare the lunches she sells until 2:00 p.m. Then she takes a break for a couple of hours and starts selling candies until 8:00 p.m.

With the S/. 1,000 loan, which she will repay in 5 months, she will buy S/. 200 worth of candies, 1 blender, 1 mixer and will set up a place to sell fresh juice. Cleria is very happy and is independent because she does not have to rely on her husband so much; as a matter of fact, she brings more to the household and is very thankful for the support Manuela Ramos has provided her.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer

La señora Cleria pertenece al Banco Comunal Nuevo Horizonte, ubicado en Jr. Unión 589, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 55 años y es madre de un hijo mayor de edad, pero que siempre está pendiente de ella, es casada y su esposo es chofer. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 que recibió de Manuela Ramos decide invertir en la venta de golosinas. En la actualidad cuenta con un negocio de venta de comidas y golosinas. Se levanta a las 5 a.m. para ir al mercado a comprar sus productos para preparar los almuerzos que vende hasta las 2 p.m., descansa un par de horas y después dedica la a venta de golosinas hasta las 8 p.m. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará S/. 200 en golosinas, 1 licuadora, 1 batidora e implementará un negocio para la venta de jugos. Cleria se siente muy feliz e independiente porque no depende tanto de su esposo, al contrario ella es quien mas aporta en el hogar y da muchas gracias al apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Compra de golosinas y activos (licuadora y batidora)

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Estela belongs to al Banco Comunal Banco Del Futuro (Del Futuro Community Bank), located in Carretera Federico Basadre Km. 8.600 of AA. HH. Nueva Magdalena Mz 1 Lt 12, Callería district in Ucayali department. She is 62 years old and has 3 children (all of them of legal age) who always support her.

Estela used her first S/. 300 loan, from Manuela Ramos, to invest in a small soda fountain. Nowadays she still has the soda fountain and 4 internet booths as well as a small chicken rotisserie joint. Estela gets up very early to check the time the staff comes in. In the afternoon she only takes a couple of hours off to rest because she has to open one of her businesses at night and keep it open until very late, but her children help her with it.

With the S/. 2,000 loan, which Estela will repay within 5 months, she will buy a modem for the Internet and the rest of the loan will be used to remodel the chicken rotisserie joint. Estela has a routine that is quite hectic because of the several businesses she has, but her age does not hold her back and she can manage all the businesses properly; she considers herself to be successful and happy for having been able to support her children. She is also very thankful to Manuela Ramos for all the support she has received.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer

La señora Estela pertenece al Banco Comunal Banco Del Futuro, ubicado en Carretera Federico Basadre Km. 8.600 del AA. HH. Nueva Magdalena Mz 1 Lt 12, distrito de Callería, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 62 años y es madre de 3 hijos mayores de edad que siempre la apoyan. Estela con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 que recibió de Manuela Ramos decide invertir en una pequeña fuente de soda. En la actualidad ella continúa con la fuente de soda, además tiene 4 cabinas de Internet y una pequeña pollería. Se levanta muy temprano para controlar el ingreso de su personal, en las tardes sólo descansa un par de horas porque uno de sus negocios tiene que abrirlo en la noche quedándose hasta altas horas de la noche para poder cerrarlo, para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos. Con el préstamo de S/. 2,000, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará un modem para su Internet y el resto de su préstamo lo utilizará para refaccionar su pollería. Estela tiene una rutina de vida muy agitada por los diversos negocios que posee y a pesar de su edad no es impedimento para manejarlos adecuadamente hasta el punto de considerarse una mujer exitosa y feliz por haber sacado sola adelante a sus hijos y además está muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos por todo el apoyo que le brinda.

loans.use: Compra de activo (modem) y refracción de local

loans.name: Georgina Himelda

texts.es:
Georgina belongs to Banco Comunal Las Aves Fenix (Las Aves Fenix Community Bank), located in Jr. Eduardo del Águila 796, Calleria district in Ucayali department. She is 35 years old and has 2 young children. She is married and her husband is an accounting assistant. With the first loan of S/. 300 Georgina obtained from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest it in a sewing workshop at her house.

Georgina has the workshop now and also sells sodas, ice and lollipops. She gets up at 6:00 a.m. to do her daily chores at home and sew her clients' clothes until late at night.

With the S/. 1,000 loan, which she will pay back within 5 months, Georgina will buy fabrics of different colors and quality, different size rubber bands, silk lace and 4 cases of sodas.

Georgina is happy because her business is doing well and she is able to contribute to her household's expenses, educate her children and feel more independent, thanks to Manuela Ramos' support.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer

La señora Georgina pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Aves Fenix, ubicado en Jr. Eduardo del Águila 796, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 35 años y es madre de 2 hijos menores de edad, es casada y su esposo es auxiliar contable. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 que recibió de Manuela Ramos decide invertir en un taller de costura en su casa. En la actualidad cuenta con un taller de costura y también vende gaseosas, hielos, y chupetes. Se levanta a las 6 a.m. para realizar las actividades diarias en su hogar y al mismo tiempo se dedica a coser las prendas de sus clientes hasta altas horas de la noche. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual pagará en 5 meses, ella comprará telas de todos los colores y calidades, elásticos de diferentes tamaños, blondas y 4 cajas de gaseosas. Georgina está feliz porque le esta yendo bien en el negocio, además puede aportar en su hogar, educar a sus hijos y también se siente mas independiente gracias al apoyo de Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Compra de materiales (telas, elásticos, etc) y gaseosas

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
Ana Patricia Chavarría A. is a young married woman with 2 school age children. Her business is vegetable sales. She's had this business for 5 years. She comments that from the time she was very young she worked selling in the streets while she was studying in school. When she married she wasn't able to continue studying because she had to look for a way to earn a living and give her children her support.

Ana founded the business 5 years ago and reports that it has always gone well for her, since she has the right character to tend to clients and provide them the best possible service. Ana has worked with CEPRODEL for 2 years. She feels very satisfied with the loans she has received, since they have been provided to her at the ideal moment, helping her to restock her business and satisfy her clients every day. She has a record of 10 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Ana Patricia C. A., es una joven casada y con 3 hijos en edad escolar. El negocio de esta señora es la venta de verduras, tiene 5 años de tener este negocio, nos cuenta que desde muy pequeña a ella siempre se dedicó a vender en las calles y al mismo tiempo estudiaba pero cuando se casó no pudo continuar estudiando porque en estas circunstancias tenia que buscar la forma de sobrevivir y darle a sus hijos su apoyo.

Este negocio lo comenzó hace cinco años y nos cuenta que siempre le ha ido bien ya que tiene buen carácter para atender a su clientela y brindarle la mejor atención posible. Ana trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 2 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados ya que les han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando así a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. Ella tiene un record de 10 créditos.

loans.use: Purchase of  vegetables

loans.name: Antonia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Antonia del Socorro G. M. is single and has one daughter, currently in secondary school. Her business is a convenience store which she has been growing little by little since she was young. She started the business when she separated from her husband. She comments that the separation was very difficult for her because she had no idea how she was going to support her children. She had worked in one period of her life as a domestic worker, but, realizing she had 3 more children to support at the time of the separation, she decided to launch her own business.

As she gained experience, the business grew stronger. She was able to raise her 3 eldest children with her earnings from the store. Antonia has been working with CEPRODEL for 4 years and feels very satisfied with the loans she has been granted. Each loans has been provided to her at the ideal moment, helping her to restock the business and satisfy her clients every day. She has a record of 25 loans. At the moment she needs to acquire products in order to offer them in her store. She has turned again to to Ceprodel, an organization that has never abandoned her.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Antonia del Socorro G. M. es soltera y tiene una hija que está estudiando su secundaria. El negocio de la señora Gonzalez es una pulpería que desde muy joven la ha venido desarrollando. El negocio lo comienza cuando ella se separa de su esposo, nos dice que fue muy duro ya que ella no tenia idea de cómo iba a mantener a sus hijos, en un momento de su vida ella trabajo como domestica, pero como en ese momento contaba con tres hijos más decidió poner un negocio.

Con la experiencia que fue tomando con el tiempo, el negocio lo fue fortaleciendo, y de esta manera pudo preparar a sus otros hijos. Doña Antonia trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 4 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando a sí a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. El tiene un record de 25 créditos. Su necesidad actualmente es adquirir productos para ofrecerlos en su negocio, por este motivo es que recurre a Ceprodel quien nunca la ha abandonado.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for the business

loans.name: Rosana's Group

texts.es:
The group was formed thanks to Mrs. Rosana S. that knew about the program “Committee of Enterprising Women” developed by the Paraguayan Foundation through a friend. She hence gathered a group of friends and neighbors to form her committee.

Although this is a new group, you can see the dedication and sense of responsibility each of these members has in their respective businesses. They perform different types of endeavors. Amongst them are sellers of fruit salads, sodas, fruits, and vegetables; others sell prepared foods; some sell clothing; and some sell ice creams and sweets. Daily they go out into their neighborhood offering their products in addition to taking care of their families.

They are asking for the loan to purchase merchandise to sell and in other cases to buy necessary ingredients to prepare their products. They are anxious to keep on growing and increase their incomes and profits so they can improve their quality of life a little bit at a time.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

El grupo se formo gracias a la Sra. Rosana S. que tubo conocimiento del programa “Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras” que desarrolla la Fundación Paraguaya a través de una amiga. Fue así que ella reunió a un grupo de amigas y vecinas para formar su comité.

Este es un grupo nuevo, pero aún así podemos ver la dedicación y responsabilidad que posee cada integrante en sus negocios. Ellas realizan distintos tipos de actividades, entre ellas hay algunas que venden ensaladas de frutas, gaseosas, frutas y verduras, otras venden comidas rápidas, otras venden ropas, otras helados y golosinas. Ellas diariamente salen a las calles a recorrer ofreciendo sus productos y además de ello cuidan de sus familias.

Solicitan el crédito para invertirlos en la compra de mercaderías para la venta y en otros casos para comprar ingredientes para la elaboración de sus productos. Ellas están muy ansiosas por seguir creciendo y ampliar sus ingresos y ganancias de tal modo a mejorar cada vez más su calidad de vida.

loans.use: To buy fruits, sweets, sodas, meats, cheese, milk, flour, sugar, vegeables, ice creams, etc.

loans.name: Arely Guadalupe

texts.es:
Arely Guadalupe P. P. is a young married mother of two, one of her kids is in high school and the other in primary school. This woman's business is a corner store. She started it when she noticed that her husband's income was not sufficient. The start up was very difficult because she had no idea how to start a small business, because prior to that she was a pork butcher. Nevertheless, with experience she started earning and with time, she started to build her business, and has managed to help her children.

Arely has been working with CEPRODEL for 6 years now and feels very satisfied with the timely credits she has been granted, helping her supply the needs of her business and of her daily clients. She has 14 loans in her credit history which she has invested in the purchase of products which is a major need to acquire them to survive in her humble home.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Arely Guadalupe P. P. es una joven casada y con dos hijos que están estudiando uno en la secundaria y el otro en primaria. El negocio de esta señora es una abarrotaría, lo comienza cuando observa que los ingresos de su esposo eran muy pocos. Su inicio fue muy duro ya que ella no tenia idea de cómo comenzar el negocio por lo que se dedicaba solamente al trabajo en el destace de cerdos. Sin embargo, con la experiencia que fue tomando con el tiempo el negocio lo fue fortaleciendo, y de esta manera ha preparado a sus hijos.

Arely trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 6 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando así a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. Ella tiene un record de 14 créditos que los ha invertido para la compra de sus productos que es su mayor necesidad adquirirlos para poder sobrevivir con su humilde hogar.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Aura Maria

texts.es:
Aura Maria M. G. is a married woman and mother of a girl. The business that she runs is a coffee shop that, aside from coffee, also sells food and soft drinks. She tells us that she started her business when she separated from her husband and was lookinng for a way to improve her financial situation. She decided to start selling prepared food from her home in Chichigalpa.

Aura has been working with CEPRODEL for 6 years and feels very satisfied with the credits that have been granted to her. With them she has been able to improve her business and has also managed to get the products she so badly needed. She has a credit history of 17 past loans. Her greatest current need is the purchase of merchandise to supply her business.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Aura Maria M. G. es una dama casada y una hija, el negocio de ella es un cafetín que aparte de café vende diferentes platos de comida y gaseosas. Nos cuenta que el negocio lo comienza cuando ella se separa de su esposo y partir de aquí comienza a buscar la manera de como mejorar su situación financiera por lo que decide poner la venta de comida en su hogar de habitación en Chichigalpa.

Doña Aura trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 6 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados ya que le han beneficiado en el mejoramiento de su local y además ha adquirido sus productos que tanto los necesita. Ella tiene un record de 17 créditos. Su necesidad actual es la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Severiana's Group

texts.es:
This committee is comprised of 15 enterprising women that dedicate themselves to various endeavors that they excel at such as selling prepared food items, beverages, and clothing sales. The desire to progress that these women have is their main driving force.

They wish to acquire a loan in order to buy larger quantities of merchandise to sell like clothes, fruits, vegetables, meat, flour, sodas, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

Este comité está compuesto por quince mujeres emprendedoras que se dedican a actividades varias entre las que se pueden destacar la venta de comidas rápidas, bebidas, además de venta de ropas en general. El deseo de progreso que tienen estas mujeres es su principal motor.

Ellas desean adquirir un crédito con el que podrán adquirir mayor cantidad de mercaderías para la venta, tales como: ropas, frutas, verduras, carne, harina, gaseosas, etc.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as clothes, fruits, vegetables, meat, flour, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura R. is a fifty eight year old divorced mother of three. All of her children are married and have families in Brazil and in Paraguay. While her children were growing up, she made ends meet as a commercial business promoter in Asuncion, the capital of Paraguay.

In 1979 she decided to become an independent business woman and began a small grocery store. After she had made a little money she then added bookstore goods. Her store is located in a perfect location, very near to a school, so she has had great business from the students. Now, Laura has also added some pieces of clothing and footwear that she picked up from a nearby town, Foz de Iguazu.

The loan that Laura is applying for is very important to continue amplifying her sales and diversifying her goods. Her store has already shown great success, and because of its great location and her business practices, it should only continue to grow in popularity.

loans.use: To buy various goods for her general store, such as food, books and clothes.

loans.name: Pastora

texts.en:
Pastora F. is a 66 year old womanwho has lived a hard life. Earlier in her life her husband passed away, and she was left alone to care for her blind daughter. Together she and her daughter live in an apartment in Villa Elisa. A few years ago, after the death of her husband, Pastora needed a source of income to support herself and her daughter. Opening her own grocery store was a perfect business because it allowed her to be close to her daughter who needs constant care.

She works there everyday and is hoping to expand her goods and clientele. The loan is very important to Pastora because it will allow her to better the quality of her goods and gain numerous clients. She currently rents the space in which her grocery store is located but is working towards the goal of gaining a space of her own.

loans.use: To buy oil, meat, flour, eggs, ice cream and drinks.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a 31 year old single mom with a four year old daughter who is just about to begin kindergarten. She lives with her parents and brothers in order to save money. She was in the third year in school on her way to an accounting degree when she had to drop out due to financial difficulties. It is one of her dreams to one day go back to school to gain her degree.

With nowhere else to turn, she got a job working with her father in a spare auto parts shop. She didn’t know anything about the business since she was being formally trained in accounting, and the years she worked with him were hard.

Eventually she picked up the trade and with her skills in numbers and accounting, she became a fine business woman. She had herself and her daughter to support, and did not want to rely on her parents any longer. Recently she decided to venture out on her own and begin her own shop in another area of Paraguay. Both her parents and her brother felt is was a great idea and encouraged her.

Now it has been close to two years since she began her spare parts store and it has grown quite popular in the area. She remembers she was a little scared in the beginning because she did not have much knowledge about owning her own business, however she excelled. Her dedicated clientele says that she has good prices and even better quality of merchandise. Vilma is asking for a loan today to help her purchase more car parts for her shop so that it may continue to grow.

loans.use: To buy car parts.

loans.name: Carla Vanesa

texts.es:
Carla Venesa R. C. has been selling apparel in the municipal market of Chichigalpa for 10 years. She is a mother of two daughters, for whom she has to provide health, education, and shelter. Her problem is that due to her low income, she needs to invest in the purchase of clothing in order to offer a greater variety of high-quality products.

For this reason, she has been a member of CEPRODEL for 4 years, and she is very satisfied with the loans that have been so opportunely given to her, helping her meet her business needs and satisfy her customers daily. She has obtained a total of 20 loans. Her biggest wish is that her daughters earn a university degree so that they can excel and become well prepared adults.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La venta de ropa es el negocio al que se dedica la dama Carla Vanesa R. C. desde hace 10 años en el mercado municipal de Chichigalpa. Es madre de dos hijas a las que tiene que brindarles salud educación y un techo digno. Su problemática es que debido a sus bajos ingresos económicos debe invertir en la compra de la ropa para ofrecer mayores variedades y además ofrecer mejores productos con alta calidad.

Por esta razón, Carla trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 4 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando a sí a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. Ella tiene un record de 20 créditos. Su mayor sueño en la vida es que sus hijas coronen una carrera universitaria y así poder salir adelante y ser personas preparadas en la vida.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Silvina

texts.es:
Ms. Silvina C., lives as a couple and has four children; one is married, one studies at the university and the last two are still in school.

Silvina has a store that operates out of her home that has grown throughout the years and is supported by a large clientele. With time she was able to open another store in the city’s municipal market. Both businesses are doing well as they are in commercial zones.

In addition she also has a booth at the wholesale market located in a very populated and busy area. Miss Silvina wants the loan to buy various items wholesale such as yerba (an herb used in infusions), sugar, beverages, flour, and canned goods amongst other things.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

La Srta. Silvina C., vive en pareja y tiene cuatro hijos, una ya esta casada, la otra estudia en la universidad y los últimos dos van aún a la escuela.

Silivina tiene un almacén, la misma funciona en su domicilio que fue ampliando con el correr de los años ya que cuenta con una amplia clientela. Con el tiempo pudo abrir otro almacén en el mercado municipal de la ciudad. Ambos negocios marchan bastante bien, pues se encuentran en zonas comerciales.

y posee otra despensa situada en el Mercado Municipal de Abasto pues la zona en la que se encuentran es muy poblada y muy concurrida. La señora Silvina retira el préstamo para la compra de varios artículos de almacén al por mayor como yerba, azúcar, bebidas varias, harina, productos enlatados y otros.

loans.use: To purchase various items wholesale such as yerba (an herb used in infusions),  sugar, beverages, flour, and canned goods amongst other things.

loans.name: Carlos Enrrique

texts.es:
Carlos Enrrique G. Q.'s business is a mobile shoe-shine in the streets of Chichigalpa, mainly in the whereabouts of the main market. Carlos is not married and has no children, but nonetheless he works to support his family since the recent passing of his father. It was up to him to assume the family responsibilities.

He has been working at this business for 15 years, a business he started with a principal of 500 cordobas, for the purchase of shoe-shine products. Today he has an urgent need to purchase more of the same shoe shine products and for this reason Carlos has been working with CEPRODEL for the last 3 years. He feels very satisfied with the timely credit that has been granted to him, helping him to supply the needs of his business and obtain the products to keep shining shoes. Carlos has a credit history of 19 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio al que se dedica Carlos Enrrique G. Q. es lustrar zapatos ambulante en las calles de Chichigalpa principalmente en las afueras del mercado municipal. Carlos no tiene esposa ni hijos sin embargo, él trabaja para mantener su familia ya que hace poco su papá falleció y tuvo que ser él quien asumiera las responsabilidades familiares.

Se dedica a este negocio desde hace 15 años con el que comenzó con un capital de quinientos córdobas para la compra de la caja de lustrar, cepillos, tintes y pasta. Hoy en día, su necesidad radica en la compra de sus productos para zapatos y por este motivo, Carlos trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 3 años y se siente muy satisfecho con los créditos otorgados pues se les han otorgados en el momento oportuno, ayudando a sí a suplir las necesidades de obtener sus productos para continuar lustrando los zapatos. Carlos tiene un record de 19 créditos.

loans.use: To purchase shoe polish, dyes, and brushes.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosalina is 39 years old, married, and has 3 sons that are 15, 17 and 19 years old. They are all studying in high school. This humble family lives in the neighborhood of Carlos Fonseca. Mrs. Rosalina's husband was the sole provider of the household; he worked at the National Police and due to his age could not continue working. He now receives a monthly pension. When they found themselves in this situation, Mrs. Rosalina decided to set up a general food store at her house. Here, she sells dairy products, basic grains like rice, sugar, oil and some perishable items such as vegetables and fruits. This is how this entrepenourial woman supports her family. Due to her good administration, her business is growing little by little. Currently, Rosalina would like to stock new products in her store. She would like to buy chicken, cheese, candy and cleaning products so that all homemakers in the area find necessary items at her store

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

. Doña Rosalina tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos varones de 15, 17 y 19 años, todos se encuentran estudiando en Secundaria, esta humilde familia habitan en el barrio Carlos Fonseca. El esposo de la señora era el único proveedor de la casa, trabajó en la Policía Nacional y debido a su edad no pudo seguir trabajando por lo que ahora recibe una pensión mensual. Al verse en esta situación Doña Rosalina decidió montar una Pulpería en su vivienda, en donde vende productos lácteos, granos básicos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, también vende perecederos, verduras y frutas. Es así como esta mujer emprendedora mantiene a su familia, debido a su buena administración el negocio va creciendo poco a poco. Actualmente, Rosalina desea surtir con nuevos productos su Pulpería, desea comprar pollo, queso, golosinas y también desea comprar productos de limpieza, con el fin que todas las amas de casa de la zona encuentren lo necesario en su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase rice, beans, dairy products and chicken

loans.name: Ramon Antonio

texts.es:
Mr. Ramón is 50 years old, married, and has 2 kids that are 6 and 12 years old. Both kids are studying in elementary and junior high, respectively. His wife helps him with household expenses by selling shellfish cocktails. Her number of customers is small because the people who buy from her are occasional passers by. In the evenings, Mrs. G. is a waitress at a restaurant. This family lives in the settlement of Hialeah, a small and impoverished neighborhood where streets are not paved; they do not receive basic services such as drinkable water. In his small house, Mr. Ramón has a workshop where he has repaired and serviced refrigerators for 10 years. He has a good number of clients who go to him. This kind of business is sporadic, so this family's income fluctuates. At the moment, Mr. Ramón needs a loan to buy tools and supplies he needs to repair refrigerators.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr Ramón tiene 50 años de edad, esta casado y tiene 2 hijos de 6 y 12 años, ambos niños se encuentran estudiando en primaria y secundaria respectivamente, su esposa le ayuda con los gastos de la casa, ella vende en la vivienda Cócteles de Mariscos, la clientela de la Sra es reducida debido que los que le compran son personas que pasan por el lugar de manera ocasional, por la noche la Sra es mesera de un restaurante. Esta familia habita en el asentamiento Hialeah, un barrio pequeño, muy pobre, las calles no son pavimentadas y no cuentan con todos los servicios básicos como lo es el agua potable. El Sr. tiene en su pequeña vivienda un taller en donde repara y da mantenimiento a las refrigeradoras desde hace 10 años, tiene un buen número de clientes que lo visitan, este tipo de negocio es esporádico; por lo tanto los ingresos de esta familia son variables. En estos momentos el Sr., necesita el préstamo para comprar herramientas e insumos que necesita para reparar las refrigeradoras.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to use in refrigerator repair workshop

loans.name: Diamantes Group

texts.en:
The community bank “Diamantes” was formed six months ago. Now there are 16 associates and they have completed one loan cycle together. In the community bank they have learned important business skills such as punctuality, responsibility and saving. In addition, they have learned about self-esteem, and how to avoid getting sick. One associate mentioned that the training she received on how to treat her children had been particularly helpful.

The loans that they have been able to take out from the community bank have helped each associate develop their business. The associates have a variety of businesses. People sell products and services including groceries, cosmetics, animals, food, carpentry services, clothing, fruits, and taxi driving.

Each associate has a story they can tell. For example, Yovana raises and slaughters cattle. With her loan from the community bank she has been able to purchase more young cattle and later receive more profits. Another example is Felicitas, who sells clothing at various markets in the region. When she started she was only able to sell a few items, but with an increase in capital she is able to offer a much larger selection.

Different associates need different loans, most are for 300, 600, 900 soles (3 soles = $1) making a total of 9,300 soles. They will invest their loans in buying fabric, buttons, beer, rice, oil, a variety of clothing, wood, and fruit. The community bank emphasizes the importance of saving and each member has an interest earning savings account. The members of “Diamantes” plan to use their savings to improve their houses and pay for their children’s education. Their dreams are to own a tailor shop, that their children will be professionals, and that they can open a business in their homes.

loans.use: Different associates need different loans, most are for 300, 600, 900 soles (3 soles = $1) making a total of 9,300 soles.  They will invest their loans in buying fabric, buttons, beer, rice, oil, a variety of clothing, wood, and fruit.

loans.name: Juana Yolanda

texts.es:
Juana is 39 years of age, married and has two children; a 16 year old daughter who is in her first year of college and a 14 year old boy who is in middle school. Her husband is a security guard and Juana works at a sports club. This family has limited financial resources and their salaries do not complete the cost of maintaining their home. That is why Juana decided to sell various products based on customer orders, by either credit or cash sales. Juana needs the loan to purchase uniforms and school supplies being that she has many orders to fill as classes are about to begin in many schools. This is how Juana has fought to be able to provide for her two children with the support of her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Wendy Wise

Doña Juana tiene 39 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos una mujer de 16 años que cursa I año de la universidad y un varon de 14 años que cursa la educación secundaria. Su esposo es guarda de seguridad y Doña Juana trabaja de conserje en un lub deportivo. Esta familia es de muy bajo recursos económicos, y los salarios no completan los gastos del hogar. Es por eso que Juana decidío vender productos varios por encargo, ya se al crédito o al contado. Doña Juana necesita el préstamo para comprar uniformes y utiles escolares ya que tiene muchos pedidos porque las clases en los colegios están por iniciar. Es así como Doña Juana ha luchado por sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos con el apoyo de su esposo. .

loans.use: Purchase uniforms and school supplies.  Comprar Uniformes y Utiles Escolares

loans.name: Ciro César

texts.es:
Ciro César M. M. is a married man and father of three children. This man's business is a corner store, and since he was very young he worked hard to support his household. The corner store business started 12 years ago with only a small nunber of items but with the passage of time he has been improving the business.

He tells us that all of his life he has been an agriculturist, but that type of work wasn't yielding enough income to be able to establish himself financially, but there was a turning point when he decided to establish his corner store in the main market of Chichigalpa.

Mr. Ciro Cesar works with CEPRODEL for 4 years now and he feels very satisfied with the timely credits that have been granted to him, helping him to fill the business' needs and fill the needs of his household. He has a history of 19 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Ciro César M. M., es un señor casado y con 3 hijos que mantener. El negocio de este señor es una pulpería, desde muy joven ha trabajado fuertemente por llevar el sustento a su hogar. El negocio de la pulpería lo comienza hace 12 años con pequeñas cantidades de productos pero a medida que el tiempo ha transcurrido ha venido mejorando su condición del negocio. El nos comenta que toda su vida ha sido agricultor, pero que este tipo de negocio no le generaba ingresos suficientes como para poder desarrollarse económicamente, por lo que este también fue un elemento para decidirse a establecer su pulpería en el mercado municipal de Chichigalpa. Don Ciro César trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 4 años y se siente muy satisfecho con los créditos otorgados pues se los han brindado en el momento oportuno, ayudando a sí a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer las necesidades del su casa, el tiene un record de 19 créditos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Josefa Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol belongs to Banco Comunal Del Futuro (Del Futuro Community Bank), located on Federico Basadre Highway Km. 8.600 AA. HH. Nueva Magdalena, Callería district in Ucayali department. She is 33 years old, has 3 young children and her husband works with motorboats. With the first loan she got (S/.300) from Manuela Ramos, she invested in the manufacturing of crates for fruits.

Marisol currently owns a factory that produces fruit crates. She gets up at 5:00 a.m. to check the time the staff comes in and to supervise their work throughout the day. In the afternoon, she takes some time off to take care of her children.

With the S/. 1,500 she is borrowing, and which she will return in 5 months, she will use S/. 500 to buy wood, 20 kilograms of nails, 10 liters of glue, and use S/. 50 to buy sandpaper, etc.

Marisol is very happy and satisfied because her business has been growing, thanks to the wise decisions she has made; this way she has been able to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer

La señora Marisol pertenece al Banco Comunal Del Futuro, ubicado en la Carretera Federico Basadre Km. 8.600 AA. HH. Nueva Magdalena, distrito de Callería, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 33 años y es madre de 3 hijos menores de edad y su esposo es lanchero. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 que recibió de Manuela Ramos decide invertir en la fabricación de cajones para frutas. En la actualidad cuenta con una fabrica de cajones para frutas. Se levanta a las 5.00 a.m. para controlar el ingreso del personal y supervisar el trabajo que realizan durante todo el día. En las tardes se da un tiempo para dedicarse al cuidado de sus hijos. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará S/. 500 en madera, 20 Kilogramos de clavos, 10 litros de pegamento, S/. 50 en lijas, etc. Marisol se siente contenta y realizada ya que su negocio está creciendo por las buenas decisiones que toma y de esa manera poder apoyar a su familia .

loans.use: Compra de madera, clavos, pegamento, etc

loans.name: Cruz Del Carmen

texts.es:
Cruz del Carmen Diaz Martinez, is married and has two children, one studying in University and the other in high school. Cruz's business is a corner store, a business she has had since she was very young. According to her, she started her business when she observed that her husband's income was insufficient, and she tells us that it was very difficult at first because she had no idea how to start. In a time in her life she was a pork butcher, which gave her an idea on what she was going to do, but butchering pork was only a once-a-week occurence, and she felt that the earnings were too small. Today her greatest need is to invest in her business through the pruchase of products for resale. For this reason Cruz has been working with CEPRODEL for 4 years now and she feels very satisfied with the credit that has been granted to her. She has secured higher income that has benefitted the improvement of her business and of her household. Her credit history show 18 past credits.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Cruz del Carmen D. M., casada, tiene dos hijos que están estudiando uno en la Universidad y el otro en secundaria, el negocio de Cruz es una pulpería, ella desde joven tiene este negocio. Según cuenta, el negocio lo comienza cuando observa que los ingresos de su marido son muy pocos, nos dice que fue muy duro ya que ella no tenia idea de cómo comenzar el negocio, en un momento de su vida ella trabajo en el destace de cerdos, esto dice que le ayudo para tener idea de lo que iba hacer, pero como el destace de cerdos lo hacia una ves a la semana, sintió que los ingresos eran pocos. Hoy en día su mayor necesidad es invertir en su negocio con la compra de sus productos para luego comercializarlos es por esta razón que doña Cruz trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 4 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados ya que ha obtenido mejores ingresos que le han beneficiado en el mejoramiento de su negocio y por ende de su hogar. Su record crediticio es de 18 créditos.

loans.use: Purchase of products for her business

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Mrs. M. D. H. belongs to the Las Aves Fenix Community Bank located en 241 Jr. Grau Street, Calleria district, Ucayali department. She is 54 years old and has 5 children. All but one still depends on her. She is married and her husband is a cargo operator. With the first loan of 300 soles(Peruvian currency) that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest it in a small pantry shop.

Currently she has a grocery store and she also rents sound equipment for local social events. She gets up at 6 a.m. to start working on her house chores and at the same time she runs her business until 8 p.m.

With the 1,000 soles(Peruvian currency) loan, which she promises to pay back in 5 months, she will buy: 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar, 1 box of oil, 2 boxes of eggs, 1 package of detergent, 1 box of soap, 1 package of noodles, 1 package of flour and 1 box of carbonated beverages.

Olga feels that her life has change. She feels more calm and at ease economically because her business allows her to be close to her family and tend to her customers. Olga can contribute to the household and although she has aged and lost one of her children, those are not things that can stop her determination to achieve important things in life. She give thanks for the support that the Manuela Ramos institution gives her in a constant basis.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Olga pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Aves Fénix, ubicado en Jr. Grau 241, distrito D. Calleria, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 54 años y es madre D. 5 hijos, pero uno aún depenD. D. ella, es casada y su esposo es operador D. carga. Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300 que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 deciD. invertir en una pequeña bodega.. En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega y alquila equipos D. sonidos para eventos sociales. Se levanta a las 6 a.m. para dedicarse a las labores del hogar y simultáneamente atienD. en su negocio hasta las 8 p.m. Con el préstamo D. S/. 1,000, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará 1 saco D. arroz, 1 saco D. azúcar, 1 caja D. aceite, 2 cajas D. huevo, 1 paquete D. detergente, 1 caja D. jabón, 1 paquete D. fideos, 1 paquete D. harina y 1 caja D. refrescos. Olga siente que su vida cambió, está más descansada y tranquila económicamente porque su negocio le permite estar cerca D. su familia y esperar a sus clientes, además pueD. aportar en su hogar y también que a pesar D. su edad y a la pérdida D. uno D. sus hijos no es impedimento para lograr cosas importantes y agradece el apoyo que Manuela Ramos le brinda.

loans.use: Buying groceries like : rice, sugar, oil, eggs, etc. to supply her store

loans.name: Rosa Corina

texts.es:
Mrs Rose belongs to the Community Bank “New Eden” located at Virgen D. Lourdes Mz street Lot number 6 in the district of Yarina Cocha, department of Ucayali. She is 47 years old, has 4 children under 18, is married and her husband is a motorcycle rickshaws driver.

She already received a first loan of 300 soles (100 USD) from the association Manuela Ramos which she invested buying wood that she later sold for a profit.

She has continued selling wood of all types and sizes. She wakes up everyday at 5am to go to the sawmill, where she meets her clients.

With the loan of 1800 soles (625 USD), that she will pay in 5 months, she will buy different types of wood as cedar and other Latin American tropical species (like capirona, shihuahuaco, zapotillo and quillobordon).

Rose feels good about the business; she is economically independent and has a stable situation. She can manage her income without depending on anyone. All thanks to the first loan she got from Manuela Ramos and its staff that advised her well.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal Nuevo Edén, ubicado en el pasaje Virgen D. Lourdes Mz A Lt 6, distrito D. Yarina Cocha, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 47 años y es madre D. 4 hijos, todos menores D. edad, es casada y su esposo es motocarrista.

Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300 que recibió D. Manuela Ramos deciD. invertir en la compra y venta D. madera. En la actualidad se dedica a la compra y venta D. madera en sus distintas modalidades y D. distintas especies, para ello se levanta a las 5 a.m. para ir al aserradero para buscar a sus clientes.

Con el préstamo D. S/. 1,800, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra D. diversas especies D. maderas, tales como capirona, cedro, shihuahuaco, zapotillo, quillobordon, etc. Rosa se siente bien, económicamente estable e independiente porque pueD. manejar sus propios ingresos sin depender D. nadie, todo ello gracias al apoyo D. Manuela Ramos y a sus promotoras que la orientaron bien.

loans.use: Buying wood to sell

loans.name: Daysi Irene

texts.es:
Daysi Irene R. is married and is a mother with 3 children to support. This woman's business makes and sells piñatas. Since she was young, she had the ability to make these piñatas, alternating them with different colors, figures and forms.

Due to the difficult financial situation she has experienced, she has not been able to invest in the infrastructure of her business. She is trying to find a way to expand her shop to have more space and be able to better attend to her customers. Mrs. Daysi has worked with CEPRODEL for 2 years now and feels very satisfied with the loans extended. Using them, she has been able to support her husband with their home's expenses in addition to pay for her children's studies.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Daysi Irene R. es madre casada y con 3 hijos que mantener, el negocio de esta señora es la elaboración y venta de piñatas. Desde joven ha tenido habilidad para elaborar estas piñatas combinándolas de diferentes colores, figuras y formas.

Por la difícil situación económica que por mucho tiempo ha atravesado, no ha logrado invertir en la infraestructura de su negocio por lo que busca la manera de ampliar su local para tener mayor espacio y por ende una mayor atención a sus clientes.

Doña Daysi trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 2 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados. De esta manera ha logrado apoyar a su esposo para el mantenimiento del hogar y además para el pago de los estudios de sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase tools to make piñatas

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa belongs to the Las Aves Fenix Community Bank, located in 174 Jr. Aguaytia Stree, Yarina Cocha district, Ucayali department. She is 53 years old and has 5 children: 4 of them are alredy independent an only one still depends on her. She is married and her husband has retired from the police force. With her first loan of 300 soles(Peruvian currency) from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest it in a small sewing and seamstress shop.

Currently, she manufactures quilts and sheets at her home. She gets up at 7 a.m. to prepare her daughter's and husband's breakfast and at the same time she does the household chores and dedicates herself to sewing.

With the 1,000 soles (Peruvian currency) loan which she promises to pay in 5 months, Rosa will buy all kinds of color fabrics and of different quality, elastics in different sizes, flaxen, and other sewing supplies as well as invest in the repair of her machine.

Rosa is happy being a business owner although she has faced many difficulties, she always has faith that everything will be allright. She thanks the Manuela Ramos organization for its constant support.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Aves Fénix, ubicado en Jr. Aguaytía 174, distrito D. Yarina Cocha, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 53 años y es madre D. 5 hijos, 4 ya son independientes y uno aún depenD. D. ella, es casada y su esposo es jubilado D. la policía. Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300 que recibió D. Manuela deciD. invertir en un pequeño taller D. costura . En la actualidad se dedica a confeccionar sábanas y edredones en su domicilio. Se levanta a las 7 a.m. para preparar el desayuno D. su hija y D. su esposo y simultáneamente a las labores del hogar se dedica a coser. Con el préstamo D. S/. 1,000, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará telas D. todos los colores y calidades, elásticos D. diferentes tamaños, blondas, sesgos, piezas D. dunlopillo y también invertirá en la reparación D. su remalladora. Rosa está feliz D. tener un negocio propio y a pesar D. muchas dificultades que se le puedan presentar ella siempre tuvo fe que todo iba a salir bien, además da muchas gracias al apoyo D. Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Buying sewing materials like fabrics, elastics, etc and for machine repair.

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
Ysabel belongs to the New Horizon Community Bank, located at the #2 Market of the Calleria District, Ucayali department. She is 53 years old and has 5 young children. She is married and her husband is a merchant. With her first loan of 300 soles(Peruvian currency) from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest it in implementing a vegetable stand.

Currently, she continues selling vegetables. She wakes up at 4 am. to open her stand at the farmers' market until 3pm. then she goes home to rest and start over again the next day.

With the 1,800 soles loan, which she promises to pay back in 5 months, Ysabel will but 5 boxes of pannetonne, 5 boxes of milk, 5 boxes of chocolates, 3 sacks of potatoes, 2 sacks of onions and a variety of vegetables.

Ysabel is very happy because the Manuela Ramos organizations is a great support for her. She feels like she is progressing in all aspects of her life

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Ysabel pertenece al banco comunal Nuevo Horizonte, ubicado en el Mercado Nº 2 del Distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 53 años y es madre de 5 hijos menores de edad, es casada y su esposo es comerciante. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 que recibió de Manuela Ramos decide invertir en la implementación de un negocio de venta de verduras. En la actualidad ella continúa con la venta de verduras. Se levanta a las 4 am. para abrir su puesto de venta en el mercado hasta las 3 p.m., luego se dirige a descansar para su rutina del día siguiente.
