Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment—a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of fish in bulk.

loans.name: Marcana

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 37-year-old Marcana M.. She is married with two children, ages 10 and 17, and has two other dependents, who are her niece and nephew. In 2006 Marcana established a livestock and weaving business, and now requires a loan of $450 in order to purchase additional livestock, as well as materials and dyes for weaving. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment—a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional weaving materials and dyes in bulk.

loans.name: Natalia Helena

texts.pt:
Natalia Helena A. is married and has three children, two of them school-age. They live in the neighborhood of Chalembe 2, in Mozambique, and both her and her husband work for the Police Department in the province of Inhambane. Natalia just joined the credit program with the intent of buying some kitchen appliances for her home. She plans to start a business in the near future, since, as their children grow, her and her husband's salaries alone aren't enough to take care of all the household and school expenses.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva volunteer.

Natalia e casada e mae de 3 filhos. Natalia e policia e o seu marido tambem. Ambos estao afectos ao Comando da Policia na Provincia de Inhambane. O casal tem 3 filhos. Os dois mais velhos estao a estudar mas o mais novo ainda nao estuda porque nao tem idade para se matricular numa escola. Natalia esta entrando pela primeira vez no Programa de Cr]edito. Ela pretende comprar electrodomesticos para a sua casa. Mas no futuro pensa em abrir um negocio, ois que o seu salario e o do seu marido nao sao suficientes para prover todas as necessidades familiares a medida que os filhos vao crescendo.

loans.use: To buy kitchen appliances for her home

loans.name: Paschasia

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 42-year-old Paschasia R.. She is married with three children, ages 13, 16, and 20. In 2003 Paschasia established a cosmetics business and now requires a loan of $450 in order to purchase additional stocks of lipstick, nail polish, perfume, and powder. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment—a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To expand her range of cosmetics.

loans.name: Salmada

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 34-year-old Salmada M.. She is married with three children, ages 5, 6, and 12. In 1990 Salmada established a used clothing business and now requires a loan of $450 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk.

Secondhand clothes journey across the oceans from America and Europe and are then washed, ironed and sold in bulk by wholesalers in Dar es Salaam and other major towns and cities in Tanzania to retailers who then re-wash and re-iron them for sale on the streets, in shops, and peoples homes and gardens. These clothes are becoming increasingly popular, especially amongst the younger generation, because they are so cheap and because of the general appeal of anything western or modern. Many people argue that the popularity of the West’s castoffs is damaging the local cloth and garment industry. There are many people who still appreciate the beauty of traditional Tanzanian dress; however, the growing market in used clothing and its importance to any micro-entrepreneurs cannot be denied.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of used clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Sonia Francisco

texts.pt:
Sonia is 30 years old. She's single but lives with a man with whom she has two children. Sonia's partner isn't employed; he lives by odd jobs to support the family. Because of this, Sonia decided to enter the program. This is the first loan that she will borrow. She wants to help her husband meet the household expenses, because what her husband manages to bring in is not enough to cover the expenses. She says she is going to do everything to be a good client, she wouldn't think of abandoning the program, as, from what she's seen, it has really helped people improve their lives.

If all goes well and in accordance with her dreams, she will persuade her husband to begin the construction of an improved residence so that her children gain decent housing. She is also going to ask her husband to open a shared account in the bank where they can deposit the profits from the business, thinking of the future of the children. The eldest is already in school, in the third grade. The youngest still is not old enough but will enroll next year.

Translated from Portuguese by Ilse Ackerman, Kiva volunteer

Sonia tem 30 anos. Ela e solteira mas vive com um homem com quem tem 2 filhos. O marido de Sonia nao esta empregado., vive de pequenos expedientes para sustentar sua familia. Por isso Sonia resolveu entrar para o programa. Este e o primeiro emprestimo que ela vai tomar.Ela que ajudar o marido a custear as despesas da casa, pois que o que o marido tem conseguido nos biscates que faz nao e suficiene para cobrir todas as despesas. Ela diz que vai fazer de tudo para que seja uma boa cliente, pois que nao pensa abandonar o programa pois que pelo que tem visto este tem ajudado muito as pessoas a melhorar a sua vida.

Se tudo correr bem e de acordo com aquiloo que sao os seus sonhos, ela ira perssuadir o marido a iniciarem a construccao de uma residencia melhorada para que os seus filhos nham uma habitacao condigna. Vai tambem pedir o marido para abrirem uma cona conjunta no Banco onde poderao depositar os rendimenos do negocio , pensando no futuro dos filhos. O mais velho ja vai a escola esta na terceira classe o mais novo ainda nao tem idade mas o proximo ano sera matriculado.

loans.use: Sonia wants to use the money for the purchase of more clothing for sale.

loans.name: Ahammd Zalghy

texts.en: Ahammd Zalghy lives in district 3 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and the father of 2 sons. He lives with his own family. He is a tailor and he started this business when he was in Pakistan 7 years ago. He is a good tailor; he has lots of clients. He wants to expand his business so he is requesting an individual loan to buy new sewing machines and complete his stock so that he can make a good income. Ahammd is happy with this process of loans that helps poor people in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy new sewing machines

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann B. is 33 years old, married and has 2 children. She's from Lagos State, Nigeria.

Ann B. is a stylist and also sells accessories including shoes and bags. She has been in business since 1995. She's requesting a loan of $875 to buy more bags, shoes, and clothes for sale.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Matlab

texts.en: Matlab is an Internally Displaced Person from the Lachin region located in the southwest part of Azerbaijan. He and his family were relocated to Sumgayit as a result of the Armenian-Azerbaijan military conflict over Garabakh. He rents a shop and trades mobile phones. As mobile phones are very popular now, the business is going well. But the number and variety of mobile phones is poor. Matlab wants to increase the volume of business. As he has little of his own funds, he has applied to Normicro Sungayit branch for a loan in the amount of $1200 to invest in his business. He will repay the loan in 12 months.

loans.use: To increase the variety of phones to grow the business

loans.name: Agip A 2005(Iv) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year and six months. Ssanyu is married with three children. Her current business is selling used clothes. She wants to use the extra business profits to buy a piece of land in the village. Jane and Hasifah both run restaurants.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand clothing resale business

loans.name: Ayo

texts.en:
Ayo A. is 36 years old, married and has 5 children. She comes from Iba Area of Lagos State Nigeria. She's a fashion designer and also, sells ready made clothes.

Ayo A. has been in business since 1999. She's requesting a loan of $875 to buy more clothes and tailoring materials for sale.

loans.use: To buy clothes and tailoring materials for sale

loans.name: Laman

texts.en: Laman is a refugee from the Zangilan region situated in the south-west part of the country, in the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict zone. She lives in the town of Sumgayit now. She and her husband Ramiz (shown in the picture) rent a shop and sell fruit and vegetables. They have had this business for more than 4 years. They need to buy a cash register for the shop, because it is a requirement of the tax authorities. They have invested all their own money in their business and they want to apply for a loan. They want to borrow $800 with a repayment period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy a cash machine

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en:
Mr. Elshan is a person with a very low income. He is 32, married with two children and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.
Elshan owns and operates a clothing stand in the bazaar of his hometown of Saatli. Recently he employed a shop assistant and now is looking for more funding to further increase the quantity and quality of his inventory.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Agip B 2006(Ii) Group

texts.en:
Martha is a single mother of two children. She has a beauty salon. She wants to use the extra busienss profits to pay school fees for the children and also improve her home. S. sells fresh fish while Gorette has a retail shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand her saloon

loans.name: Arzu

texts.en: Arzu is an Internally Displaced Person from the Zangilan region situated in the southwest part of the country known as the Azerbaijan-Armenian conflict zone. She lives in Sumgayit town now. She and her husband Adalat (shown in the picture) rent a shop and sell male clothing and shoes. They have had this business for more than 4 years. They want to increase the number and variety of goods but they have little of their own funds. They want to borrow $600, with a repayment period of 12 months, for investing in their business.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods

loans.name: Vahid

texts.en: Vahid C. is 35 years old. He is married with three children. He owns and operates an iron door repair shop in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. Almost all homes in Azerbaijan are surrounded by a masonry block wall with an iron door. Vahid has been working in this occupation for the last 12 years. He is currently looking for funding so that he can purchase a new lathe for his workshop.

loans.use: To purchase a new lathe for his shop.

loans.name: Gulu D 2002 (I) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one and a half years. Salima is 30 years old and married with four children. She sells used clothes for a living. She wants to use the extra profits to pay school fees for her children. Margret and Faridah sell fruits and vegetables, while Annet makes and sells snacks.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand the clothe business

loans.name: Elshad

texts.en: Elshad lives in Sumgayit city, he is married and has three children. He runs a sewing workshop. Elshad established this business four years ago, and he now has two more employees. He receives orders from customers, and makes different kinds of clothing. Sometimes he is short of raw materials to fill the orders on time. He heard about Normicro loans and decided to apply for a loan. He wants to borrow $500 for 6 months to buy raw materials such as fabric, thread, needles, etc.

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Gulu D 2002 (Ii) Group

texts.en:
Faridah and Annet are poultry farmers. With the extra profits, Annet wants to pay school fees for her children and also provide more support for her family. Vero and Sarah sell used clothes and want to use the loan to expand their businesses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To introduce new poultry breeds

loans.name: Walbina

texts.es:
Senora Walbina sells clothing for women and children along a busy road between Asuncion and the city of Fernando de la Mora. Many people wait for the bus along this route and all the main bus lines pass by.

Walbina starts very early each day, starting her one hour journey to work around 5am. She exhibits her products from two wooden tables along the road. One of her goals is to be able to rent a place for her business.

She tells us she began her business selling a few accessories for little girls, such as bracelets, hair clips, etc, but as time passed she was able to expand the variety of merchandise thanks to her successful sales. Today, she also travels once a month to Argentina, the neighboring country, to sell typical products such as table clothes, hammocks and other handicrafts.

Walbina is a hardworking woman who would like to grow her business. She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise to sell, such as shorts, pants, hats, blouses, skirts, and various handicrafts.

La señora Walbina vende ropas para damas y niños debajo del viaducto que esta ubicado en una zona de mucho movimiento, ya que este viaducto une dos ciudades grandes Asunción (capital) y la Ciudad de Fernando de la Mora. En este punto mucha gente espera el autobús pues las principales líneas de buses pasan por ahí.

Todos los días, Walbina empieza su día muy temprano, alrededor de las cinco de la mañana ella emprende su viaje hasta su puesto de trabajo, ya que ella vive en la ciudad de Capiatá que queda a una hora de viaje. Ella exhibe sus productos en dos mesas de madera y desea en el futuro poder alquilar un local para su negocio.

Ella nos cuenta que empezó con un capital pequeño vendiendo algunos accesorios para niñas como pulseras, binchas para el pelo, remeras, gomas para el pelo, pero con el tiempo fue ampliando su variedad de mercaderías gracias al éxito que tuvo con las ventas. Hoy día, además de su puesto de ventas, ella viaja una vez al mes al vecino país, Argentina, para vender productos típicos como manteles, hamacas, entre otras artesanías.

Walbina es una mujer emprendedora que desea seguir expandiendo su negocio, ella solicita el crédito para comprar más mercaderías para la venta tales como: remeras, shorts, pantalones, gorros, camisas, faldas, bermudas, manteles, hamacas, artesanías, etc.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE MERCHANDISE FOR HER CLOTHING BUSINESS SUCH AS SKIRTS, PANTS, BLOUSES, AND VARIOUS HANDICRAFTS

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
"I am borrowing for the first time in my loan group. I am the group leader and I require this loan for my husband who needs to buy rugs and blankets in bulk. I have some savings that I will pool with the loan for this purpose. I have two kids: one boy and one girl. My son is four years old and attends kindergarten whereas my daughter is only two years old.

I would like to borrow in a group with several other women. Waziran B. needs this loan to buy her son a rickshaw. Zaiba B. will invest the loan to buy an additional motorbike. Zubaida B. needs this loan for their restaurant. Zareena B. requires this loan to buy a rickshaw. I am the guarantor of all these women and I assure you that they will repay your loan on time."

loans.use: Buy rugs and blankets in bulk

loans.name: Venancia

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 33-year-old Venancia Justin. She is married with three children, ages 8, 12, and 13. In 2001 Venancia established an African clothing business and now requires a loan of $450 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment—a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To expand her range of African clothing.

loans.name: Gulu D 2002 (Iii) Group

texts.en:
Tadeo is a 40 year old widow with eight children. She has a grocery store. She wants to use the extra profits to pay school fees for the children and also buy a plot of land.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her range of clothing.

loans.name: Riaz's Group

texts.en:
I am Riaz B. and I live in the small town of Pakpattan, Pakistan. I am married and the mother of four children. My husband runs an electronics repair shop, and we need this loan to expand his business.

My group members are: Balqees B., who needs a loan for her grocery store. Haleema B. will use the loan to buy her son a donkey cart. Jannat G. will use this loan to help her husband, who sells vegetables in the town market.

I know all of these women. They are very good people, and playing a vital role in bringing income to their families.

loans.use: Expand an electronics repair shop and several other small businesses

loans.name: Starehe

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 37-year-old Starehe S.. She is married with four children, ages 4, 6, 10, and 13. In 2007 Starehe established a clothing business and now requires a loan of $350 in order to expand her range of clothing. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment—a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To expand her range of clothing.

loans.name: Hajra's Group

texts.en:
My name is Hajra A. and I live with my family in the small town of Pakpattan, Pakistan. My family consists of my husband and five children, three daughters and two sons. My husband supports us by selling chickens in the food market while I sell milk from my house. We are applying for this loan to expand my husband's business.

The members of my group who require loans are: Amina B. and Zahida P., each of whom will use the loan to buy an additional cow. Sadiqa B. will use the loan to expand her cradle-making business.

loans.use: To expand several small businesses

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 34-year-old Caroline E.. She is married with four children, ages 1, 5, 8, and 10. In 2007 Caroline established a business selling fish and now requires a loan of $450 in order to purchase additional stocks of fish in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment—a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of fish in bulk.

loans.name: Arshan's Group

texts.en:
My name is Arshan B. and I have lived in Pakpattan, a small town in Pakistan, for my entire life. I am a widow and mother of four: two boys and two girls. My brother lives with me and supports us. We are applying for this loan so that he can buy a rickshaw.

There are several other women in my loan group: Shama B. will use this loan to buy more items to sell from her fruit cart, Khursheed B., who supports her family by making traditional hair ornaments known as Paranda, has applied for this loan to buy fertilizer for her husband's farm. Allah M. will use the loan to buy a rickshaw.

loans.use: Buy a rickshaw and other items for several small businesses

loans.name: Gulu D 2002 (Iv) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year and a half. Betty is married with six children. She sells raw food in the market. She wants to use the extra profits to pay school fees for her children and take care of her family.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more food for sale.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
I am Nasreen R. and I live in Pakpattan, a small town in Pakistan. My loan group and I are borrowing for the second time. Last year, we took out a loan to start a bicycle repair shop. The profit from this business is small but we have managed to repay our loan. This year I plan to start a cosmetics store. I believe this business will do well because there is a high demand for such a store in our community.

The other members of my group are: Anwer B., who wants to expand her sewing business and start a sewing school. Mumtaz B. will buy a rickshaw with the loan. Razia B. needs the loan for her son, who is a tailor. Shamim A. needs the loan to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farm.

loans.use: Open a cosmetics store and expand several other businesses

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Mr. Emilio T. is 54 years old and has a business in the center of the city of Asunción. For more than 25 years he has owned an optician’s shop, where he sells a variety of frames for reading glasses and sunglasses for men, women, and children.

Emilio is a past customer of Fundación Paraguaya, and has for several years now worked with loans provided through the foundation. He is an excellent client and very responsible about his loan payments, all of which he has used to invest in additional merchandise for his business.

Despite the fact that he faces a great deal of competition, Emilio has a well-established customer base and he also works at building new clientele. Today, he is seeking credit to buy additional merchandise because new styles are always being introduced and he wants to always have a well-stocked inventory to meet customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Emilio T., es un hombre de 54 años de edad que tiene un negocio en el centro de la ciudad de Asunción. Emilio posee una óptica hace mas de 25 años, en donde comercializa todo tipo de armazones para anteojos de vista y de sol, para damas, caballeros y niños.

Emilio es un antiguo cliente de la Fundación Paraguaya, lleva ya varios años trabajando con créditos obtenidos de la Fundación, siendo un cliente excelente y responsable en sus pagos, y que los ha invertido siempre en la compra de mercaderías para su negocio.

A pesar de que en la zona existe mucha competencia, Don Emilio, posee su clientela ya formada y periódicamente recibe nuevos clientes. El solicita hoy el crédito para comprar nuevos armazones, pues cada mes salen nuevos modelos y el desea estar siempre al tanto con los diseños novedosos pues sus clientes lo solicitan.

loans.use: Purchase frames for reading glasses and sunglasses.

loans.name: Mwavita

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 33-year-old Mwavita M.. She is married with three children, ages 2, 11, and 13. In 2005 Mwavita established a clothing business and now requires a loan of $450 in order to expand her range of clothing. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. loans.name: Mwajabu

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 40-year-old Mwajabu B.. She is widowed with six children, ages 5, 11, 14, 17, 20, and 23. Mwajabu runs a charcoal business and now requires a loan of $450 in order to purchase additional stocks of charcoal in bulk.

These small, black and dirty pieces of dry earth are important not just to charcoal sellers but to their customers who rely on charcoal to cook their meals. Many Tanzanians still use small coal pots in which they arrange mkaa (charcoal) and add either paper, dry grass, old plastic bags or kerosene in order to light them. The fire requires constant fanning to ignite and maintain the flame and makes cooking quite a hot and laborious task. It may not be the easiest or most environmentally friendly form of cooking, but it is the only option many people can afford.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of charcoal in bulk.

loans.name: Nasuti A(I) Group

texts.en:

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand the businesses of the group members.

loans.name: Zuleykha

texts.en: Zuleykha U. is a 34-year-old married woman with two children. She is a farmer. She lives with her family in Saatli, situated in the central part of Azerbaijan. She started her business in 1995, when she purchased one cow with money she had saved up. The work is hard but interesting and takes a lot of effort. With the help of her husband, who is pictured, she purchases calves, breeds them, and cuts and sells them to the butcher at the local big market. Her current income is not enough to cover all of her family's expenses. To increase the business's profit margin, Zuleykha has to invest some money to increase the size of her small herd. This Winter she applied for a $1,000 loan to help her purchase five calves and she hopes that the calves will be worth twice as much in six months. If Zuleykha receives credit from KIVA lenders, she hopes to eventually expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional calves

loans.name: Nasuti A(Ii) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for eighteen months. Catherine is 40 years old and a single mother with five children. She owns a small bar and she intends to use the extra business profits to pay school fees for her children. Florence has a bakery and wants to use the loan to buy more flour and other baking ingredients. Margret has a poultry business and Ruth makes and sells bricks.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To pay school fees and increase the capacity of the group's businesses.

loans.name: Terma

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 38-year-old Telma K., who is married with one child, age 18. In 2006 Telma established a soft drink and snack food café business, and now requires a loan of $350 in order to purchase modern cooking equipment and utensils, which will enable her to produce and sell more food.

It is said that Coca Cola is one of the most recognized symbols or ‘words’ in the world. And it’s true. Even in the most remote villages in Africa, there is usually some kind of beverage stand selling Coke, Fanta, and Guiness. (Pepsi has made it to most African capitals but not to the sticks, but I’m sure they’re working on it!) The hot weather makes soft drinks all the more appealing--heat is a very cheap marketing tool! All of which explains why selling soft drinks is such a popular venture, whether you’re the CEO of Coca Cola Ltd in the United States or a micro-entrepreneur in Tanzania!

loans.use: To purchase modern cooking equipment and utensils, which will enable her to produce and sell more food.

loans.name: Vugar

texts.en: Vugar B. owns and operates a wood working shop in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. Vugar is 22 years old and has been working in this field for a number of years already. He specializes in making custom doors for his customers. He is currently looking for funding so that he can invest in his business by purchasing new tools for his shop.

loans.use: To purchase new tools for his wood working shop

loans.name: Nasuti B(I) Group

texts.en:
Justine is 48 years old and married with eight children. She plans to increase the stock in her retail shop and use the extra business profits to pay school fees for her children. Sylvia has a beauty salon and wants to use the loan to buy a hair dryer. Rose has a retail shop, while Caroline sells second-hand clothes and Cissy has a restaurant.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a trained nurse/midwife who manages her own private facility in Nakuru, Kenya. She is 49 years old and a mother of 5 children, two of whom are still in school. After finishing training as a nurse/midwife in 1985, Rose initially worked with the Ministry of Health. After 9 years, she resigned from the government job and joined Mariostopes International, where she worked until 2001, when she opened her own private clinic in one of the slums of Nakuru where most of her clients come from. Rose offers a wide range of health services, including general curative , family planning, and maternal and child health. In addition, she also runs a pharmacy, a laboratory, and a theatre. Rose attributes her success to hard work, perseverance, and financial assistance from KMET. She currently needs a loan of US$1,200 to be able to expand the clinic and to purchase an additional stock of drugs.

loans.use: Expansion of a clinic and purchase of a stock of drugs

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Kisumu Medical & Education Trust (K-MET) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Gizbest

She has been working in this business for the last eight years and has already successfully repaid two prior loans with Norwegian Microcredit. She is currently looking for funding so that she can increase the quantity and diversity of her inventory.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is married and her husband works as a driver. They have 5 children who all attend school. The oldest of her daughters, helps her take care of the other children and the business in the afternoons, and attends highschool in the mornings.

Juana has a small dispensary in her house which she opened several years ago. She sells all kinds of every day items such as sugar, flour, noodles, fruits and vegetables, sodas, dairy products, cookies, and various household products. She began with very little capital and now has a larger business which is much better stocked.

The loan she is requesting is to buy more merchandise for her store.

Juana es una mujer casada, su marido es chofer de una línea de transporte, tienen cinco hijos todos aun están en edad escolar, la mayor de sus hijas, la ayuda por las tardes a atender a los niños y el negocio ya que por las mañanas asiste al colegio.

Juana posee una despensa en su casa que lo abrió hace varios años, en el mismo vende todo tipo de insumos de primera necesidad, como azúcar harina, fideos, frutas, verduras, gaseosas, productos enlatados, golosinas, galletitas dulces, productos para la casa, entre otras cosas. Ella empezó con un muy pequeño capital y hoy día ya posee un negocio mas grande y surtido.

El crédito que solicita la señora será utilizado para la compra de mercaderías.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MERCHANDISE FOR HER SMALL STORE, SUCH AS FRUITS AND VEGETABLES, DAIRY PRODUCTS, NOODLES, AND VARIOUS HOUSEHOLD ITEMS.  THE SMALL DISPENSARY SHE RUNS FROM HER HOME HELPS SUPPORT HER 5 CHILDREN.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 45 -ear-old Stella K.. She is single with three children, ages 8, 13, and 15. In 2000 Stella established a poultry business. Stella has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a loan of $700 in order to purchase additional chicks to raise and sell.

Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. In fact, if you are a regular lender on Kiva.org, you may be tired of reading about kuku. "Who or what are kuku?" you may ask. Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. Firstly, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two and either add to them as you go or wait for them to multiply naturally! Secondly, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Thirdly, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. I’m sure there are hundreds of other reasons why raising kuku is so popular (maybe they are friendlier than other animals or prettier?), but this is all time and space will allow.

loans.use: To purchase additional chickens to raise and sell.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! Teddy K. is a 34-year-old single woman with one child, who is 15 years old. In 2002 Teddy established a soft drink business. Teddy has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and she now seeks another loan in order to purchase additional stocks of soft drinks in bulk. Undoubtedly, Coca Cola® is one of the most recognized symbols or 'words" in the world. Even in the most remote villages in Africa, there is usually some kind of "bar" selling Coke, Fanta, and Guinness; Teddy notes that Pepsi has made it to most African capitals but not to the less-populated areas, but she is sure that Pepsi is working on expanding into those areas too!). The hot weather makes soft drinks all the more appealing, which explains why selling soft drinks is such a popular venture regardless of whether you’re the CEO of Coca Cola Ltd. in the United States or a micro-entrepreneur in Tanzania!

About SELFINA:
SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facilities as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing whereby SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA will purchase equipment from said client, extend a loan to her, and then lease the same equipment back to her – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; therefore, financial institutions do not consider Tanzanian women to be credit-worthy because they lack tangible assets that could serve as collateral. As a result, Tanzanian women with low income receive poor financial support and meager access to basic needs and services. SELFINA thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of soft drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en: Elnur H. is a 20-year-old barber in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. He has been working as a barber for the last three years in Khachmaz. He is currently looking for funding so that he can purchase more modern equipment for his barber shop.

loans.use: To purchase more modern equipment for his barber shop

loans.name: Lilana

texts.es:
Liliana is a single mother to a 10-year-old daughter and 7-year-old son. Both are in school, and are excellent students. Liliana is young and entrepreneurial, and she started her business when her husband abandoned her and left her alone to raise and educate their children.

Liliana worked for several years as a veterinary assistant, until she decided to open her own dog grooming business with the little savings that she had accumulated. It has been three years since she opened, and she tells us her endeavor is a success. Every week, more than a dozen dogs are brought to her for her services. In addition to providing bathing and cleaning services, she sells accessories such as dog collars, shampoos, clothing, beds, etc.

Liliana tells us that she finds her work to be relaxing, in addition to being profitable, because she is such an avid dog-lover. She is seeking a loan to buy more dog accessories to offer for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Liliana G. es madre soltera de dos, una niña de 10 años y un niño de 7, ambos van a la escuela y son excelentes alumnos. Liliana es una mujer joven y emprendedora, ella empezó su negocio cuando fue abandonada por su marido y se vio sola para criar y educar a sus hijos.

Liliana trabajo unos años como ayudante en una veterinaria, hasta que con unos pocos ahorros que tenía decidió abrir su propia peluquería para perros. Ya van tres años desde que abrió y cuenta que ha sido todo un éxito. Semanalmente recibe mas de doce perros que requieren de sus servicios. Además de realizar servicios de baño y aseo, ella vende accesorios para perros, como collares, shampoo, ropas, camas, etc.

Liliana cuenta que su trabajo además de ser rentable, es bastante relajante pues a ella le encantan los perros. Solicita el crédito para la compra de accesorios para vender.

loans.use: Purchase dog shampoos, perfumes, collars, clothing, beds, etc.

loans.name: Nasuti C(Iv) Group

In 2000 MaryStella established a photography and digital services business and she now seeks a loan in order to purchase a digital camera and a pinnacle capture card. She thanks you for your support.

Mahmud has been working in this business for the last 8 years and is married with four children. He has already successfully repaid three prior loans with Norwegian Microcredit and thus has proved to be one of our valued and trusted customers. He is currently looking for funding in order to increase and diversify the amount of auto parts he keeps in stock.

loans.use: To increase and diversify his inventory of auto parts

loans.name: Kigombya A(I) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Florence is 38 years old and married with four children. She sells African crafts for a living. With the increased business profits, she intends to pay school fees for her children and re-invest in her business. Justine sells new clothes and wants to use the loan to increase her stock. Federesi sells local brew. Hawa has a retail shop, while Rose sells raw food in the market.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand the group's businesses

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
Mrs Clotilde lives together with her husband and daughters in a house they own. The house is located in the street of José Saravia’s, neighborhood of Alto San Pedro in the city of La Paz.

Her husband is a carpenter and she sells food at construction sites. Indeed, she works together with an engineer who helps her to get contracts to sell food to the construction workers.

She now needs a credit to buy more wholesale products for her cooking in order to lower her costs of production.

Clotilde has been working with the non-profit association “Amparo Gutierrez” since 2002 and due to her good credit history; she can access a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Clotilde vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijas en la calle José Saravia de la zona de Alto San Pedro de la Ciudad de La Paz; el esposo trabaja como carpintero y la actividad que ella tiene es la venta de comida en lugares donde se construyen edificios ya que trabaja con un ingeniero que le ayuda a conseguir contratos para ofrecer comida a los albañiles que trabajan la construcción de los edificios. El crédito que solicita es para comprar en insumos al por mayor para elaborar su comida y de esta forma abaratar sus costos de producción. Por su antecedente histórico puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Clotilde es cliente de nuestra Institución desde el año 2002 con un buen historial de pagos.

loans.use: To buy more wholesale products for her cooking in order to lower her costs of production

loans.name: Kigombya A(Ii) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Doren is 40 years old and married with nine children. She sells charcoal for a living. She wants to use the extra profits to pay school fees for the children and build rental houses. Jane and Peace have retail businesses and want to use the loan to increase their stock. Peace sells second-hand clothes. Aidah lays bricks.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To add in stock in the charcoal business

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Petrona P. has a store for clothing sales in the center of the city, in a very commercial zone visited primarily by tourists and office workers that work in the area as there are many office buildings nearby. She sales mainly women’s clothing, and a few items for men as well. Among the items she offers, we can include: skirts, shirts, blouses, shorts, capris, dress pants and jeans, dresses, etc.

She obtained her own business with much sacrifice, working arduously for several years to be able to save enough money to invest. The Fundación Paraguaya was a great help also, given that it helped her get access to loans so she could start her business.

These days, she can be found very content at her endeavor, given that she generates enough income to support her home as well as to provide for her childrens’ basic needs and educations. She seeks a credit to invest in the purchase of additional merchandise, particularly for the summer months, as she has received many requests for such inventory from her most frequent customers.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Petrona P. posee un puesto de ventas de ropas en el centro de la ciudad, en una zona muy comercial, visitada principalmente por turistas y oficinistas que trabajan en la zona ya que hay muchos edificios. Ella vende principalmente ropas para damas, y algunas para caballeros. Entre las prendas que ofrece podemos citar: remeras, faldas, camisas, blusas, shorts, capris, pantalones de tela y de jeans, vestidos, etc.

Cuenta que con mucho sacrificio pudo lograr obtener su propio negocio, pues trabajo arduamente durante varios años para poder ahorrar su dinero y formar su capital. La Fundación Paraguaya fue de gran ayuda también ya que le facilito los créditos para que ella pueda iniciar su negocio.

Hoy día, ella se encuentra muy contenta con su trabajo, ya que le genera las ganancias suficientes para mantener su hogar, y darles a sus hijos educación, ropas, y comida. Ella solicita un crédito que los desea invertir en la compra de mas mercaderías especialmente de la temporada verano, pues en este mes ha recibido muchos pedidos de sus clientes más frecuentes.

loans.use: Purchase clothing/merchandise: dresses, blouses, shirts, skirts, pants, etc.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo lives with his mother in his own house in La Paz. His activity involves making sombreros (hats) for children and adults. He is also starting to make suits and jackets. He is seeking a loan to purchase a sewing machine and more raw materials for his products.

His previous history qualifies him as a good loan candidate.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Gerardo vive en casa propia con su mama en la Av. Buenos aires de la zona Tiwiña de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que realiza es la confección de sombreros de niños y adultos, también está empezando a elaborar trajes, chamarras etc. El crédito que solicita es para comprar una maquina de coser y comprar más material para la confección de trajes y chamarras, así como también sombreros. Su antecedente histórico lo califica como buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Purchase sewing machine, material, thread, etc.

loans.name: Modesto

texts.en:
Modesto P. is married to his wife Teresa and together they have four children. Their oldest son is married with children and works in the area of automotive repair. Their three daughters still live with them because they are still attending high school. Modesto is 52 years old and has worked as a fish vendor on Acceso Avenue since the year 1983. He is hoping to expand his business with different types of fish and better the small dining room that is located in his shop.

With a loan Modesto will buy different types of fish, which will bring in a greater prices. Fish is in high demand. He also wishes to buy a freezer in which to keep the fish fresh, along with tables and chairs to allow customers to wait and eat in comfort in his shop.

loans.use: To buy a freezer for his products. He also wants to invest in selling different kinds of fish and also buy tables and chairs for the small dining room in his shop.

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en: Tahir C. is a barber in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. Tahir has already successfully repaid one prior loan with Norwegian Microcredit. He is currently looking for funding so that he can make repairs and remodel his barber shop.

loans.use: To make repairs and improvements to his barber shop

loans.name: Kigombya A(Iii) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Resty is 28 years old and a single mother of three children. She has a hotel business. She intends to use the increased business profits to pay school fees for her children and look after her family. Aisha offers tailoring services. Aminah sells second-hand clothes and wants to use the loan to expand her business. Vero lays bricks.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more hotel equipmwnet

loans.name: Yegane

texts.en: Yegane I. buys and sells cows in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. She and her husband have been working in this business for the last six years and have already successfully repaid two prior loans with Norwegian Microcredit. She is currently looking for funding so that she can purchase more cattle.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Ševala

texts.en:
Ševala is a 51-year-old woman from a small village called Bašigovci near the town of Živinice. Her husband is self-employed in construction. His monthly income is US$ 300 (when weather permits). Agriculture and raising livestock is the basic income source by which Ševala supports her family. They have two daughters; one is a student.

This is Ševala's first loan with MCO WWI in the amount of US$ 450. Her intention is to buy a cow. Ševala has two cows and she is going to expand this business to improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: Buying a cow

loans.name: Lidia's Group

texts.en:
A committee of seventeen women neighbors has formed in the city of Villa Elisa, and together they are asking for a loan to help support their individual businesses. The name of their organization is United Hands, and together they are a solidified, confident group of women who are working together to improve their lives and the livelihood of their families.

The committee has worked very well in the neighborhood and all the women meet weekly to discuss their businesses, and share the responsibility of paying back loans. On various occasions, they have put on joint activities for their families, and are friends and not just business members. However, they also solve problems together, everyone has a say in the group, and they always make decisions based on the good of the majority.

These mothers and businesswomen are asking for a loan in order to increase their supply of goods to be sold. They all wish to increase the size of their businesses, whether it is in the area of clothes, meat, groceries or sweets.

loans.use: The loans from Fundación Paraguaya are invested in buying more goods for all the business women who are participating in the committee.  Some of these good include meat, sugar, rice, vegetables, dairy, cheese, etc.  These are sold by the women who own small general stores; however, other women used the funds to buy candies and sweets, cleaning supplies, and fabrics for their different businesses.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en: Elmira A. operates a clothing stand in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. Elmira is a conservative Muslim woman and, therefore, did not want to have her face pictured on the internet, which is why she is looking away from the camera. She has been working in this business for the last five years and has already successfully repaid two prior loans with Norwegian Microcredit. She is currently looking for funding in order to increase and diversify her inventory stock.

loans.use: To increase and diversify her stock of inventory

loans.name: Kigombya B(I) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Winnie is 28 years old and married with four children. She sells raw food in the market. She wants to use the increased business profits to construct rental houses so that she can supplement her income. Nulu and Jannet have grocery stores while Mary has a brick laying business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more foods for sale.

loans.name: Aynur

texts.en: Aynur Q. is a low income, vulnerable woman. She is 20 years old and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central, flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. Aynur owns a small herd of cattle. On Saturdays she sells animals that she bred and buys calves for breeding purposes. Her mother, who is pictured, helps to breed the calves. The business is going well but needs certain improvements. Aynur plans to increase the number of calves she purchases to generate additional income. Her family's expenditures are increasing as the children grow older. Aynur has applied for a $1,000 loan from the Normicro Saatli branch. She hopes this credit will help her and her family.

loans.use: To buy additional calves

loans.name: Talib

texts.en: Talib T., whose father is pictured, owns and operates a market in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. He has been working in this market for the last five years and has already successfully repaid two prior loans with Norwegian Microcredit. He is currently looking for funding so that he can expand and diversify his inventory stock.

loans.use: To expand and diversify his inventory

loans.name: Gertrudis De Los Áng

texts.es:
Gertrudis de los Ángeles S. B. is single, and the mother of four school-aged children. Her business for the past 33 years has been selling vegetables at the market in Chichigalpa. She tells us that, as a youngster, her parents did not send her to school and so she had to find a way to survive and support the home. Today, she endeavors to give her children what she did not have: a stable home environment and an education.

She inherited her business from her mother, who has been a force behind her getting ahead and supporting her family. Gertrudis has worked with CEPRODEL for four years, and is very happy with the loans provided to her at various opportune times. These have helped her supply her business and satisfy her customers’ daily needs. She has a record of 19 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Gertrudis de los Ángeles S. B., es una dama soltera y con 4 hijos en edad escolar. Su negocio es la venta de verduras teniendo 33 años de tenerlo en el mercado municipal de Chichigalpa. Según cuenta en su niñez los padres no la ponían a estudiar y por tal motivo tenia que buscar la forma de sobrevivir para mantener el hogar. Hoy en día ella se esfuerza para darle a sus hijos lo que ella no tuvo, brindándoles de esta manera a su familia estabilidad y una educación para el futuro de ellos.

Este negocio de venta de verduras lo heredó de su mamá quien ha sido el pirar para que ella salga adelante y le de el sustento a su familia. Doña Gertrudis trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 4 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados ya que les han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando así a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. Ella tiene un record de 19 créditos.

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables.

loans.name: Arif

texts.en: Arif M. is a taxicab driver in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. Arif is married with three children and has been working as a taxi driver for the last three years. He is currently looking for funding so that he can make some much needed repairs to his taxicab.

loans.use: To make repairs to his taxicab

loans.name: Mirela

texts.en:
Mirela is a 31-year-old woman and she lives in a village near the town of Kovači. Her husband is self-employed in construction. His monthly income is about US$ 300, when weather permits. When her husband does not have seasonal construction work, they are busy with agricultural work. They have a 5-year-old daughter.

Mirela is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 450 at MCO WWI and her intention is to buy seeds for their greenhouse. She wants to secure a safe future for her child.

loans.use: Buying seeds for her greenhouse

loans.name: Namile

texts.en: Namile is a 22-year-old local resident of Saatli town. She is married and lives with her husband and their child. She breeds cattle with her family and they have been working in this business for 25 years. She raises calves and sells them alive to the local market or to butcheries. She also sells milk and other dairy products. She wants to buy two more calves to add to their stable of livestock so she applied to the Normicro Saatli branch for a loan in amount of $1,000.

loans.use: To buy additional calves

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia is an entrepreneurial lady who dedicates herself to making and renting “Globos Locos” (crazy balloons). She also does animations for birthdays, particularly for small children.

She is mother to three small children who are still in school, and who are her inspiration. Each month, she has many engagements and she travels with her equipment and helpers.

Other services she offers include filming, photography, and magicians. Her balloon rental inventory includes sleighs, castles, etc. She is seeking a loan to purchase two air compressors with which to fill the ballons.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Sonia es una mujer empresaria, ella se dedica a la fabricación y alquiler de “Globos locos” (Bounce house), además de ello ella también realiza animaciones para cumpleaños, especialmente para cumpleaños infantiles.

Ella es madres de tres niños pequeños que aún van a la escuela y que son su fuente de inspiración. Cada mes posee bastantes pedidos, trabaja en equipo junto con varios personales a los que ella da trabajo.

Entre los servicios que presta también podemos añadir que realiza filmaciones, fotos, magos y entre la variedad de sus globos locos están: toboganes, castillos, camas elásticas, etc. Ella solicita el crédito para comprar dos motores compresores de aire, que son los que se utilizan para inflar los globos locos.

loans.use: Purchase of two air compressors.

loans.name: Gregoria Estela

texts.es:
Gregoria Estela R. is a very hardworking woman who, from a young age, has dedicated herself to the sale of shellfish in the city of Chinandega. She started her business because her husband did not have a stable income, and she needed to support their children.

She gained more and more experience as time went by, and her business is now located in a major market that is frequented by many visitors.

Gregoria has worked with CEPRODEL for four years, and is very happy with the loans that have been provided to her to buy her products. Her current need is to purchase additional shellfish to sell. She has a record of 17 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Gregoria Estela R. es una dama muy trabajadora que desde muy joven se dedica a la venta de mariscos entre ellos las conchas negras vendidos en la ciudad de Chinandega. Inicia con la venta de estos productos debido a que su esposo no percibía ingresos estables y por la necesidad de mantener a sus pequeños comercializa estos productos.

Ya con la experiencia que fue tomando con el tiempo el negocio lo fue fortaleciendo, actualmente el negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal donde es muy visitado por muchas personas.

Doña Gregoria trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 4 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados para la compra de sus mariscos. Su necesidad actual es la compra de los productos para su respectiva venta. Ella tiene un record de 17 créditos.

loans.use: Purchase shellfish.

loans.name: Natavan

texts.en: Natavan B. owns and operates a beauty salon in the small, northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi. Natavan has been working in this business for the last ten years and has successfully repaid three prior loans with Norwegian Microcredit. She is currently looking for funding so that she can purchase new equipment for her salon as well as make some minor repairs to her salon.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment and to make minor repairs to her salon

loans.name: Tahire

texts.en: Tahire K. owns and operates a furniture store in the small northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi. Tahire has already repaid one prior loan with Norwegian Microcredit, thus proving to be one of our trusted and valued customers. She is currently looking for funding so that she can make improvements in her store.

loans.use: To make improvements to her store

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis A. owns a garage specializing in Mercedes Benz repairs. He acquired his mechanical experience and knowledge from working for several years at a large, well-known garage in the city.

Luis comes from a humble family, for whom he began to work at a very early age. After saving some money, he started his garage in a location which he currently rents. His proposed goal is to open his garage at a location of his own, and he has already purchased some land for this purpose. He is now seeking to buy additional land and start building.

To reach his goal, he asks for a loan of $1,075, which he will invest in the purchase of additional land.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Luis A., posee un taller mecánico para autos especialmente de la marca Mercedes Benz. Las habilidades y conocimientos los ha adquirido luego de trabajar varios años como ayudante en un taller grande y reconocido de la ciudad.

Luis proviene de una familia humilde, por lo que desde muy joven empezó a trabajar. Luego de ahorrar dinero, monto su taller que se encuentra hoy día en un lugar alquilado. El proyecto que tiene Luis es la de montar su taller en un local propio, para ello ha comprado un terreno y ahora desea comprar otro terreno más para luego empezar a construir su local propio.

Para poder cumplir su meta, solicita hoy un crédito de $ 1.075 que los invertirá en la compra de un terreno mas.

loans.use: Purchase land.

loans.name: Haydee Jesús

texts.es: Haydee

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Valide

texts.en: Valide E. and her husband own and operate a home goods store in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi. She and her husband have four children and have been working in this business for the last 10 years. They are currently looking for funding so that they can increase and diversify their inventory.

loans.use: To increase and diversify her inventory

loans.name: Indira Escarleth

texts.es:
Indira Escarleth S. G. is a young, married professional. She has two children, one eight years old and the other a newborn of eight months. Because of the lack of jobs in our country, she found herself in the vital position of needing to seek any type of work to survive. She wants to provide for them, and give her family a stable future and good education.

For the past eight years, she has dedicated herself to selling accessories for cell phones. This business is one of the most prosperous in her area. Her sales have increased substantially given that she has improved her business location and its structure. Her initial capital investment of 5,000 córdobas came in part from her own savings as well as from her life partner.

She has worked with CEPRODEL for three years, and she is thankful for the loans that have been provided as they have helped her improve her business. She has a record of 17 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Indira Escarleth S. G., es una Joven profesional casada y con 2 hijos uno de 8 años y el otro un recién nacido de 8 meses. Por la situación de falta de trabajo en nuestro país, es que ella se vió en la imperiosa necesidad de buscar cualquier forma de trabajo para sobrevivir y darle a ellos lo mejor, brindándoles a su familia estabilidad y una educación para el futuro de ellos.

Hace más de 8 años esta joven se ha dedicado a la venta accesorios para celulares. Este negocio es uno de los mas prósperos hoy en día en su sector, sus ventas incrementaron considerablemente, ya que ella ha ido ampliando su local y mejorando la estructura del mismo. Su capital de inicio fue de C$ 5,000 (córdobas) los cuales una parte eran sus ahorros y otra parte fueron de apoyo de su compañero de vida.

Escarleth trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 3 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados ya que le han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando así a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. Ella tiene un record de 17 créditos.

loans.use: Purchase cell phone accessories.

loans.name: Irania Del Socorro

texts.es:
Irania del Socorro M. L. is married and has three school-aged children. For the past 16 years, she has sold her own refreshments and enchiladas. She studied up until the sixth grade, and she tells us she married too young as it made it impossible for her to continue her studies. Her husband did not earn enough to help complete her education. Once she had children, and seeing that her husband’s income was not enough to support the family, she decided to find a way to contribute financially. Her wish is to help provide for their children, giving them a stable home and good education that will serve them well in the future.

She inherited her business from her mother, who was an excellent cook and who stood out for her delicious enchiladas. She has worked with CEPRODEL for three years, obtaining loans that have greatly helped her acquire the ingredients necessary to create her delicious products.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Irania del Socorro M. L., es una señora Casada y con 3 hijos, dos de ellos en edad escolar, el negocio de esta señora es venta de refrescos y enchiladas, tiene 16 años de tener este negocio, ella estudió hasta el sexto de grado de primaria y dice que se casó muy joven por lo que después se le hizo imposible seguir estudiando ya que su esposo ganaba muy poco como para ayudarle con los estudios. Una vez que nacen los hijos y con lo poco que su esposo ganaba ella busca la forma de cómo ayudarle a su esposo y de esta manera poder darle a sus hijos todo lo que necesitaran, brindándoles de esta manera a su familia estabilidad y una educación para el futuro de sus pequeños.

Este negocio lo heredó de su mamá que era una excelente cocinera ya que se destacaba por las deliciosas enchiladas que hacía. Para elaborar los refrescos y enchiladas doña Irania trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 3 años obteniendo créditos que le han beneficiado para adquirir la materia prima y elaborar sus deliciosos productos.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make specialty food products.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel N. produces and sells springs; he has had this business for more than 20 years. Miguel lives in the city of Limpio (which means clean in Spanish), located 30 minutes away from Asuncion, where he has his shop and factory.

In the mornings, Miguel works at a retirement home, repairing chairs and beds amongst others. He then works at his workshop, where he makes and sells the springs. He buys wires in different sizes and widths then gives them the required form with a special machine in order to produce the springs.

Most of his clients are cars or motorcycle repair shops. This year, his goal is to become the sole provider of the biggest motorcycle’s factory in Paraguay.

He therefore requests a loan to buy the working material (more wires) he needs.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Miguel N. se dedica a la fabricación y ventas de resortes. Esta actividad la desarrolla desde hace ya más de 20 años. El vive en la ciudad de Limpio que queda a treinta minutos de Asunción en donde posee su fabrica y local de ventas.

Por las mañanas, Miguel trabaja en un hogar de Ancianos realizando reparaciones varias en las sillas, camas entre otras cosas. También fabrica sus resortes en el mismo lugar de venta, compra alambres de distintos tamaños y grosores y le da forma con una máquina especial.

La mayoría de sus clientes son talleres de reparación de vehículos y motocicletas. Este año tiene como meta ingresar como único proveedor en la fábrica más grande de motocicletas de Paraguay. Solicita el crédito para poder adquirir más elementos de trabajo.

loans.use: To buy wires in different sizes and widths in order to produce springs

loans.name: Ivonne De Los Ángele

texts.es:
Ivonne de los Ángeles C. V. is single and has three school-aged children. Her last year of studies was the fifth grade. She runs a general store, and tells us that she has enjoyed working since a young age. For a time in her life, she decided to travel overseas. Upon her return, and with the money she was able to save, she obtained her business in Chinandega. She started her store upon the birth of her first child. She was quite young and her husband was out of work. She invested the money she earned abroad in the implementation of her store.

This young lady has worked with CEPRODEL for four years, and she feels very gratified with the 21 loans that have been granted to her. They have helped her stock her store and improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Ivonne de los Ángeles C. V. , soltera, tiene tres hijos los tres están el periodo escolar, el ultimo año que cursó ella fue el quinto año de secundaria, el negocio de esta señora es una pulpería, nos dice que desde joven le ha gustado trabajar, tanto así que en un momento de su vida decidió viajar al extranjero, después regresó y con el dinero que logró ahorrar obtuvo este negocio de pulpería en Chinandega. El negocio lo comienza cuando nace su primer hijo, ella era muy joven y su esposo estaba sin trabajo entonces con el dinero que ella recopiló en el exterior lo invierte en la implementación de la pequeña pulpería.

Esta joven señora trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 4 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los 21 créditos otorgados que los utiliza para suplir el negocio y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for general store business.

loans.name: Johana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Johana del Carmen G. D. is a single young woman with two kids who are studying in high school. This woman's business is a general food store. She has been working since she was young; her business started when she was separated from her husband. She says it was very difficult since she had no idea how she was going to support her kids. At one point in her life, she worked as a domestic worker, but due to it's low wages, she decided to invest in a general store instead.

These days, Ms. Johana works with CEPRODEL and has done so for the last 2 years. Seven loans have been extended to her which she has invested in her business to build her shop, and primarily to acquire products. Purchasing merchandise is her main need right now and the reason she is asking for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Johana del Carmen G. D., es una joven soltera, tiene dos hijos que están estudiando su secundaria, el negocio de esta señora es una pulpería, ella desde joven ha trabajado, el negocio lo comienza cuando ella se separa de su esposo, nos comenta que fue muy duro ya que ella no tenia idea cómo iba a mantener a sus hijos, en un momento de su vida ella trabajó como domestica pero por los bajos ingresos que percibía decide invertir en la pulpería.

Hoy en día la señora Johana trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 2 años habiéndole otorgado 7 créditos que los ha utilizado en la inversión de su negocio para construir su local pero principalmente para la adquisición de sus productos que es su mayor necesidad en este momento y por tal razón es que solicita el crédito.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: José Dolores

texts.es:
José Dolores U. is single and has a two year old son. U. attended five years of secondary school and succeeded in becoming a graduate. Once he finished his studies, he looked for jobs in various places. However, he was not able to find any work due to the country's difficult economic situation, and he decided to set up a business selling various products (general food store) to support his young son.

This young man has worked with CEPRODEL for 1 year now. He is very satisfied with the extended loans so far since he has invested the money in his business. One advantage U. possesses is that his business is located in the outskirts of the municipal market of Chichigalpa. This is an area heavily visited by people, so his main desire is to invest in the infrastructure of his shop to provide a high quality service.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

José Dolores U. es soltero y tiene un hijo de dos años. U. cursó hasta el quinto año de secundaria logrando llegar a ser un bachiller. Una vez que termina sus estudios busca empleo en varios lugares pero por la difícil situación económica del país no encuentra ningún empleo por lo que decide implementar un negocio de venta de productos varios (pulpería) para mantener a su pequeños hijo.

Este joven trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 1 año y se siente muy satisfecho con los créditos otorgados ya que los ha invertido en el negocio. Una ventaja que posee U. es que su negocio se ubica en las afueras del mercado municipal de Chichigalpa siendo este local muy visitado por las personas por lo que su mayor anhelo es invertir en la infraestructura de su local para brindar un servicio de alta calidad.

loans.use: To Invest in the infrastructure of his business

loans.name: Terana

texts.en: Ms. Terana is a 24 year old local resident of Saatli town. She and her brother have been engaged in the business of cattle-breeding for many years. She raises calves and sells them alive to the local market or to butcheries. She also sells milk and other diary products. Cattle breeding is traditional in this region, where there are no other jobs.  Terana  wants to buy two more calves to add to their livestock. She has applied to Normicro Saatli branch for a loan of $1000.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Zarifa

texts.en: Ms. Zarifa is  a resident of Saatli town. She is married and lives with the family of her husband. She, along with  her mother-in-law (who is pictured), breeds cattle in her yard. They have been engaged in this business since 1991 and are now quite experienced.  Zarifa raises calves and sells them alive to the local market or to butcheries. Cattle breeding is a tradition in this region, and is often the only source of income. It can bring a good income. Zarifa wants to develop this business,by buying five more calves to add to their livestock.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos D. B. is a young, single man who is very hardworking. This young man's business is a coffee shop located at the municipal market of Chichigalpa. This client says he's owned the business for 10 years since he inherited it from his mother, who decided to hand over her business to her only son when she fell ill; she was confident knowing he would manage it. Throughout the years, he has invested in his business, but now a days has the need to acquire products such as coffee, bread, butter, etc.

For this reason, he turned to Ceprodel which has provided much support with loans for 4 years now. He has used these loans to purchase products and to maintain his house. Juan Carlos has a record of 21 past loans and it is necessary to highlight that he has paid all of them back on time and according to the terms established.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan Carlos D. B. es un joven soltero muy esforzado. El negocio de este joven es un cafetín que está ubicado en el mercado municipal de Chichigalpa. Este cliente nos cuenta que el negocio lo obtiene hace 10 años por herencia de su mamá ya que al entrar en una crisis de enfermedad decide entregar su negocio a su único hijo muy confiadamente de que él lo iba a administrar. A través de los años ha invertido en su negocio pero hoy en día tiene la necesidad de adquirir los productos como el café, pan, mantequilla, etc.

Para esto acude a Ceprodel que con mucho apoyo le ha beneficiado con créditos desde hace 4 años habiéndolos invertido en la compra de sus productos y además para el mantenimiento de su hogar. Juan Carlos tiene un record de 21 créditos que es necesario destacar que todos los ha pagado en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido.

loans.use: To purchase coffee, bread, and butter

loans.name: Nayah

texts.en: Nayah is 43; her husband, A., does not work anymore. So to earn income for the family, she makes and sells flavoured ice and earns $2 a day. She requests a loan of $100 to expand her business, and as a member of MBK, she agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Doña Luzmila is a member of the community bank “Mujeres de Grandes Retos”, and for a living she sells clothing. Her business is located in the town of Huaraz, department of Ancash. With the loan, S/.3,000.00,($1,025) to be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase a dozen girl’s suits , 5 dozen ladies’ jackets, and 2 dozen men’s jackets.

Luzmila is 32 years old, a single mother with two children in elementary school. She needs to increase her income in order to meet family expenses as she is both father and mother in her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Luzmila pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres de Grandes Retos, se dedica a la venta de ropas. El negocio está ubicado en la ciudad de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.
