Con el préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará una docena de conjuntos para niñas, 5 docenas de casacas para damas, 2 docenas de casacas para caballeros.

Luzmila tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos quienes están en educación primaria. Su ingreso debe permitir sacar adelante a sus hijos porque es padre y madre de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase garments to increase sales.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Doña Raquel is a member of the community bank “Mujeres de Grandes Retos” and for a living she sells clothing and footwear (which she brings from the town of Trujillo). Her business is located in the town of Huaraz, department of Ancash. With the loan of S/.2,300.00 ($800), to be repaid in 5 months, she will buy 2 ½ dozen jackets for men and women, 4 dozen ankle boots, 12 dozen boots, and underwear for men, women and children.

She is 30 years old, married, with no children. Her husband is dedicated to wholesale and retail of eggs and both work to run their household.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Raquel pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres de Grandes Retos, se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado (que los trae de la ciudad de Trujillo). El negocio está ubicado en la ciudad de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 2,300.00, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará 2 ½ docenas de casacas para damas y caballeros, 4 docenas de zapatos tipo botines, 12 docenas de botas, ropas interiores para damas, caballeros y niños.

Ella tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y no tiene hijos. Su esposo se dedica a la venta de huevos al por mayor y menor y ambos trabajan para sacar adelante a su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase clothing and footwear to increase sales.

loans.name: Fuad

texts.en: Fuad owns a clothing stand in the bazaar of the Saatli town of Azerbaijan. Fuad has been running his business for several years with the help of his shop assistant (she is pictured), and is now looking for funding so that he can increase his inventory of winter clothing. The seasons will be changing soon, and he needs to be prepared for this shift within the market.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Juan Filiberto

texts.es:
Juan Filberto is an elderly gentleman with a business that sells all types of products, such as rice, beans, oil, garlic, soap, toilet paper, etc. In essence, it's a small general food store that is located at a self-owned shop in the interior of the municipal market of Chichigalpa.

Due to the difficult economic situation he has experienced for a long time and his low income, Mr. Filiberto finds himself with the obligation of bettering his life's conditions. For this, he needs to invest in purchasing new products that are demanded by the public.

Aware of his family's needs, and considering he is the sole provider of the household, he decided to turn to Ceprodel, which has helped him with loans that he has used to acquire new products to sell at the municipal market of his city. His credit record consists of 19 loans with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan Filiberto es un caballero de edad avanzada y con un negocio de venta de todo tipo de productos entre ellos arroz, frijoles, aceite, ajos, jabón papel higiénico, etc. En fin es una pequeña mini pulpería que la ubica en un local propio en lo interno del mercado municipal de Chichigalpa.

Debido a la difícil situación económica que por mucho tiempo ha pasado el señor Filiberto y por los bajos ingresos que obtiene en su negocio, se ha visto en la obligación de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y para esto necesita invertir en la compra de nuevos productos que sean demandados por la población.

Consiente de la necesidad que atraviesa su familia siendo él sustento único de su hogar decide recurrir a Ceprodel quien le ha beneficiado con créditos que los ha utilizado para adquirir nuevos productos y ofertarlos en el mercado municipal de su ciudad. Su record crediticio es de 19 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his business

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
Doña Ysabel is a member of the community bank “Las Candelarias II”. She is dedicated to the production and sale of ice cream. Her business is located in the town of Huaraz, department of Ancash. With the loan of S/.800.00,($275) to be repaid in 4 months, she will buy 10 bags of sugar, 3 bags of flavoring, and 3 bags of essences.

Ysabel is 50 years old, married, her husband is a government employee and both have been successful in raising their 3 children who are now independent.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Ysabel pertenece al banco comunal Las Candelarias II. Se dedica a la elaboración y venta de helados. El negocio está ubicado en la ciudad de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará 10 bolsas de azúcar, 3 bolsas de saborizantes y 3 bolsas de esencias.

Ysabel tiene 50 años de edad, es casada, su esposo es empleado público y ambos han logrado educar a sus tres hijos que ahora son independientes.

loans.use: Purshase supplies for the production of ice cream.

loans.name: Gasham

texts.en: Mr. Gasham is a low income vulnerable person. He is 30 and lives in the Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in Caucasus region. Gasham rents a small shop in the local bazaar of Saatli town and sells food. The business is very successful and needs some investment to increase the daily turnover. But Gasham has no collateral to apply to the commercial banks. This is why he has applied to Normicro Saatli branch for a $500 loan. This credit would let him buy and sell a larger amount of goods and better provide  the necessities of life to his children.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods he sells.

loans.name: Umyanah

texts.en: Umyanah, 32, mother of 3 children, is a rice farmer who earns $53 a month. Her husband, S., sells steel and earns $11 a day. She requests a loan of $75 to buy fertilizer and add to her business capital. She is a member of MBK and willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and add business capital

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Doña Adela is 62 years old. At the present she lives in the town of Trujillo and her business is located at the “Chacarero” market. She is dedicated to selling all kinds of groceries (milk, cooking oil, noodles, rice, etc.) balanced food, vegetable stews, and cheese. At 19 years of age doña Adela started to work at a furniture store while she was studying a technical degree which she did not finish as she became ill. When recovered she had several jobs and little by little she saved money which she spent on buying clothes to sell in the mountains, as she was living for some time in Mache and was accepted in the community bank “Progresistas”. After getting married she returned to the town of Trujillo, bought a house, and some years later managed to get a stall at the “Chacarero” market which slowly has grown into her present business.

With a previous loan of S/.300 from the community bank “Progresistas” she traveled to Mache to purchase lamb, ground meat, cheese, wheat grains, dry potato, and “chufla” (pudding made of corn) which she sold in different parts of Trujillo. With the requested loan of S/.2,300, ( $800) to be repaid in 4 months, she will buy rice, sugar, milk and noodles by wholesale. It is doña Adela’s dream to start a chain of general stores offering the same products as she is now selling.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Adela tiene 62 años de edad. Actualmente vive en la ciudad de Trujillo y su negocio está ubicado en el mercado “Chacarero”. Se dedica a la Venta de toda clase de abarrotes (leche, aceite, fideos, arroz, etc.), alimento balanceado, menestras y quesos. Desde la edad de 19 años la señora Adela trabajó en una tienda de muebles, en paralelo estudiaba una carrera técnica, pero no terminó debido a que se enfermó, luego de mejorarse trabajó en varios empleos y poco a poco fue ahorrando dinero con el cual compró ropa para vender en la sierra, porque un tiempo vivió en Mache e ingresa al banco comunal “Progresistas”. Después de casarse regresa a vivir a la ciudad de Trujillo, se compra una casa y después de unos años consigue un puesto en el mercado “Chacarero”, en el cual poco a poco ha ido surtiendo el negocio.

Con un primer préstamo de S/.300 que recibió en su banco comunal “Progresistas” viajó a Mache para comprar carneros, molidos, quesillo, granos de trigo, papa seca y chufla para ofrecer por las diferentes urbanizaciones en Trujillo. Con el préstamo de S/. 2,300, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará arroz, azúcar, leche y fideos al por mayor. El sueño de la señora Adela es tener una gran empresa, es decir, tener una cadena de depósitos que ofrezcan los mismos productos que ahora ella vende.

loans.use: Purchase groceries (rice, sugar, milk, etc.) to increase business.

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
Juan José B. A. is a single gentleman, whose business is to sell beef at his place of residence in the city of Chinandega, Nicaragua.

He has stood out for the last 19 years for having the ability to succeed in this business. He says he has enjoyed selling beef since he was very young since he was brought up by his father in the countryside; that is how he started his business. These days, his main need is to purchase beef.

In order to better his family's financial situation, Mr. Juan José has worked with CEPRODEL for the last year. He feels very satisfied with the loans that have been granted since they have been extended at opportune moments; they have helped him meet the needs of his business and satisfy customers on a daily basis. He has a record of 3 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan José B. A. es un caballero soltero, el negocio al que se dedica es al destace de res en su casa de habitación en la ciudad de Chinandega de Nicaragua.

Desde hace 19 años se ha destacado por tener la habilidad de realizar este negocio y nos cuenta que desde muy joven siempre le gusto la venta de carne de res, ya que él se había criado con su papá en el campo y de esta manera comenzó este negocio. Hoy en día su mayor necesidad es la compra de las reses.

Para poder mejorar la situación económica de su familia y negocio el señor Juan José trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 1 año y se siente muy satisfecho con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando así a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. El tiene un record de 3 créditos.

loans.use: Purchase beef

loans.name: Julia Yamileth

texts.es:
Julia Yamileth S. M. has two school-aged daughters. Her business is a general store and, since of a young age, she has worked at sales with her mother. She tells us her husband is with her and their children, but that he earns very little money. For this reason, feeling the need to help out with the family’s living expenses, she set out to start her own enterprise. She recalls it being very difficult at first but, little by little, over time, she began to grow the business.

Julia’s primary need is to purchase additional merchandise to sell in her store. Toward this end, she has worked with CEPRODEL for three years. She is very gratified by the loans they have granted her at opportune times, helping her to keep her store stocked and to meet the needs of her customers each day. She has a record of 12 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Julia Yamileth S. M., soltera, tiene dos hijas las que están en edad escolar, el negocio de esta señora es una pulpería, ella desde joven ha trabajado vendiendo con su mama, nos cuenta que su esposo ha estado con ella y sus hijos pero que también él gana muy poco dinero. Por este motivo es que ella sintió la necesidad de ayudar a su marido con los gastos del hogar, es a si que ella con la poca experiencia que tenía decide poner su propio negocio, nos cuenta que al comienzo le fue duro pero poco a poco se vino desarrollando en el negocio.

La mayor necesidad de doña Julia es la adquisición de los productos para su pulpería y por este motivo trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 3 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues se le otorgaron en el momento más oportuno, ayudando a sí a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. Ella tiene un record de 12 créditos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for general store.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo is 38 years old, finished her studies only to the first grade, and lives in the La Esperanza district of Trujillo province.

Thirteen years ago she started a business in the Union market in Trujillo, where she sold dry goods such as raisins, pecans, tuna and dairy products. Currently, she sells the same types of products from the Victoria Market having changed locations because it was closer to her home. In the afternoons, at around 5 pm, she sets up a grill outside her house and sells prepared foods.

She belongs to the collective bank “Mujeres en Acción” (“Women in Action”) from which she received her first loan of 300 soles (Peruvian currency). With these funds she purchased merchandise brought in from Cajamarca, such as cheeses and butter.

With the loan of 1,000 soles (approximately $350USD), to be repaid over four months, she will buy tuna, pecans, raisins, etc.

She dreams of having her own location in the market and to add another business in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Consuelo tiene 38 años de edad, estudió sólo el primer grado de primaria, vive en el distrito de La Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad. Hace trece años comenzó un negocio en el mercado “Unión” del distrito de Trujillo donde vendía frutas secas como pasas, pecanas, aceituna y productos lácteos. Actualmente se dedica a la venta ambulatoria de los mismos productos en el Mercado Victoria. Se cambió porque este mercado está más cerca de su domicilio. Por las tardes a partir de las 5 p.m. coloca una parrilla afuera de su casa y prepara y vende anticuchos de corazón, molleja, cuellitos y patitas. Pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres en Acción”, aquí recibió un primer crédito de S/. 300.00, con el cual compró mercadería que le traen desde Cajamarca como quesos, mantequilla y manjarblanco. Con el préstamo de S/. 1000, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará 50 kilogramos de aceituna, 5 kilogramos de pecanas, pasas y guindones. La señora Consuelo sueña con tener un puesto propio en el mercado y en poner otro negocio en su casa.

loans.use: Purchase food products such as tuna, pecans, raisins, etc.

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es:
Dionisia is married, and mother to two young children who are still in primary school. Her husband works as a taxi driver and, in order to help out with the family’s living expenses, she started her own business selling home electrical appliances 15 years ago.

She carries a large variety of merchandise, and works around a system of orders whereby her customers make requests for what they need, she purchases the item, and sells it to them either on credit or in cash. Her customer base is growing, given that she offers a wide variety of goods at reasonable prices.

Currently, Dionisia seeks a loan to have cash on hand when her customers place an order. The recent holiday season she had many sales, using up all her capital from the business. Thanks to her enterprise, they were able to buy a taxi cab for her husband’s use.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra Dionisia es madre de 2 hijos, menores de edad, estudiantes de primaria, esta casada, su esposo trabaja como taxista y para ayudar en los gastos familiares a su esposo, decidió emprender su propio negocio, en el cual tiene 15 años, ella habita en el barrio 31 de diciembre. La Sra Dionisia comercializa electrodomésticos. La mercadería que vende es muy variada, cuenta con un sistema de pedidos, en donde el cliente le encarga lo que desea, ella lo compra y luego se lo vende al crédito o al contado. El número de clientes de la Sra esta creciendo, debido a que esta ofreciendo una variedad de productos y con precios favorables. Actualmente, Doña Dionisia necesita el préstamo para poder contar con efectivo al momento que sus clientes lleguen y le hagan un pedido, ya que por motivos de la epoca navideña por las ventas que tuvo, dispuso de todo su capital en el negocio. Con el negocio de Doña Dionisia, es como pudieron adquirir el vehículo taxi que su esposo trabaja.

loans.use: Purchase home electrical appliances.

loans.name: Gladys Katheryne

texts.es:
Gladys is 25 years old, finished high school, but currently does not practice her profession. She lives in the La Esperanza district of La Libertad.

Gladys travels to Lima each month to bring novelties in clothing for women, men and children, in addition to decorations, ceramics, and gifts. Her business was starting thanks to her aunt who traveled overseas, leaving her a spot at the Victoria market. She decided to continue the business that this family member left to her, and little by little she began to grow it.

She is a member of the collective bank “Mujeres en Acción” (“Women in Action”) from which she received an initial loan of 300 soles (Peruvian currency). With this capital, she purchased products ordered by some of her customers such as clothing and gifts.

With the loan of 1,200 soles (approximately $425USD), to be repaid in four months, she will travel to Lima to buy additional merchandise as well as a display case in which to exhibit her products.

Her dream is to own her site at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señorita Gladys Katherine tiene 25 años de edad, estudió superior completa, pero por el momento no ejerce su profesión. Vive en el Distrito de La Esperanza, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad. Gladys viaja a la ciudad de Lima mensualmente para traer novedades en ropa para dama, caballeros y niños, además de adornos, cerámica y regalos. Su negocio se inicia gracias a su tía que viajó al extranjero y le dejó un puesto en el mercado “Victoria”. Ella decidió continuar con el negocio que le había dejado este familiar y poco a poco fue surtiéndolo. Es socia del banco comunal “Mujeres en Acción” en el que recibió un primer préstamo de S/. 300 y con este dinero compró los pedidos que le hicieron algunos clientes como ropa y regalos. Con el préstamo de S/. 1200, el cual pagará en 4 meses, viajará a Lima para traer peluches, ropa y regalos, además arreglará una vitrina en la que exhibe su mercadería. Su sueño es comprar un puesto en este mercado.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise (clothing, gifts, etc.).

loans.name: Dora Maria

texts.es:
Dora is married and has three older daughters. With the financial support of her husband, who works as a mechanic, she has been able to provide an education for them and they are now studying at the university. The family lives in the La Libertad neighborhood, a place where the residents find themselves in a precarious situation in life.

She attends to a school cafeteria that offers items such as breakfast, sandwiches, hamburgers, drinks, and sweets. The cafeteria’s customers are the school students and faculty, who are able to buy a quality product there. Given that the school has two daily sessions, morning and afternoon, Dora works from 6 am to 5 pm. Her daughters help her with tasks related to running the cafeteria.

Currently, her customers are asking that she add new dishes to her current menu. For this reason, she seeks a loan to buy additional food/ingredients such as rice, beans, chicken, and vegetables in order to prepare the meals. Her short-term goal is also to improve the physical condition of her cafeteria's location.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Dora es casada y tiene 3 hijas mujeres, con el apoyo económico de su esposo que se desempeña como mecánico es que ha podido educar y preparar a sus hijas las cuales se encuentran estudiando en la Universidad, esta familia habita en el barrio Villa Libertad en donde los pobladores se encuentran en precaria situación de vida. La Sra. atiende un Cafetín Colegial, en este cafetín se ofrece desayunos como sándwich, hamburguesas, almuerzos caseros, refrescos y golosinas. Los clientes del Cafetín son los alumnos del Colegio y los Docentes del mismo, los cuales se les ofrece un producto económico de acuerdo a sus necesidades, la Sra se encuentra trabajando desde las 6:00 a.m. hasta las 5:00 p.m., ya que el colegio tiene 2 horarios de clase, mañana y tarde. Las hijas le ayudan a su madre ha administrarlo. Actualmente, a la Sra. le están demandando nuevos productos y platillos para ofertarlo a sus clientes, es por eso que necesita el préstamo, para comprar productos alimenticios como arroz, frijoles, pollo, verduras para elaborar los platillos que ofrece. Su meta a corto plazo es ampliar la estructura física del cafetín.

loans.use: Purchase food/ingredients for cafeteria.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Maria Auxiliadora T. F. owns a food sales business specializing in fried fish. The business is located at the municipal market of Chichigalpa. From a young age, she has had the experience needed for this venture, given that she previously helped her mother in the preparation of the food.

Sadly, her husband passed away, and for this reason she had to find a way to support her family, particularly her oldest daughter who is still a student. Mrs. T. starts selling on her way from her house to the market. Once there, she prepares the remainder of the food for the day and finishes selling it at the market.

Maria has worked with CEPRODEL for four years, and she is very gratified by the loans that have been granted her previously. They have helped her to meet the needs of her business and meet customers' daily demands. She has a record of 22 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Auxiliadora T. F. posee un negocio de venta de comida siendo su especialidad el pescado frito.El negocio se ubica en el mercado municipal de Chichigalpa. Ella desde muy joven tiene la experiencia en lo que respecta al negocio, ya que anteriormente ella le ayudaba a su mamá en la elaboración de los alimentos.

Lastimosamente su esposo fallece y por tal motivo busca la manera de cómo mantener su núcleo familiar y a su hija mayor que cursa la secundaria. Hoy en día la señora T. comienza vendiendo en las calles, haciendo recorrido desde su casa, pasando por las calles principales hasta el mercado municipal, que es donde termina la comida que hace para el día.

Doña Maria trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 4 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues se les han brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando a sí a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. El tiene un record de 22 créditos.

loans.use: Purchase of meat and fish for food preparation.

loans.name: Juana Bacilia

texts.es:
Juana Bacilia is 48 years old, and completed her studies only to the fifth grade. She currently lives in the La Libertad section of the province of Otuzco. She has three children who are all grown and no longer depend on her financially.

She started her business at a very young age, first helping her mother and later on her own. She first had a small store, but she quit this endeavor after she was robbed and because the community is quite small and had other similar establishments. Today, she instead buys and sells cereals/grains which she buys from various producers and then takes to Trujillo to sell. In addition, she buys curd with which to make cheeses to also sell in Trujillo.

Juana is a founding member of the collective bank “Mujeres de Trabajo” (“Working Women”), where she obtained her first loan of 300 soles (Peruvian currency). She used the funds to buy groceries to stock her store. With the loan of 2,300 soles (approximately $800USD), to be repaid in four months, she will buy cereals at good prices and also the curd to make cheeses from.

Juana dreams of having a small truck to use for transporting her goods to Trujillo.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Juana Bacilia tiene 48 años de edad, estudió sólo hasta quinto grado de primaria y actualmente vive en el Centro Poblado Menor Piscopampa, distrito de Mache, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad. Juana tiene tres hijos, pero todos mayores de edad y que ya no dependen de ella. Empezó su negocio desde muy joven, primero ayudando a su madre y luego con un dinero que recibió como apoyo inició sola su actividad. Primero tuvo una pequeña bodega en su comunidad, pero luego la dejó debido a que le robaron y también porque el poblado no es muy grande y hay otros negocios similares. Ahora se dedica a la compra y venta de cereales; los compra a pequeños productores de diferentes caseríos y luego los lleva a vender a la ciudad de Trujillo, además también compra cuajada para preparar quesos y también llevarlos a vender a Trujillo. La señora Juana es socia fundadora del banco comunal “Mujeres de Trabajo” lugar donde obtuvo un primer préstamo de S/.300, con los que compró abarrotes para implementar su bodega que en ese entonces tenía. Con el préstamo de S/.2,300, el cual pagará en 4 meses comprará cereales a buen precio y también cuajada para preparar los quesos. La señora Juana sueña con tener un camioncito para trasladar la mercadería hasta Trujillo.

loans.use: Purchase cereals, as well as ingredients to make cheese.

loans.name: Maria De La Concepci

texts.es:
Doña María comes from a very poor neighborhood called “Batea” in the municipality of “Muelle de los Bueyes”. She is 39 years old, married and has 3 children that study at the elementary school. Her husband works as a Security guard.

In order to contribute to the household expenses, she has a small groceries store at her house. She has had this small business since 10 years and the profits it has raised, together with her husband’s income, have allowed her to expand her house and to provide her children with education and a better standard of living.

Doña María now needs to buy more staple commodities as she does not have enough and her customers often ask for this type of products.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña María, es originaria del municipio de Muelle de los Bueyes de una zona muy pobre llamada La Batea, tiene 39 años, casada, con 3 hijos que se encuentran estudiando primaria, el esposo de Doña Maria Concepción trabaja como Guarda de Seguridad.

Para ayudarse con los gastos de la casa Doña Maria atiende una Pulpería en su casa de habitación, tiene 10 años de tener este negocio, y es con esta pulpería y el apoyo de su esposo como ha podido salir adelante y han ido construyendo su hogar y su negocio y también brindarles a sus pequeños hijos educación y una mejor calidad de vida. Doña Maria en estos momentos necesita comprar productos de consumo básicos, ya que en existencia no cuenta con suficientes y sus clientes demandan a menudo dicho productos.

loans.use: To buy more staple commodities to provision her small groceries store

loans.name: Elburus

texts.en: Elburus A. is 30 years old, married and has one son. He lives in Amirzeyidli village of Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He owns and operates a small food market in the village. He started his business five years ago. He is  applying to Normicro Beylagan Branch for a loan in the amount of $950 to purchase more types of goods and expand his business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Maria Danelia

texts.es:
The sale of curds and cream is the business to which Maria Danelia N. R., single and with one school-aged child, dedicates herself to. She has had the business since a young age, starting it after she separated from her husband and had to watch over the well-being of her children. She started selling the curd and cream on the streets but, seeing a need for something more stable, she decided to obtain a site at the municipal market of Chichigalpa which is where she is currently located.

Today, the challenge facing Danelia is the need to invest in the infrastructure of her business for which she has turned to CEPRODEL over the past two years. She is very happy with the loans that she has been granted because, through them, she has been able to improve her sales as well as the standard of living of her family who so needs your support.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La venta de cuajada y crema es el negocio al que muy esforzadamente se dedica la señora Maria Danelia N. R. , soltera y con un hijo que están en edad escolar. Desde joven tiene este negocio iniciándolo cuando se separa de su esposo y comienza a velar por el bienestar de sus hijos. Inicia vendiendo en las calles las cuajadas y las cremas pero al ver la necesidad de algo mas estable, decide solicitar un tramo en el mercado municipal de Chichigalpa que es donde actualmente se encuentra ubicada.

Hoy en día la problemática que atraviesa la señora Danelia es que necesita invertir en la infraestructura de su negocio y para ello ha recurrido a CEPRODEL desde hace 2 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados porque a través de ellos ha logrado mejorar sus ventas y sacar adelante su familia que tanto necesita de su apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase primary ingredients to prepare curds and cream (for making cheese).

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz María is 40 years old. She had studied for a technical degree, but did not pursue a career because she married shortly thereafter and her husband did not want her to work. She has two children who still depend on her, and lives in the El Cortijo sector of the Trujillo province.

Luz started in the business of selling juices by traveling throughout the city. Subsequently, with the credit she received from Manuela Ramos, she added a display case in her house for cakes and bread. With both her savings, as well as later loans, she has outfitted her small store. She now has a well-stocked store in her home, and she continues with her sales of juices. She no longer travels around to sell her goods, but is instead able to do so from her own home.

She is a founding member of the collective bank “Luz Divina” (“Divine Light”) where she obtained her first loan of 300 soles (Peruvian currency). With the loan of 750 soles (approximately $275USD), to be repaid over six months, she will buy sodas, fruit and beer to sell in her store. Given that it is the summer season now, these products are in great demand.

Luz is very happy with what she has achieved, having initially suffered greatly at the hand of her husband. They are now separated, and she feels much better. She dreams of seeing her children succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Luz María tiene 40 años de edad, estudió una carrera técnica pero no la ejerció porque se casó al poco tiempo y su esposo no quería que trabaje. Tiene 2 hijos que aún dependen de ella y vive en el Sector El Cortijo, distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad. La señora Luz se inicia en el negocio vendiendo jugos en un carrito el cual movilizaba por toda la ciudad, posteriormente con los créditos que recibió de Manuela Ramos puso en su casa un vitrina con algunos pasteles y pan. Ahorrando y con los siguientes créditos ha ido implementando su bodega, ahora tiene una bodega bien surtida en su casa y además no ha dejado el negocio de los jugos, pero ya no vende como ambulante sino en la puerta de su casa. Es socia fundadora del banco comunal “Luz Divina”, en su banco comunal obtuvo un primer crédito de S/. 300 con el cual compró vitrinas para iniciar la implementación de su bodega. Con el préstamo de S/.750, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará gaseosas, fruta y cerveza para vender en su bodega debido a que estamos en temporada de verano y estos productos tienen demanda. La señora Luz está muy contenta con lo que ha logrado, al inicio sufrió mucho porque su esposo la maltrataba pero decidió separarse y se siente mucho mejor. Sueña con ver a sus hijos realizados.

loans.use: Purchase sodas, fruit and beer to sell in general store.

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en: Tahir A. lives in Amirzeyidli village of Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He is 45 years old, married and has three children. He owns and operates a small market. He sells clothes, home products, etc. at his market. Tahir needs a loan in the amount of $1075 to increase the variety of his products.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Khagani

texts.en: Khagani A. lives in Amirzeyidli village of Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He is 30 years old, married and has one son. He has been engaged in cattle-breeding for more than ten years. He needs a loan in amount of $950, he would like to purchase some sheep and expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase some sheeps

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria F. is a married lady with two daughters, who in addition to helping her in her business also study at secondary school. Her business is the sale of food. She has had experience in this since she was a young girl, as previously she worked helping a woman in the same line of business. She began selling food when her husband lost his job and she noticed that the family really needed money. Her husband stopped working when their children were still small, so she decided to begin selling food. At first she sold it from her house, but with time she says she realized that she would sell more if her business was in a location where there was a higher volume of people, so for that reason she decided to move her business to the municipal market.

One of Maria´s needs is that because of scarce resources she does not have enough to buy food ingredients, and for that reason she has worked with CEPRODEL for the past 5 years. She feels very satisfied with the loans granted to her as they have been given at the right moment, helping her to supply her business. She has a record of 8 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria F. es una dama casada y con dos hijas las que además de ayudarle en el negocio también están estudiando la secundaria, el negocio de esta señora es venta de comida, ella desde jovencita tiene experiencia en lo que respecta al negocio, ya que anteriormente ella trabajó de ayudante con una señora en este mismo negocio. Comienza la implementación de la venta de comida cuando su marido queda sin trabajo y nota que el dinero en el núcleo familiar hacía mucha falta, el marido deja de trabajar cuando sus hijos todavía estaban pequeñas, por lo que ella decide dedicarse a vender comida, inicialmente lo hacía en su casa, pero con el tiempo dice que se da cuenta que ella vendería más si el negocio lo ubicara en un lugar donde hubiera mas afluencia de personas, es por eso que decide ubicar su negocio en el mercado municipal.

Una necesidad que atraviesa la señora Maria es que por ser de escasos recursos no le alcanza lo suficiente para comprar los ingredientes de la comida es por esta razón que trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 5 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues se les han brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando a sí a suplir las necesidades del negocio, ella tiene un record de 8 créditos.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Akif

texts.en: Akif G. lives in Amirzeyidli village of Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He is 52 years old, married and has three children. He has engaged in cattle-breeding.for the past 15 years.  He has  had three loans from Normicro Beylagan Branch and repaid them in a timely fashion. He is again applying to Normicro for a loan in the amount of $1000 to purchase 10 sheep and expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase 10 sheep

loans.name: Miralam

texts.en: Miralam H. lives in the Amirzeyidli village of Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He is 59 years old, married and has two children. He is engaged in cattle-breeding like other people in his village. He has good experience in this business. He applied to the Normicro Beylagan Branch for a loan in the amount of $700 to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Sveta

texts.en: Sveta R. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. Sveta is 31 years old. She is single and operates a small beauty salon. She lives with her parents, brothers and sisters. She started her business because she needed to help out even more with the family's expenses. She wants to be a successful woman. She applied for a loan of $900 because she wants to purchase more merchandise and increase the number of customers by offering a greater variety of products.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en:
Tomasa is 63 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters. She has seven children, but the majority are grown up and have their own families. Tomasa’s husband is handicapped and has to stay home all the time.

Tomasa earns her livelihood selling deep-fried chicken, spicy pork sausage and natural juices. She started the business five months ago with a loan she borrowed from FSMA. Tomasa used the funds wisely and says that she can repay the loan on time. Until now, she has run the business within her house, but she plans on renting a small local for that activity after a short time.

Fortunately, competition in her zone is not very strong. So, she has received a lot of customers that visit her house every day to buy her delicious fried food.

Tomasa will invest her second loan in the purchase of meat and other goods to continue that activity which is the main source of income of her family.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and other goods for a small fried food activity.

loans.name: Nadir

texts.en: Nadir H. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He is 43 years old, married and has two children. He owns and operates a small café in Beylagan. He started his business ten years ago. Nadir wants to increase the size of his café. He needs a loan in the amount of $1000.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Maria Haydee

texts.es:
Maria Haydee E. M. is a young wife, she has three children, two of whom are studying primary school. This woman´s business is a general store. She has had the business since she was young. She tells us that the business began when her husband had an accident at work and was put on disability. She tells us that it was very hard at the beginning as she had no idea how she was going to support their children. At one time she had worked in the fields but she realized that work in the city was very different from work in the country.

Maria Haydee´s general store has been gradually growing as she has been working with CEPRODEL over the past 4 years. She feels quite satisfied with the loans granted as they have come at very opportune moments, helping her to supply her business and helping the family's economic situation. She has a record of 6 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Haydee E. M., es una joven casada, tiene tres niños dos de ellos están en estudiando su primaria, el negocio de esta señora es una pulpería, ella desde joven tiene este negocio, nos comenta que el negocio lo comienza cuando su esposo tuvo un accidente en el trabajo y por tal razón lo pensionan. Nos comenta que fue muy duro el inicio de su negocio ya que ella no tenia idea de cómo iba a mantener a sus hijos, en un momento de su vida ella trabajó en el campo pero se dio cuenta que el trabajo de la ciudad es muy diferente al trabajo del campo.

La pulpería de la señora Maria Haydee ha venido mejorando gradualmente a medida que ha venido trabajando con CEPRODEL desde hace 4 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues se los han brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando así a suplir las necesidades del negocio y de la situación económica en que se encontraba su familia, ella tiene un record de 6 créditos.

loans.use: Purchase goods for a general store.

loans.name: Arshad

texts.en: Arshad J. lives in Amirzeyidli village of Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He is 51 years old, married and has four children. He is engaged in cattle-breeding. He started his business 10 years ago. He needs a loan in the amount of $1075 and he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Noemí

texts.en:
Noemí is a 23 year-old woman struggling to earn a living by means of a humble women’s clothing store. Noemí started her store with funds she borrowed from FSMA five months ago. Currently, she operates the business within her house located in Lambedera, in the community of Yamasá. AsiD. from her business, she is a full-time mother with two school-going daughters aged three and six.

In spite of the relatively short period of operation, Noemí could obtain a well-established clientele. Her sense of humor and kindness make the customers feel comfortable when they go to her store to make the purchases. Noemí explains that she would like to see her business grow so that she can keep supporting her children's studies. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothing in bulk and an assortment of fashionable slippers and shoes to increase her inventory and attract new clients.

loans.use: To buy clothing in bulk and other goods for a clothing store.

loans.name: Zarmina

texts.en: Zarmina H. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. She is 43 years old, married and has two children. She is engaged in clothing sales in Beylagan city bazaar. She rented a small booth there. She started her business ten years ago. She needs a loan in the amount of $1200 to purchase more kinds of goods and expand her business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Nasraddin

texts.en: J. Nasraddin lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He is 47 years old, married and has three children. He is engaged in sheep-breeding. He has ten years experience at this business. He needs a loan in the amount of $725 to expand his business and he will purchase ten sheep.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Maria Mercedes G. S. has four school-age children. This woman´s business is the sale of carbonated soft drinks, natural soft drinks and bread. Since she was a young girl she has had experience in this business. This woman tells us that the business began when her husband abandoned her and she realized that the family´s money was not enough for the expenses of her humble home. For that reason she began selling carbonated drinks, soft drinks and bread along the streets of Chichigalpa, which she continues today.

CEPRODEL has been her helping hand, and she has benefited from the acquisition of products by means of loans. She has also known how to get ahead, since she has improved her income in order to maintain her home.

The problem that Mercedes faces is that, despite not having her own stand, she sells out in the open, exposing her drinks to the sun and in the winter, to rain.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Mercedes G. S., tiene cuatro hijos que están en edad escolar, el negocio de esta señora es venta de gaseosas, refrescos naturales y pan, ella desde jovencita tiene experiencia en este negocio. Según cuenta esta señora que el negocio lo comienza cuando su marido la abandona y se da cuenta que el dinero en el núcleo familiar era insuficiente para los gastos de su humilde hogar. Por tal motivo inicia vendiendo las gaseosas, refrescos y pan ambulantemente en las calles de Chichigalpa hasta hoy en día.

CEPRODEL ha sido su mano ayuda ya que la ha beneficiado con la adquisición de sus productos por medio de los créditos. Además ha sabido salir adelante ya que ha mejorado sus ingresos para la manutención de su hogar.

La problemática que atraviesa la señora Mercedes es que a pesar de no contar con un local propio, ella vende a la intemperie exponiendo sus bebidas al sol y en tiempos de invierno a la lluvia.

loans.use: Investment in business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali M. lives in Amirzeyidli village of Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He is 59 years old, married and has five children and five grandchildren. He is engaged in cattle-breeding. He started his business ten years ago. He needs a loan in the amount of $400 to purchase one calf and increase the number of his cows.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Teymur

texts.en: Teymur J. is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Fuzuli city of Azerbaijan. Now he lives with his family in Amirzeyidli village of Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He is 31 years old, married and has three children. He has been engaged in sheep-breeding for more than five years. He has good experience in this business. He applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for a loan in the amount of $1200 to purchase 15 sheep and expand his business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Ifaya

texts.en: Ifaya G. lives in Amirzeyidli village of Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. She is 49 years old, married and has three children. Her husband owns and operates a chemist shop in the village. (Her husband is pictured). They started their business five years ago. They needs a loan in the amount of $900 to purchase more medicine and expand their business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Nelva Jesus

texts.es:
Nelva Jesús is 57 years old. She studied up to fourth graD. of primary school and has 7 children, but only 2 still depend on her for support. She lives in the district of Mache, province of Otuzco, department of La Libertad.

Nelva has a restaurant where she sells breakfast, lunch and dinner and, in addition to this business, she has a store where she sells groceries, soft drinks and some cooking utensils.

Nelva is a member of the "Mujeres D. Mache" communal bank, and from this communal bank she received her first loan, which she used to buy meat, rice, firewood and other ingredients to make her various food dishes. With another loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy beer, soft drinks, rice, pasta, oil and other products for her store as well as to use in preparing meals

Her dream is to live and buy a house in the city of Trujillo.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Nelva Jesús tiene 57 años D. edad, estudió hasta el cuarto grado D. primaria, tiene 7 hijos, pero solo 2 dependen aún D. ella, vive en el distrito D. Mache, provincia D. Otuzco, departamento D. La Libertad.

Nelva tiene un restaurante en el cual venD. desayuno, almuerzo y cena, además D. este negocio tiene una tienda en la que venD. abarrotes, gaseosas y algunos utensilios D. cocina. .

La señora Nelva es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres D. Mache” en este banco comunal recibió un primer préstamo, el cual utilizó para comprar carnes, arroz, leña y otros ingredientes para hacer sus variados platos D. comida. Con el préstamo, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará cerveza, gaseosa, arroz, fideos, aceite y otros productos para su tienda y también para utilizarlos en la preparación D. alimentos.

Su sueño es vivir y tener una casa en la ciudad D. Trujillo.

loans.use: Purchase groceries (rice, sugar, pasta, oil, etc.) and soft drinks.

loans.name: Maria Salome

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Salome N. Juarez is a hard working single mother. She has two children one of which is attending primary school. It is important to note that she was able to finish secondary school, obtained her diploma and later received a technical degree in accounting. In the 1990’s she lost her job at the company where she was working because it went out of business. Due to her situation she decided to start a business and the most adequate for her was a general store.

Currently, to improve her standard of living and support her home, she is requesting a loan from Ceprodel to obtain merchandise from her suppliers. With the 8 loans from this institution she has been able to move ahead and diversify her product offerings, and continue to support her family which depends on her.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Maria Salome N. J., es madre soltera y muy trabajadora. Tiene dos hijos de los cuales uno de ellos está cursando su primaria. Es necesario destacar que ella logró finalizar su secundaria llegando el grado de bachiller y luego estudiar una carrera de técnico medio en contabilidad. Para los años noventa ella es despedida para le empresa donde laboraba debido a que tal empresa fracasó, al verse en esta situación decide abrir un negocio y el mas idóneo que según ella encuentra es el de la pulpería.

Actualmente para mejorar sus condiciones de vida y para el sostenimiento de su hogar realiza créditos en Ceprodel para adquirir su mercadería a los proveedores. Con los 8 créditos brindados en esta institución ha logrado salir adelante diversificando sus productos y llevando el sustento a su familia que depende de ella.

loans.use: Purchase of products

loans.name: Nicolasa Jesus

texts.es:
Mrs. Nicolasa Jesus is 42 years old and has finished secondary school but for personal reasons was not able to work in her field. She has two children that depend on her and she works very hard to get them ahead.

Currently Mrs. Nicolasa sells beauty products. She places orders with each sales campaign and also buys products to have in stock and be able to sell on credit. She has always been involved in a business. Previously she traveled to Lima to bring clothing to fill customer orders and additional ones to sell as a street vendor in the Victoria Market of the La Esperanza district. She had many problems because she did not have a permanent location and therefore stopped this kind of work.

With her first loan of 300 Soles (about USD $100) that she obtained from her community bank “Women in Action” she purchased clothing to fill her orders. With this loan of 2,300 Soles (USD $800) which she will repay in four months, she will purchase beauty products to replenish her inventory and some clothing for she still has some orders.

Mrs. Nicolasa dreams of having a place in the center of the town of Trujillo to establish a boutique.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Nicolasa Jesús tiene 42 años de edad, estudió superior completa, pero no pudo ejercer su carrera por motivos personales. Tiene dos hijos que aún dependen de ella y por los cuales trabaja mucho para sacarlos adelante.

Actualmente la señora Nicolasa se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza. Hace pedidos en cada campaña y también compra productos en oferta para tenerlos en stock y así también poder vender al crédito. Ella siempre se ha dedicado al negocio, antes viajaba a la ciudad de Lima para traer ropa de acuerdo a los pedidos que le hacían sus clientes y también parte de estos productos los vendía como ambulante en el Mercado Victoria” del distrito de La Esperanza, pero tenía muchos problemas debido a que no tenía un puesto fijo, así es que dejó de trabajar de esa manera.

Con su primer préstamo de S/. 300 que recibió en su banco comunal “Mujeres en Acción” compró ropa que en ese entonces le habían pedido. Con el préstamo de S/. 2,300, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará productos de belleza para reponer su stock y también algo de ropa ya que tiene algunos pedidos.

El sueño de la señora Nicolasa es tener un local en el centro de Trujillo para poner una boutique.

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products

loans.name: Afsar

texts.en: Afsar J. lives in Amirzeyidli village of Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He is 49 years old, married and has two children. He has been engaged in cattle-breeding for more than 15 years. He borrowed 3 loans from Normicro Beylagan Branch and used these loans for his business. Now he needs a loan in the amount of $800 to buy a calf as he wants to increase the number of his cows.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Ruth Maria

texts.es:
Ruth María is 45 years old. She completed secondary school and has three children and only one, a 15-year-old girl, still depends on her. She lives in Anexo Roma in the Casa Grande district, province of Ascope.

Ruth has various economic activities. She first started by selling juices and shambar (a soup typical of the city of Trujillo which is prepared every Monday) and later on, with her earnings started up a small grocery store. She also sells breakfasts in the morning and anticuchos (beef heart marinated, skewered, and seered over a grill) in the evenings. She is very content because this is the way she has been able to get ahead with her daughter since she was widowed 13 years ago.

She is a member and President of the "Romanas Luchadoras II" community bank. In this bank she obtained her first loan, with which she bought a small kitchen to prepare breakfasts. With another loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy rice, sugar, milk, pasta, jams, etc. so that she can continue supplying her grocery store.

Ruth, in addition to the various economic activities she does, also helps her community. She is a member of the Committee to Support the Police, President of the APAFA of an educational institution called "Víctor Raúl Haya de la Torre", a promotor for citizen safety and Press and Publicity Secretary of the Civil Defense Committee.

She dreams of having a bigger business, which will allow her to help her daughter with higher education.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ruth María tiene 45 años de edad, estudió secundaria completa y tiene tres hijos y sólo una adolescente de 15 años depende de ella. Vive en el Anexo Roma del distrito de Casa Grande, provincia de Ascope.

La señora Ruth realiza diferentes actividades económicas, primero se inició vendiendo jugos y shambar (sopa típica de la ciudad de Trujillo que se prepara los lunes) y posteriormente con las ganancias que tuvo fue implementando una pequeña bodega. Actualmente también vende desayuno por las mañanas y anticuchos por las noches. Se siente muy contenta porque de este modo pudo sacar adelante a su última hija debido a que enviudó hace 13 años.

Es socia y Presidenta del banco comunal “Romanas Luchadoras II”, en este banco obtuvo un primer préstamo con lo cual compró una cocina pequeña para preparar los desayunos. Con el préstamo, el cual pagará en 4 meses comprará arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, conservas, etc. para seguir surtiendo su bodega.

La señora Ruth además de realizar varias actividades económicas también trabaja en beneficio de su comunidad. Es integrante del Comité de Apoyo a la Policía, Presidenta de la APAFA de la Institución Educativa “Víctor Raúl Haya de la Torre”, promotora de seguridad ciudadana y Secretaria de Prensa y Propaganda del Comité de Defensa Civil. Sueña con tener un negocio más grande que le permita apoyar a su hija con sus estudios superiores.

loans.use: Purchase groceries (rice, sugar, milk, etc.)

loans.name: Martha Lucila

texts.es:
Martha Lucila M. is the mother of 4 children who are currently attending high school. For about 14 years, she's been selling food in the city of Chinandega, specifically in the city's municipal market. Her business began when her partner in life lost his job and although he devoted himself to finding a job was unsuccessful. This obviously resulted in a household crisis, and Martha had not alternative and decided, along with her husband, to invest their savings in a general store.

To fulfill her need in acquiring products for her store, Martha has been working with CEPRODEL for 4 years and is very happy with her loans because they have been provided during times when she needed them the most. Currently, she has a record of 19 loans, which of course, have been paid in a timely manner in accordance with the provisions set forth by CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Martha Lucila M. es madre de 4 hijos que actualmente están estudiando la secundaria, el negocio de esta señora es venta de comida desde hace 14 años en la ciudad de Chinandega, específicamente en el mercado municipal de Chichigalpa. Su negocio lo inicia al quedar su compañero de vida sin trabajo y al dedicarse a buscar otro empleo no lo encontraba y por tal motivo la crisis se venia apoderando de su hogar. Como no encontraba alternativa, la señora M. decide invertir junto con su esposo sus ahorros para la implementación de la pulpería.

Para suplir su necesidad de adquisición de los productos para la pulpería, doña Martha trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 4 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues se los han brindados en el momento que mas los ha necesitado. Actualmente ella tiene un record de 19 créditos que por supuesto han sido pagados en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell in her store. (Adquisicion de los productos)

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
“It’s been some time since my new house has been finished, but I really feel it is not safe. I would like to put window protections before I bring my family to live here. The thing I worry most about is their safety and I therefore ask for $500 dls to install the window protections at my home.”

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

“Hace poco tiempo que me entregaron mi casa pero la verdad la siento muy insegura y me gustaría poner las protecciones en las ventanas antes de llevar a vivir a mi familia ahí más que nada en el mundo me preocupa la seguridad de ellos”. Solicito $ 500.00 dlls para instalar protecciones en las ventanas de mi vivienda.

loans.use: To put window protections at my new home before I bring my family to live there

loans.name: Mayra Carina

texts.es:
The selling of prepared meals is a business which is very important because there are many people who, for certain circumstances are unable to eat in their homes, so they have to buy food from establishments that have a good reputation and that they can trust. In Chichigalpa, Mrs. Mayra Carina A. P., runs such a business and has the reputation of of being an excellent cook who offers a variety of many different dishes to her clients.

She began her business 10 years ago because she needed to care for her elderly parents, and through the years has been improving her business by offering a variety of dishes. Her need now is to procure the ingredients to further develop the delicious dishes that only she knows how to prepare. It is for this reason that Mrs. Mayra has been working with CEPRODEL for 4 years and is very happy with the loans because they have been provided in a timely manner. And have helped her meet the daily needs of her business and her customers. She has a record of 25 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

La venta de comida es un negocio muy importante ya que son muchas las personas que por determinadas circunstancias no tienen la posibilidad de comer en sus hogares sino que compran sus alimentos en lugares de mucha confianza y reconocimiento. En Chichigalpa, la señora Mayra Carina A. P. se dedica al negocio de venta de alimentos y se ha caracterizado por ser un excelentísima cocinera brindando diversidad de platillos a todos sus chelines.

Inicio su negocio hace 10 años con la necesidad de atender a sus ancianos padres y a través de los años ha venido mejorando su negocio ofreciendo diversidad de platillos. Su necesidad actualmente es la adquisición de los ingredientes para seguir elaborando los deliciosos platillos que solo ella sabe preparar. Es por tal motivo que doña Mayra trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 4 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues le han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando a sí a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. Ella tiene un record de 25 créditos.

loans.use: To purchase top quality products for her business. (Compra de materia prima para el negocio.)

loans.name: Mercedes Concepción

texts.es:
Mercedes Concepcion F. V. owns a sewing workshop. From the time she was a young girl she has shown skill for this work, and today serves as a seamstress in the city of Chinandega. Her business began when her husband went out of work and support ran out for their children, so she began looking for ways to buy a sewing machine so she could work as a seamstress.

With little savings she decided to put a sign outside of her home with the phrase "all types of dresses made to order". This is how she really began to work, by attracting the attention of various people who have since become her customers.

Mercedes has been working with CEPRODEL for 4 years and is very happy with the loans because they have been provided in a timely manner, which in turn have helped her meet the needs of her business and satisfy her customers. She has a record of 7 loans with CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Mercedes Concepción F. V. es una dama que posee el negocio de taller de costura, ella desde muy niña ha demostrado la habilidad para esta labor y hoy en día se desempeña como costurera en la ciudad de Chinandega específicamente en Chichigalpa. Su negocio lo comienza cuando su esposo queda sin trabajo y por el apoyo que debía de dar a sus hijos, busca la manera de cómo adquirir su maquina para realizar sus trabajos de costurera.

Con los pocos ahorros que ella posee decide poner un rotulo en las afueras de su local con la frase “se hacen vestidos de todo tipo” es a si que ella comienza a trabajar por si sola captando la atención de varias personas que posteriormenente se convirtieron en sus clientes.

Mercedes trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 4 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados ya que se los han brindado en el momento oportuno, ayudando a sí a suplir las necesidades del negocio y poder satisfacer a los clientes con los pedidos que le hacen, ella tiene un record de 7 créditos.

loans.use: To purchase threads, fabrics and supplies for her shop. (Compra de hilos, bobinas, telas)

loans.name: Mercedes Felicita

texts.es:
Mercedes Felicita Hernandez S. is a married lady, with 1 school aged child. This lady's business is selling tortillas and she has been doing so for 42 years in the Chichigalpa municipal market.

This lady works very hard. She starts each day very early in the morning and prepares her delicious tortillas, which are very much in demand by her faithful customers. What she needs the most to purchase is corn, coal and wood for the preparation of her tortillas. For this reason, Mrs. Mercedes has worked with CEPRODEL for 4 years and is very happy with her loans because she has been able to acquire her products without any problems. She has a record of 24 loans to-date.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Mercedes Felicita H. S. es una señora casada y con 1 hijo en edad escolar, el negocio de esta señora es la venta de tortillas, desde hace 42 años se dedica a este negocio en el mercado municipal de Chichigalpa.

Es una dama muy esforzada debido a que todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la madrugada comienza a elaborar las deliciosas tortillas que por cierto son muy demandadas por sus fieles clientes. Actualmente su mayor necesidad es la compra de maíz, cal y leña para la elaboración de las tortillas. Por tal razón, doña Mercedes trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 4 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados debido a que ha adquirido sus materiales sin ningún problema. Ella tiene un record de 24 créditos.

loans.use: To purchase corn, coal, and firewood. (Compra de maíz, cal, y leña)

loans.name: Nery Carmen

texts.es:
Nery Carmen T. Perez is the mother of two girls (ages 3 and 1 respectively). This woman's business is selling clothing and she tells us that she married at a very young age and had no experience with this type of work, as she previously helped her mother do housework. She established her business when her husband was unable to meet their household expenses, due to the fact that that his income was too low, and this way, the two of them began working hard to support their two beloved daughters.

Mrs. Nery has workded with CEPRODEL for 4 years now, and is very happy with the loans which have already been provided. They have helped her meet the needs of her business and her customers. To date, she has had 20 loans with CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Nery Carmen T. P. es madre de dos niñas en edades de tres y un año, el negocio de esta señora es la venta de ropa y según cuenta, se casó muy joven y en ese momento no tenía ninguna idea en lo que respecta al negocio de venta de ropa ya que anteriormente ella le ayudaba a su mamá en los quehaceres de la casa. El negocio de la venta de ropa lo comienza cuando su esposo no logra cubrir los gastos del hogar por recibir bajos ingresos, de esta manera entre ambos comienzan a trabajar fuertemente por llevar el sustento a sus dos amadas hijas.

Doña Nery trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 4 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados ya que le han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando a sí a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. Ella tiene un record de 20 créditos.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for sale in her business. (Compra de ropa)

loans.name: Elia

texts.es:
Mrs. Elia is a 43 year-old single mother with a 9 year-old son named Juan Carlos who is the light of her life and the inspiration for her progress. Elia has been dedicated to the tailoring of suits, linen and other garments. It is sad for her to be alone with her son and therefore she spends as much time as possible to dressmaking in order to forget about this sad episode of her life and to be able to support her economic needs. Thanks to her skill and ability in the textile field, she worked at a very well-known store in the area, but this caused negligence toward her young son and now she has opened her own sewing workshop at home and it has been very successful as she has a good clientele. Doña Elia wishes to establish her own textile enterprise to live in peace without worries and she needs investment capital to put this into effect. Let us support this talented and hard-working mother to keep on working arduously to make progress.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Elia de 43 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un pequeño hijo de 09 años de edad de nombre Juan Carlos, que se ha convertido en la luz de su vida y le ha devuelto las ganas de progresar. Elia desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica al arte textil en la confección de trajes, lencerías y otros, para ella es muy triste estar sola con su hijo, es por eso que se dedica el mayor tiempo posible a la costura con el afán de olvidar este triste episodio de su vida y sustentar sus necesidades económicas, gracias a su destreza y a sus habilidades en este campo textil trabajó en una tienda muy conocida en la zona, pero eso causaba el descuido de su pequeño hijo, ahora abrió su propia textilería en casa y la está aprovechando al máximo ya que tiene una buena clientela.Para la señora Elia el único interés para vivir tranquila sin preocupaciones es formar su propia empresa textil y para ello necesita un capital de inversión para su implementación. Apoyemos a esta madre que con talento y esfuerzo sigue trabajando arduamente por progresar.

loans.use: Capital to start a sewing workshop.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos is a 22 year old man who lives with his parents and two younger brothers. It has been two years since he opened a tire store where he also sells new and used tires.

He hopes that in this business he is able to save and have enough to have a family in the future. Carlos is asking for a loan so that he may buy bigger quantities of used tires in order to fix them to sell. With a greater amount of tires he will increase his sales and better his income.

loans.use: To buy more tires.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.en:
Nicholas B. is a widowed man at the age of 37 and lives with his two children.  He has been the head of a mechanic shop for six years.  After saving a little money from his previous job, he was able to open his own shop.  Nicholas received his first job working with his uncle in the mechanic shop right out of school.  His uncle had offered to pay his tuition for school if he promised to work for him after graduating.  
After the death of his wife, Nicholas let the business slip as he went into a depression.  But he realized that he had to continue fighting to make enough money to support his children.  It is now stronger and more profitable than ever.  It was his wife’s dream to see their children growing up and becoming professionals in whichever field they choose to study. 
Nicholas is asking for a loan today to buy oil and air filters, brake fluid, motor oil, carburetors, light bulbs, and other various car parts.

loans.use: To buy oil and air filters, brake fluid, motor oil, carburetors, and other various car parts for his shop.

loans.name: Tania

texts.es:
Mrs. Tania has been selling food at night for a long time, typical regional dishes such as “juanes”, fish wrapped in husk or leaves, among others. She is a 33 year-old single mother with two beautiful children named Anthony and Naysha who are students and her inspiration to make progress. Her intention is to expand her business and buy a counter in order to sell cold beverages (beer and soft drinks) and the loan will be used for that purpose. With your support make this hardworking mother’s dream come true for the well-being of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Tania vende comida por la noches desde hace mucho tiempo, se dedica a la venta de platos típicos de la región (juanes, pescado envuelto en hoja entre otros), tiene 33 años y es madre soltera sus dos hermosos hijos de nombres Anthony y Naysha están estudiando y son sus aspiraciones de progreso. Ella tiene un propósito, ampliar su negocio y comprar un exhibidor para vender bebidas heladas(cervezas y gaseosas), pero para este objetivo le urge un préstamo. Con tu apoyo has posible el sueño de esta madre que trabaja incansablemente por el bienestar de los suyos.

loans.use: Expand business of food sales.

loans.name: Salvith

texts.es:
Señora Salvith, who is thirty-years-old and is the mother of three children, makes a living by selling empanadas. She has done this for a long time. Her husband is señor Mariano, sho supports her occasionally by delivering and/or attending to the orders of their clients. She gets up very early to prepare this appetizer to take them to sell in a very well-known institute in their region. She also delivers them to some small grocery stores in the city of Pucallpa. She and her husband work with much care to see their children be happy and so they will soon become excellent professionals. Salvith has an objective of growing her business and starting a sales kiosk for her empanadas, and this is why she needs capital to fulfill her goal. With your help, señora Salvith will acheive her objective in a short time.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Salvith, de 30 años de edad es madre de 03 hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de empanadas desde hace mucho tiempo, su esposo el señor Mariano la apoya ocasionalmente repartiendo y/ o atendiendo los pedidos de sus clientes.Ella se levanta muy temprano a preparar este aperitivo para llevar a venderlos en un Instituto muy reconocido de su región y también para repartirlas a algunas bodeguitas de la ciudad de Pucallpa. Ella y su esposo trabajan con mucho esmero para ver felices a sus hijos y para que pronto se conviertan en excelentes profesionales.Salvith tiene un objetivo acrecentar su negocio y poner su Kiosco de venta de empanadas es por eso que requiere de un capital para cumplir su propósito. Con tu ayuda la señora Salvith logrará su objetivo en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Construction and implementation of a small sales space

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es:
Mrs. Jovita’s daily activity is retail sale of bananas. Doña Jovita describes herself as a hardworking lady who has the capacity to fight for what she wants. Her product is sold at a very well-known harbor of Malecón Grau where her bananas are very popular among a large group of people. Jovita is a 46 year-old single mother of five children who are independent with their own families and therefore she is always praying to the almighty to protect them and, above all, guide them. She wishes to invest in her business and also start selling cds and cosmetics and she needs capital to make her achieve her purpose. She awaits the unselfish support from your noble heart.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La venta al por menor de un producto comestible (plátanos) es la actividad diaria de la señora, Jovita, quien se califica como una mujer emprendedora y sobre todo capaz de luchar para conseguir sus propósitos, dichos productos los vende en un puerto muy conocido del Malecón Grau ya que existe una gran acogida de personas que degustan de este producto. Jovita a sus 46 años de edad es madre soltera y tiene cinco hijos los cuales ya son independientes y poseen sus propias familias, es por eso que siempre le pide al todo poderoso que los proteja y sobre todo los guíe por el buen camino. Ella quiere invertir en su negocio y también quiere dedicarse a la venta de CDS y productos de belleza, y para ello requiere de un capital el cual la ayudará a lograr sus objetivos. Ella espera la ayuda desinteresada de tu noble corazón.

loans.use: To increase sales and add other products to business.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Carmen is an expert in the preparation of the typical dish from the coastal area of her country, “ceviche” (fish dish) as her secret is the mixture of the best ingredients and the particular flavor acquired through her patience and cleanliness and that is the reason why she is totally dedicated to this business and is highly approved by her customers who never stop consuming her delicious “ceviche”. Together with her husband, don William who helps her attend the clients promptly, she has 4 children, the oldest, professional and independent and three young ones still in school. It is doña Carmen’s wish to open a “cevichería” in an appropriate environment, offering the necessary comfort to her customers and therefore she has rented premises but they still need to be fit properly so she can move. With your support you can make doña Carmen’s dream come true in a short period of time.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Carmen es una experta en la preparación del plato típico de la costa de su país, el ceviche, ya que su secreto está en la mezcla de los mejores ingredientes y el sabor particular que adquiere con su paciencia y limpieza, es por eso que se dedica a fondo en este negocio y tiene la importante acogida de sus clientes quienes no dejan de ir a consumir su delicioso ceviche. Ella junto a su esposo el señor William, quien la apoya atendiendo las solicitudes de sus clientes de manera inmediata, tienen 04 hijos siendo el mayor de ellos ya profesional e independiente y tres aún pequeños en edad escolar. La señora Carmen tiene el deseo de poner su cevichería en un lugar apropiado donde brinde la comodidad necesaria a sus clientes, y para eso ya tiene alquilado un local al cual solo le falta la adecuada ambientación para trasladarse. Con tu ayuda harás posible el sueño de la señora Carmen en el tiempo menos pensado.

loans.use: Implementation and setting of a new "cevichería" (fish dish restaurant).

loans.name: Ladimiro

texts.en:
Ladrimiro C. is a successful father and dedicated husband. He has three children, one who is studying nutrition, another who is studying law, and his youngest is still in elementary school. Ladimiro began a small grocery store in 1995 with a small capital of savings which he earned as a carpenter. He was assisted by his wife who prepared and cooked empanadas, pies and other foods to sell at their store. Today it has grown greater and become more popular.

He is asking for a loan so that he may expand the variety of goods that are sold in his store. Flip flops, backpacks, mops and brooms, along with rice, oil, pasta and powdered drinks, are all goods that he will add to his store.

loans.use: To buy flip flops, backpacks, brooms, mops, rice, cans of oil, pasta, flour, and powdered drinks.

loans.name: Paula Antonia

texts.es:
Paula Antonia P. M. is a woman that, for the past six years, has been dedicated to her grocery store, located at the Chichigalpa municipal market in Chinandega.

Since she started her business she has gone through very difficult circumstances, as she is a single mother, who is responsible for her three school-age children. In spite of her low income, she has managed to give her children the education they deserve, supporting them unconditionally and meeting all their needs. In order to advance, Paula has been working with CEPRODEL for four years. She is very satisfied with the obtained loans, as they have been granted timely, enabling her to buy new products to sell at her store. She has a record of 17 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Paula Antonia P. M. es una dama que desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de productos varios (pulpería), teniendo su negocio en el interior del mercado municipal de Chichigalpa en Chinandega.

Desde que inició su negocio, ha pasado por circunstancias muy difíciles debido a que es madre soltera y con la responsabilidad de mantener a sus tres hijos en edad escolar. A pesar de sus bajos ingresos económicos, ha sabido darle a sus hijos la educación que se merecen, cubriéndoles todas sus necesidades y apoyo incondicional en sus estudios. Para poder salir adelante, Paula trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 4 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos recibidos, pues se le otorgaron en el momento más oportuno, ayudando así a suplir las necesidades del negocio, en la compra de nuevos productos para la pulpería. Ella tiene un record de 17 créditos.

loans.use: Investment in her grocery store stock.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan O. is a thirty one year old man who is an automobile electrician.  He opened his own shop five years ago.  Since then he has attracted a great clientele and makes enough money to support his small family of three.  His dream is that one day his son will grow into a successful adult.
He is asking for a loan in order to buy car batteries, distilled water, cable, sockets, alternators, light bulbs and other car parts.  His plans for the future are to increase his business and include his wife.  She hopes to attach a small convenience store to the auto shop.

loans.use: To buy batteries, distilled water, reels, plugs, sockets, cables, copper, alternators and light bulbs.

loans.name: Leyla

texts.es:
Leyla has her grocery store in a very appropriate location. She sells provisions (rice, milk, eggs, sugar, etc.) and has been doing it for a while. She is 35 years of age and the mother of four children, who are her inspiration to progress. Her husband, Felix, who also works in the grocery store, agrees with all her decisions and both have proposed to offer everything necessary to each member of their household for their complete personal and professional development.
