Leyla wishes to expand her business, and of course with time, set up a mini-market. To accomplish this goal, she needs a loan. With your help, she will accomplish her greatest goal in a very short time.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Leyla, tiene su bodega en un lugar muy apropiado, se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad (arroz, leche, huevo, azúcar, etc), desde hace mucho tiempo, tiene 35 años de edad y es madre de cuatro hijos, quienes son su aspiración de progreso, su esposo el señor, Félix, quien también se dedica a la venta de abarrotes esta de acuerdo en todo lo que ella decide y ambos se han propuesto brindarles lo necesario a cada uno de los miembros de su hogar para su completo desarrollo personal y profesional.Leyla sólo quiere acrecentar su negocio y con el tiempo desde luego llegar a poner su minimarket, para cumplir este fin solicita un préstamo. Con tu ayuda logrará su sueño más anhelado en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Increase capital to expand her business and increase the amounts and varieties of the products she offers.

loans.name: Pilar Del Socorro

texts.es:
The sale of plastic bags is the business with which with much effort Pilar del Socorrro S. T. makes a living since 8 years ago. Her business is in the municipal market of Chichigalpa and is characterized by the visits of many people seeking plastic bags for certain uses. That is the reason why she has looked for a way to increase sales and supply her clients' needs.

Mrs. T. requests loans to CEPRODEL to remodel and extend her business, since she does not have enough money to grow her business on her own. With these credits she has been able to improve her situation by allowing her to sell a greater quantity of bags and saving up for the remodelling of the shop. Currently she has a credit history of 8 loans with CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


La venta de bolsas plásticas es el negocio al que muy esforzadamente se dedica la señora Pilar del Socorro S. T. desde hace nueve años en el mercado municipal de Chichigalpa. El negocio de la señora T. se caracteriza por ser muy visitado por personas que buscan bolsas plásticas para determinados usos y es por esta razón que ha buscado la manera de incrementar su negocio para satisfacer sus necesidades.

Una necesidad que atraviesa la señora Terna es que a pesar de que no cuenta con suficiente dinero para ampliar su negocio, solicita créditos en Ceprodel para ir remodelando su local poco a poco. Estos créditos le han sido otorgados directamente para su negocio y según comenta ha logrado mejorar en parte su situación vendiendo mas cantidades de bolsas y ahorrando para la remodelación de su local. Actualmente tiene un record crediticio de 8 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: Purchasing plastic bags / Compra de las bolsas plasticas

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio is 60 years of age and is a single father with five children, of which four are now independent and have families of their own. That leaves him in the company of his youngest child, who is thirteen years old and in school, and is his reason for living and progressing. Julio works arduously to give him everything necessary for his development. Julio sells fruits and beverages, and his principal clientele are employees of a renowned corporation (Electro Ucayali), which makes him feel satisfied about being a resourceful asset to society. It is important to him that he continues growing his business, and with time, set up a kiosk for the sale of fruits. Julio awaits the disinterested support of your kind heart.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Julio de 60 años de edad es padre soltero y tiene cinco hijos, de los cuales cuatro ya se independizaron y han compuesto sus respectivas familias, quedándose sólo en compañía del más pequeño de trece años quien estudia y es la razón de su vida y progreso, el señor Julio trabaja arduamente para darle lo necesario para su completo desarrollo.El señor julio se dedica a la venta de frutas y refrescos, teniendo como principales clientes a los funcionarios de una empresa muy reconocida (Electro Ucayali), por lo que él se siente satisfecho de ser un hombre útil a la sociedad, lo más importante es seguir surgiendo incrementando su negocio y con el tiempo poner un kiosco para la venta de frutas. El señor Julio espera el apoyo desinteresado de tu amable corazón.

loans.use: Increase capital to expand his fruit and beverage business.

loans.name: Felícita

texts.es:
Felicita sells treated water by delivery and according to her clients’ orders. She has been doing this for a very long time. She is 37 years of age and has five children, for whom she wishes to progress. Her husband, Carlos supports her tremendously, being that he distributes the water to their clients. Her greatest wish is to offer her children a higher education, and that they take full advantage of it and become professionals. Felicita is determined to continue selling treated water and also has in mind setting up a cold beverage bar. With these goals in mind, she requires of investment capital to achieve her objectives in the least time possible. With your help, Felicita will accomplish her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Felicita se dedica a la venta de agua tratada a domicilio y deacuerdo a la demanda de cada uno de sus clientes. Ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace mucho tiempo, tiene 37 años y es madre de cinco hijos, por quienes desea progresar, su esposo el señor Carlos la apoya bastante ya que él reparte el agua a sus clientes.Su anhelo más grande es brindarle estudios superiores, y que los mismos aprovechen al máximo y sean unos profesionales.Felícita tiene el firme propósito de seguir vendiendo agua tratada y también tiene en mente poner su bar ( venta de bebidas heladas). Con estos propósitos en mente requiere de un capital de inversión para lograr su objetivo en el tiempo menos pensado. Con tu ayuda la señora Felícita logrará su propósito.

loans.use: Increase capital to offer greater quantities of water and implement a small cold beverage bar.

loans.name: Rafaela De Los Ángel

texts.es:
Rafaela de los Angeles T. R., married, has two daughters that are in school. Her business is a general store. Since she was young she has worked in this type of business. It's necessary to point out that since she got married, her husband has always been by her side and that of her children, but now with the high cost of living and her two daughters that are studying at the university, she felt it necessary to help her husband with the expenses of the home. This is how she, with the experience she had , decided to open her own business. She tells us that at the beginning she felt shy about selling but now she has become accustomed to the business.

WIth the experience that she has had at the general store, the business has been strengthened and in this way, she has been able to prepare a better future for her children.

Dona Rafaela has worked with CEPRODEL for 4 years and feels very satisfied with the credit that she has already been given that have supported her to increase her sales and to make her small place of work bigger. She has a record of 9 credits.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer. Rafaela de los Ángeles T. R., casada, tiene dos hijas las que están estudiando, el negocio de esta señora es una pulpería, ella desde joven ha trabajado vendiendo en este tipo de negocio. Es necesario destacar que desde que se casó el esposo siempre ha estado a la par de ella y de sus hijos, pero ahora con el alto costo de la vida y que sus dos hijas están estudiando en la universidad sintió la necesidad de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, es así que ella con la experiencia que ya tenía decide poner su propio negocio, nos cuenta que al comienzo sentía timidez al vender pero que ahora ya se acostumbró al negocio Con la experiencia que ha tenido en la pulpería, el negocio lo fue fortaleciendo, y de esta manera ha podido estar preparando a sus hijos para un mejor futuro.

Doña Rafaela trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 4 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados ya que la han apoyado para la mejora de sus ventas y la ampliación de su humilde local de trabajo.Ella tiene un record de 9 créditos.

loans.use: Investing in a general store

loans.name: Maria Antonia's Group

texts.en:
Zenaida, Maria, and Candelaria are members of the community bank “Retoño”. Maria and Candelaria have been members for eight years, and Zenaida for eight months. In that time they have learned to be responsible, punctual and to save. They have also learned values such as self-esteem and solidarity.

Zenaida is 24 years old and has one 18-month-old daughter. Zenaida runs a business selling construction products. Her husband started the business, but Zenaida has been running it for two years. Before that she raised pigs.

Maria is 51 years old. She has five children, one of whom lives with her. Maria owns a small restaurant that specializes in meat dishes. She started this business 25 years ago, and it has continued to grow little by little. Candelaria is 26 years old, and has one eight-year-old son. She started a “hospedaje”, or boarding house, eight years ago. Now, with help from the community bank she runs two and is hoping to open a small salon with her new loan.

Zenaida, Maria, and Candelaria need loans of 400, 800, and 800 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying wood, soft drinks, juices, and opening a salon.

The community bank emphasizes the importance of saving and each associate has an interest earning savings account. Zenaida, Maria, and Candelaria are saving to buy another piece of land, invest in a daughter’s coffee growing business, and to pay for the education of their children. Their dreams are to continue working, continue developing their businesses, and that their children will have a better life.

loans.use: Zenaida, Maria, and Candelaria need loans of 400, 800, and 800 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying wood, soft drinks, juices, and opening a salon.

loans.name: Natalia's Group

texts.en:
Natalia, Elizabeth and MarieL. are members of the community bank “Retoño”. Elizabeth has been a member for almost four years, but Natalia and Elizabeth recently joined. As members of the community bank they have learned how to work more productively, to be responsible, to be punctual, and to save.

Natalia is 42 years old and has four children. She has been selling fruit at the airport for one year. With her new loan she plans to start selling soft drinks and candy as well.

Elizabeth is 26 and has three children who are 8, 6, and 3 years old. She and her husband run a business making hats. They have been running this business for several years. With her new loan she plans to start exporting hats to Bolivia.

MarieL. is 22 years old and has a three-month-old son. Previous to having her baby she owned a restaurant. At the moment, she is concentrating on raising her son. Maria will use her loan to help her brother who owns a “recreo” which is a business where there are a variety of recreational activities such as swimming, a café, and sports fields.

Natalia, Elizabeth and MarieL. need loans of 400, 800, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying soft drinks, candies, shipping supplies, and helping their brother. They dream of owning their home, having machines for their business, and that their children will have a better life.

loans.use: Natalia, Elizabeth and Mariela need loans of 400, 800, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying soft drinks, candies, shipping supplies, and helping their brother.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.en:
Maria is 28 years old and has three children. She has been a member of the community bank “Retoño” for one year. She says that the community bank has helped her learn how to run her business efficiently.

Maria’s husband is sick and she now has to support the family. When she started with the community bank she had nothing. Now, thanks to her loan, she has a small store. She travels to different markets and buys fruits, vegetables, and grains, which she then sells from her store in the city of Ayacucho.

Maria needs a loan of 2000 soles (3 soles = $1) to buy a stand to set up in the markets where she currently only buys her merchandise. Maria dreams of continuing to be able to save, expanding her business, and that her children will have a better life.

loans.use: Maria needs a loan of 2000 soles (3 soles = $1) to buy a stand to set up in the markets where she currently only buys her merchandise.

loans.name: Roger De La Trinidad

texts.es:
In the city of Chinandega, specifically in Chichigalpa, Mr. Roger Trinidad Cortes M. sells several products in his general store which he has managed to grow for 10 years with great effort. Like all startups, Mr. Trinidad had a rough time in the beginning when he had few products to sell. With time, he slowly increased the variety of products up until having a full stocked general store today.

As he advises us, his sole motive to run the store today is to provide for his humble family which is undergoing a tough economic situation. However, with the support of Mr. Trinidad they have the hope of raising up and moving on from the situation they are currently at.

CEPRODEL has been an inseparable companion of Mr. Trinidad. He has benefited from the credits he has obtained investing them in his business to purchase more products and improve the living conditions in his home. Currently, he has three credits with this financial institution.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


En la ciudad de Chinandega específicamente en Chichigalpa, el señor Roger de la Trinidad C. M. se dedica al negocio de venta de productos varios (pulpería) que con gran ahínco ha logrado administrar desde hace 10 largos años. Como todo inicio es duro, el señor Trinidad comenzó vendiendo pocos productos que luego los fue diversificando hasta llegar a tener la pulpería que hoy posee.

Según comenta, el único motivo por el cual se ha dedicado a este trabajo es para mantener a su humilde familia que atraviesa difíciles circunstancias económicas pero con el apoyo del señor Trinidad tienen esperanza de levantarse y salir de la situación en que se encuentran.

Ceprodel ha sido un inseparable apoyo para el señor Trinidad debido a que ha sido beneficiado con créditos que los ha invertido en su negocio para adquirir sus productos y además para mejorar las condiciones de su hogar. Actualmente posee una cuenta de tres créditos con esta institución financiera.

loans.use: Business investment

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
Ana Maria has been a member of the community bank “Retoño” for two years.  In that time she has learned that she has self worth, and can be independent. Ana Maria is 26 years old.  She has two daughters, one of whom is four and the other one.  
 Ana Maria’s business is selling wood products.  She has been selling them for four years.
Ana Maria needs a loan of 2000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will invest in her business.  Ana Maria hopes to improve her business by buying more wood and also a greater variety of wood.  
The community bank emphasizes the importance of saving, and each associate has an interest earning account.  Ana Maria is saving to buy a car, which will help her transport her merchandise.  Her dream is to have a nice home and to be comfortable.

loans.use: Ana Maria needs a loan of 2000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will invest in her business.  Ana Maria hopes to improve her business by buying more wood and also a greater variety of wood.

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
Rosa Emilia Davila, single. Her business is cheese sales. She has had this business for 11 years. She tells us that since she was very young she has liked the business. She has always liked the work. She began to work in cheese sales at the age of thirteen, but these sales were for the woman that she worked for. Eleven years ago her first husband left her and that is when she decided to work in another way from the way she previously worked because the income of the family would no longer be the same. That is when she made contacts with the purveyors of cheese so that she could get credit and pay each week.

This business began 11 years ago. She tells us that she has always done well with the business because the location is very good and she already has a clientele. Despite all of this, Dona Rosa has worked with CEPRODEL for 2 years and she feels very satisfied with the credits that were given to her in an opportune moment, helping her to supplement the business's needs and to satisfy her daily clientele. She has a record of 5 credits.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer. Rosa Emilia D., soltera, el negocio de esta señor es venta de queso, tiene 11 años de tener este negocio, nos cuenta que desde joven le ha gustado el negocio, siempre le gusto el trabajo, comenzó a la edad de trece a trabajar en la venta del queso, pero esta venta era de una señora a quien ella le trabajaba, hace once años su primer esposo la abandona y es cuando decide trabajar de otra forma distinta a la que el lo había hecho anteriormente, ya que los ingresos para la familia ya no serian iguales, es entonces que hace los contactos con los proveedores del queso para que se lo dejen al crédito para pagarlo a la semana.

Este negocio lo comenzó hace 11 años, nos cuenta que en el negocio siempre le ha ido bien ya que la ubicación es muy buena y además ya tiene clientela. A pesar de esto, doña Rosa trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 2 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues les han brindado en el momento oportuno, ayudando así a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a su clientela. Ella tiene un record de 5 créditos.

loans.use: To buy cheese

loans.name: Rosa Marlenis

texts.es:
Doña Rosa Marlenis M. is a woman who makes a living by selling food. She started gaining experience in this line of work when she was young, since she previously worked with a woman who made food. She tells us that she started her business when she noticed that her husband's income wasn't enough to support their nuclear family. This is why she started selling food only at night at in their home, and she says that this helped her because her husband later abandoned her when their children were still small.

Doña Rosa has worked with CEPRODEL for four years, and she feels very satisfied with the credits offered to her. They came at opportune moments, helping her to supply the necessities to her business. She has a record of 21 credits.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Doña Rosa Marlenis M. es una dama que se dedica al negocio de venta de comida, ella desde joven tiene experiencia en lo que respecta al negocio, ya que anteriormente ella trabajó con una señora en la elaboración de los alimentos. Nos cuenta que el negocio lo comienza cuando nota que los ingresos de su esposo no le ayudan para mantener el núcleo familiar, por lo que comienza a vender comida solo por las noches en su casa y según dice, esto le ayudó porque posteriormente su esposo la abandona cuando sus hijos todavía estaban pequeños.

Doña Rosa trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 4años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues se les ha brindado en el momento oportuno, ayudando a sí a suplir las necesidades del negocio, ella tiene un record de 21réditos.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for her food

loans.name: Las Costureras Group

texts.es:
Las Costureras (The Seamstresses) are a group that contains a mixture of young and experienced micro-entrepreneurs. This mixture of work experience means that each member of the group can benefit from the success of the rest of her partners. This communal bank has been working together for nearly 5 years. They are requesting their fourteenth credit through Friendship Bridge T. be paid over 9 months. Due T. the different levels of experience in the group, the amount of each loan is distinct. Within the group there are 13 members who are asking for higher loan amounts, while the rest are requesting an average credit. The benefit of this situation is that the successful group members are going T. share their knowledge with the rest of their partners.

Within Las Costureras different members work in various economic arenas. The majority of the women work embroidering pretty flowers and birds on traditional blouses typical of the region. In addition, there are two that work in the creation of traditional weaves. Another group sells products in the local market such as tomatoes, tamales, and chickens. Raising animals is another very popular business within the group. Chickens and pigs are the most popular animals. Surprisingly, three of the entrepreneurs have successful bakeries.

The women need loans for distinct purposes. They need the money in order T. purchase flour, butter, sugar, fabric, thread, and livestock.

The majority of the women dream that their businesses will continue T. grow so that they will be able T. purchase land, a house, or simply expand their current house, since usually many people live within one home. Other women want their businesses T. grow in order T. continue sending their daughters and sons T. school and T. college. These dreams go hand-in-hand with the success of their businesses. Help these women attain the credit necessary T. have a successful life.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Las Costureras son un grupo que contiene una mezcla de microempresarias jóvenes y experimentadas. Esta mixtura de experiencias laboral hace que cada integrante del grupo se pueda nutrir del éxiT. del resT. de sus compañeras. Este banco comunal lleva trabajando cerca de 5 años juntas. Ellas van a solicitar su decimocuarT. crédiT. con Friendship Bridge a un plazo de nueve meses. Debido a la experiencia de las integrantes del grupo, el monT. de los préstamos es distinT.. Dentro del grupo hay 13 clientas pidiendo los montos más altos, mientras que el resT. está solicitando un monT. promedio. Lo bueno de esta situación es que las clientas exitosas van a compartir sus conocimientos con el resT. de sus compañeras.

Dentro de este grupo las clientas trabajan en distintas áreas económicas. La mayoría de las clientas trabajan bordando lindas flores y aves en las blusas típicas de la región. Además, hay un par que trabajan en la elaboración de tejidos típicos. Otro grupo vende productos en el mercado local como tomates, tamales y pollos. Crianza de animales es otro rubro M. popular dentro del grupo, pollos y cerdos son los animales más populares. Sorprendentemente, tres de las empresarias tienen una panadería exitosa.

Las clientas necesitan el préstamo para distintos propósitos. Ellas van a necesitar el préstamo para comprar harina, manteca, azúcar, telas, hilos y ganado.

La mayoría de estas señoras sueñan con que su negocio siga creciendo para que así ellas puedan comprarse un terreno, una casa o simplemente ampliar su casa, ya que usualmente muchas personas viven dentro de un hogar. ¡Otras señoras quieren que su negocio siga creciendo para seguir mandando sus hijos e hijas al colegio y a la universidad! Estos sueños van de la mano con el éxiT. de sus negocios, ayúdenlas a conseguir el crédiT. necesario para que así tengan una vida exitosa.

loans.use: To purchase flour, butter, sugar, fabric, thread, and livestock.

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es:
Deysi is a young, 23-year old mother of little Shanelly, three years old, who has become the light of Deysi’s life and the reason for her daily progress in her job selling prepared meals. Deysi’s partner Luis Alberto, an assistant teacher at a high school, supports her and shares all his decisions with her. They work very hard in order to give little Shanelly an education and give her everything she currently needs. Deysi would like to expand her business selling food, and as she already has her own space, she wants to one day have a restaurant. For this she will need capital to invest, which will make her goal possible in unexpected time. With your help Deysi will achieve her objective in a short period of time.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Deysi una joven madre de 23 años de edad, Shanelly su pequeña de tres años se ha convertido en la luz de su vida y la razón de su progreso diario en su ocupación de venta de platillos preparados. Deysi y su conviviente el señor Luis Alberto, quien es trabajador dependiente (profesor de educación secundaria) la apoya y comparte todas sus decisiones y trabajan muy arduamente para brindarle a la pequeña Shanelly estudios y por el momento darle lo ella necesita.La señora Deysi quiere ampliar su negocio de venta de comidas y como cuenta con un local propio quiere llegar a tener un restaurante y para esto necesariamente requiere de un capital de inversión el cual hará posible su propósito en el tiempo menos esperado. Con tu ayuda la señora Deysi logrará su objetivo en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Expansion and improvement of her store in order to establish a restaurant there.

loans.name: Pastora's Group

texts.en:
Susana, Pastora, and Angelica are members of the community bank “Dignidad”. Susana has been a member for two years, while Pastora and Angelica have been part of the bank for 10 and 13 years respectively. In that time they have learned about responsibility, punctuality, and women’s health.

Susana is 42 years old. She has five children between the ages of two and twenty-five. Susana has been selling fruit in the Nery Garcia market of Ayacucho for several years.

Pastora is 37 years old, and has two children. She has a carpentry business, which she was able to start ten years ago with her first loan from the community bank. With this loan she is planning to expand into furniture making.

Angelica is 38 years old. She has three children aged 15, 11, and 9. Angelica raises pigs, to sell as pork. Previously she owned a small grocery store, but with this business she had to travel to different towns to buy products. When she had children she decided to buy pigs so that she could raise both at the same time. Now that her children are older, she is planning on opening a restaurant where she would sell her pork.

Susana, Pastora, and Angelica need loans of 400, 1200, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying, bananas, papayas, oranges, wood, paints, pig feed, and necessary restaurant items. Susana, Pastora, and Angelica have simple dreams. They hope that they can pay for their children’s education and help them to have a better life.

loans.use: Susana, Pastora, and Angelica need loans of 400, 1200, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying, bananas, papayas, oranges, wood, paints, pig feed, and necessary restaurant items.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María Silveria, 47 years old, has been selling groceries from her home for a short time. She, along with her husband Gustavo, decided to take on the challenge of opening a grocery store with the best service for their community. They want to keep moving forward and in time convert the store to a minimarket. María Silveria is mother to five children, four of whom are independent professionals, which leaves her with the company of her youngest child, fifteen years old, who she hopes will follow in his siblings’ footsteps. She turns to your generous hearts to raise the quantity that she needs in order to expand and implement her small grocery store, and little by little turn it into the most visited minimarket, with the best service, in the city.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Maria Silveria de 47 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su domicilio desde hace poco tiempo, ella junto a su esposo el señor Gustavo se plantearon el reto de aperturar una bodega con el mejor servicio para su comunidad, quieren seguir adelante y con el tiempo convertirlo en un minimercado. Maria Silveria es madre de cinco hijos, de los cuales cuatro de ellos ya son profesionales e independientes, quedándose con la compañía del más pequeño de quince años y espera que siga el camino de sus hermanos. Acude vuestro generoso corazón para acopiar la cantidad que necesita para ampliar e implementar su pequeña bodega y poco a poco ir convirtiéndola en el minimercado más visitado y con el mejor servicio de su ciudad.

loans.use: Improve her small grocery store

loans.name: Sandra Del Socorro

texts.es:
Sandra del Socorro M. Martinez, is a single Mom with two children who are in elementary school. She attended school until the 6th grade. She runs a general store business, and tells us that loved doing this type of work since she was young. She decided to start her own business because she always knew from a young age that it wasn't good to just depend on a husband for your needs and expenses. The store that Mrs. M. runs is currently experiencing a difficult situation and she needs to be able to invest in new products, and so she's looking for a way to obtain funding to meet her needs. It is for this reason that Mrs. M. did not hesitate to turn to Ceprodel, and has benefitted from their help during the past two months. Her dream is to be the best retailer of products in the municipal market, which is located in the town of Chichigalpa.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Sandra del Socorro M. M., es soltera, tiene dos hijos que están cursando su primaria, ella curso hasta sexto grado de primaria, el negocio de ella es una pulpería, nos dice que desde joven le ha gustado trabajar por lo que decide poner este negocio porque dice que no le gusta estar dependiendo de lo que su esposo le proporciona por el motivo de que no le ajusta para sus gastos. La pulpería de la señora M. actualmente atraviesa una difícil situación y es la necesidad de invertir en productos por lo que busca la manera de obtener financiamiento para suplir esta necesidad.

Es por esta razón que la señora M. no duda en recurrir a Ceprodel quien desde hace 2 meses la ha beneficiado con créditos para la inversión de su negocio. Su mayor sueño es ser la mejor comerciante de sus productos en el mercado municipal de Chichigalpa que es donde se ubica.

loans.use: To purchase new products for her general store. (Compra de los productos  para la pulperia)

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es:
Socorro S. G. has made a living selling milk in the municipal market of Chichigalpa for 5 years. She started her business out of the need to support her young son since she is a single mother, and the father of her son hasn't assumed responsibility of the boy. Today what she needs is to obtain milk, and she works very hard to acquire it.

Because of such motives, señora S. turned to CEPRODEL for support. For four years, she has been very satisfied with the loans offered to her, which have favored her in the purchase of milk from her suppliers. They have also given her the provisions to support her son, who she says that, after God, she loves more than anything else in life.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Socorro S. G. desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de leche en el mercado municipal de Chichigalpa. Su negocio lo inicia por la necesidad que tiene de mantener a su pequeño hijo ya que es madre soltera y el padre de su hijo no ha asumido la responsabilidad sobre el pequeño. Hoy en dia la necesidad que atraviesa es la obtención de la leche y para esto se esfuerza fuertemente para adquirirla.

Por tales motivos, la señora S. busca apoyo en CEPRODEL desde hace 4 años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados ya que le han favorecido en la compra de la leche a sus proveedores y además le ha dado abasto para mantener a su pequeño que según cuenta después de Dios es lo que mas ama en la vida.

loans.use: Purchase of milk

loans.name: Susana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Susana del Carmen P. is a married woman with three school-aged children. She has a business selling soft drinks, natural juices, and bread. She has gained experience in this line of work since she was a young girl, so she has spent a lot of time dedicated to this work. She started her business when she noticed that the lack of money in her nuclear family was notable. She was helping another lady sell these same products, so she wasn't afraid to start this kind of business.

Susana has worked with CEPRODEL for one year, having received four credits, which she has used wisely in the purchase of her beverages. They have also helped her prepare tacos and sell them.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Susana del Carmen P. es una dama casada y con tres hijos que están en edad escolar, el negocio de esta señora es venta de gaseosas, refrescos naturales y pan, ella desde jovencita tiene experiencia en este negocio por lo que desde hace mucho tiempo se ha dedicado a esta labor. El negocio lo comienza cuando ella se da cuenta que la falte de dinero en el núcleo familiar era notable, en un momento de su vida ella ayudaba a otra señora a vender estos mismos productos y por esta razón no tuvo temor para emprender esta labor.

Susana trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 1 año habiendo recibido 4 créditos que los ha utilizado sabiamente en la compra de sus refrescos, además le ha alcanzado para elaborar tacos y comercializarlos.

loans.use: Purchase of soft drinks and fruit to make her drinks

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila is 38 years of age and has been selling prepared meals for a long time now. She sells meals during breakfast and lunch time. Her dedication to this daily activity comes with the purpose of providing an education and well-being to her six loving children. Along with her husband, Lester, who supports her in this business, they give their children everything they need to progress and thus, be resourceful assets to society. Lucila has the goal of growing her business and in the future, build a restaurant that will help her improve her financial situation and lifestyle. To accomplish this she requires investment capital. Let’s support this mother, who with effort and dedication, works arduously to progress.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lucila de 38 años de edad, se dedica a al venta de comida desde hace mucho tiempo, ella vende en la hora del desayuno y el almuerzo, su dedicación a esta actividad diaria lo hace con el propósito de otorgarles bienestar y educación a sus seis queridos hijos. Ella junto a su esposo el señor Lender, quién la apoya en su negocio de venta de comida, brindan a sus hijos lo necesario para que progresen y posteriormente sean útiles a su sociedad.La señora Lucila tiene un propósito acrecentar su negocio y más adelante llegar a construir su restaurante el cual ayudará a mejorar su nivel económico y calidad de vida, para cumplir este fin requiere de un capital de inversión.Apoyemos a esta madre que con esfuerzo y dedicación sigue trabajando arduamente por progresar.

loans.use: Increase her capital to grow her business selling prepared meals.

loans.name: Ida Isabel's Group

texts.en:
Pelaya, Ida, and Vilma have all been members of the community bank “Dignidad” for close to one year. In that time they have learned about punctuality, responsibility, and investing in their businesses.

Pelaya is 53 year old. She has been selling coca, the medicinal plant from which cocaine can be produced, in the region of Huancavelica for ten years. Pelaya buys coca in and around the city of Ayacucho and then travels between four and seven hours two or three times per week to sell in the neighboring region.

Ida Isabel is forty years old and has owned a restaurant for one and a half years. Before that she traveled around the region buying and selling fruit at different markets. Thanks to a loan from her community bank she was able to start her new business and is much happier.

Vilma is 28 years old and on Sundays she travels to different markets selling clothing. During the week she works at a day care. She has been doing this for one year.

Pelaya, Ida, and Vilma need loans of 400, 600, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in expanding their businesses. They will buy more coca, a new refrigerator, and a larger variety of clothing. Pelaya, Ida, and Vilma dream of continuing to work, furnishing their homes, and that their children will have a better life

loans.use: Pelaya, Ida, and Vilma need loans of 400, 600, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in expanding their businesses.  They will buy more coca, a new refrigerator, and a larger variety of clothing.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Since very young, doña Edith’s aspirations have been related to the art of textile and therefore, with much dedication and effort, she has become an excellent seamstress. Doña Edith owns sewing machines, overcast stitch machines, and machines for the finishing process and others, which are all very helpful in her daily work as she tailors all kinds of garments which she offers from door to door. Doña Edith is 39 years old, has two children whom she wants to provide for with studies and welfare through her work. Edith’s goal is to have her own clothing store and to achieve this purpose she requires a loan as her working capital. Let us support doña Edith, a talented mother who makes an arduous effort to move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Sus aspiraciones desde muy joven han estado relacionadas con el conocimiento del arte textil, es por eso que la señora Edith, se ha convertido con mucha dedicación y esfuerzo en una excelente costurera. Ella cuenta con máquinas de coser, máquinas remalladoras, y máquinas recubridoras, entre otras, que le son de mucha utilidad para la realización de su trabajo diario ya que confecciona prendas para todos los gustos, los cuales los ofrece a domicilio.La señora Edith a sus 39 años de edad, tiene dos hijos a quienes desea brindarles estudios y bienestar con su labor. Edith tiene una meta, llegar a tener su propia tienda de ropas y para el cumplimiento de este propósito requiere de un préstamo como capital de trabajo. Apoyemos a la señora Edith madre talentosa que se esfuerza arduamente por progresar.

loans.use: Purchase sewing materials (needles, thread, yarn, fabric, etc.)

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
Teresa de Jesús H. E. started selling shoes and clothing in the municipal market of Chinandega 7 years ago. She started her business when her husband was retired because of his older age. Because of her spouse's retirement, their income shrunk and they were unable to pay for all of the house expenses. She does not own the place where her store is located, and the place lacks a roof, so when it rains her products get wet and she is often exposed to the sun.

Because of this problem Mrs. H. approached CEPRODEL 4 years ago to benefit from the credits. She advises us she has prospered with these loans as she has diversified the sale of clothing offering more brands and styles. Her next step is to invest in the construction of a small shop of her own in the municipal market.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Teresa de Jesús H. E. desde hace siete años se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos en el mercado municipal de Chinandega. Inicia su negocio a raíz de que a su esposo por ser mayor de edad lo jubilan y por tal razón sus ingresos serian menos y no cubrían con los gastos de su hogar. A pesar de que el local donde vende no es propio, en momentos de lluvia sus productos se mojan y además expone su piel al sol por el mismo hecho de no tener techo.

Por este problema es que la señora H. acude a CEPRODEL desde hace cuatro años para ser beneficiada con créditos y según cuenta ha sido prosperada en su negocio por lo que ha diversificado su venta de ropa ofreciendo mas marcas y estilos. Su próximo paso es invertir en la construcción de un local propio en el mercado municipal.

loans.use: Purchasing of merchandise for the business / Compra de mercadería para el negocio

loans.name: Gladiz

texts.es:
Doña Gladiz is a lady who wants to improve and make progress, she is dedicated to the sale of cold beverages (ice, soft drinks, and beer), and in addition she is also dedicated to dressmaking but only on request. Mrs. Gladiz is 48 years old, mother of seven children, four of them independent, and three still living under her care. She wishes to implement and expand her business to offer better service to her customers and be more successful with her sales, and therefore she needs a loan to achieve her purpose and she turns to your generous heart in search for support.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Gladiz, mujer con muchos deseos de superación y progreso, se dedica a la venta de bebidas heladas (hielo, gaseosas y cervezas), adicionalmente se dedica también al arte textil, pero sólo lo hace cuando se lo solicitan. La señora Gladiz de 48 años de edad, es madre de siete hijos siendo cuatro de ellos ya independientes, mientras que tres de sus hijos todavía se encuentran bajo su protección. Ella quiere implementar y ampliar su negocio de venta de bebidas heladas, para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes con el propósito de obtener mayor acogida de los mismos; necesita un préstamo para realizar su propósito y acude a tu generoso corazón en su búsqueda.

loans.use: Increase capital to expand business and increase sales.

loans.name: Paquita

texts.es:
Paquita is trained as a nurse and currently she has a position as a support person at a health clinic in the afternoons. Nonetheless, in the mornings she sells bijao leaves, limes, chilis and manioc roots, regional products that are eaten frequently. Paquita is 33 years old and is mother to two beautiful children, who have become the light of her life and give her hope of family progress. She, along with her beloved husband Adán, wishes to strengthen their businesses in order to give security and wellbeing to their children. Paquita wants to keep making progress with her business and would like to improve it and in this way increase her financial security. Very recently she decided she would like to open a small store in order to offer essentials and for this she needs capital which will make her goal possible. She awaits your unselfish help from your noble heart.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Paquita es técnica en enfermería y actualmente se desempeña como personal de apoyo en un puesto de salud de su ciudad por las tardes, sin embargo por las mañanas se dedica a la venta de hojas de bijao, limones, ajíes y yuca, productos regionales que son consumidos con mucha frecuencia. Paquita tiene 33 años y es madre de dos hermosos niños los cuales se han convertido en la luz de su camino y esperanza de progreso familiar. Ella junto a su querido esposo el señor, Adán, anhelan la consolidación de sus negocios a fin de brindarles seguridad y bienestar a sus hijos. Paquita quiere seguir progresando con su negocio es por eso que quiere implementarlo y así incrementar su sustento económico, muy posteriormente quiere poner una pequeña tienda para ofrecer artículos de primera necesidad y para ello requiere de un capital de trabajo el cual posibilitará su propósito. Ella espera la ayuda desinteresada de tu noble corazón.

loans.use: Increase her capital in order to offer greater quantity of products

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
Juanita Gisela is a worthy woman dedicated to what she does. She works selling bijao leaves in small quantities. Juanita also exports this product to the capital, which allows her fellow Peruvians use the leaves to prepare traditional dishes. Juanita Gisela is 29 years old and has two children, 2 and 4 years of age, who love her very much. Her husband, Rusber, agrees with and supports her in every one of her goals. What is more, he also supports her in her business and is in charge of finding clients who require the product (bijao leaves) in quantity. She wants to keep progressing and lately she wants to venture into the braid and tassel business. In order to achieve these goals, she would appreciate some capital that will make her goal into reality in the shortest amount of time possible. Let’s support Juanita Gisela with her effort and dedication to keep working hard in order keep moving forward.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Juanita Gisela, es una mujer cabal y decidida en sus propósitos, se dedica a la venta de hojas de bijao al por menor. Juanita exporta también este producto a la capital y los deja a sus paisanos que le dan el uso correspondiente, para sus preparados típicos. La señora Juanita Gisela de 29 años de edad es mamá de 02 hijos 4 y 2 años de edad, que la aman mucho, su esposo el señor Rusber esta de acuerdo y apoyo todos y cada uno de sus propósitos, y lo que es más también la apoya en su negocio, él es el encargado de buscar a los clientes que requieren este producto (hojas de bijao) por cantidad. Ella quiere seguir surgiendo y posteriormente quiere incursionar en el negocio de pasamanería; para cumplir estos propósitos estima de un capital de trabajo que hará realidad su objetivo en el tiempo menos pensado. Apoyemos a la señora Juanita Gisela que con esfuerzo y dedicación sigue trabajando arduamente por seguir adelante.

loans.use: Improver her small sale space

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara has a business in the buying and selling of timber. She travels constantly to purchase this product, and her efforts have brought forth an increase in her household income. She is 37 years old and has three children, who are in school and are her reason for wanting to progress in this field. Sara’s only wish is that her children get an education and become successful professionals in the future. Her loving husband, Julian, also supports her in the timber sales business since he introduced her to this line of work. Her wish to rent warehouse space to store and care for her products bring her to request the help of your generous heart with the goal of achieving this soon.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Sara, se dedica a la compra y venta de madera, ella viaja constantemente para comprar este producto y su desempeño ha permitido el incremento económico de su hogar. Tiene 37 años de edad y es madre de tres hijos los mismos que estudian y son su razón de progreso en este campo laboral. Sara sólo quiere que sus hijos estudien y que en un futuro sean unos profesionales exitosos. Su querido esposo el señor Julián, también se encuentra apoyándola en este negocio de comercialización de madera, puesto que él ha sido quien la introdujo en esta labor.El deseo de alquilar un almacén para depositar y cuidar sus productos la conducen a solicitar la ayuda de vuestro generoso corazón a fin de cumplir pronto esta meta.

loans.use: Increase capital and rent warehouse space.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.es:
Mrs. Olivia Teresa O., who is 49 years of age, has been selling food for a long time, since she gives board to the sawmill employees who work near her home. In order to improve her family’s standard of living, she counts on the collaboration and support of her dear husband, Richard, who works independently. Both of them have the goal of building a motorized boat so as to transport papaya throughout different cities in their country. She wants to develop her fast food business in order to expedite her goals, but she needs capital. With your generous support, Mrs. O. will swiftly achieve her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Olivia Teresa de 49 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace mucho tiempo, puesto que da pensión a los trabajadores de los distintos aserraderos que se han instalado en su ciudad natal y muy cerca de su domicilio.Para incrementar el nivel de vida de su familia cuenta con la colaboración y ayuda de su querido esposo, Richard, quien es trabajador independiente, ambos tienen el propósito de construir un bote a motor para transportar papaya y exportarlas a las diferentes ciudades de su país. Ella quiere implementar su negocio de venta de comidas para cumplir a corto plazo con este propósito, para este fin requiere de un capital de trabajo. Con tu gentil apoyo doña Olivia Teresa podrá hacer realidad en corto tiempo su objetivo.

loans.use: Increase capital for fast food business

loans.name: Marlita

texts.es:
Selling food and giving good attention to her clients is the work that señora Marlita does every day. She is 30-years-old and has 3 daughters, who have become the motor of her progress. She sells food as a street vendor, and her objective is to set up a location to construct a kiosk so she can sell her dishes in an orderly and harmonious manner. For this, she needs work capital, which will help her fulfill her goal. Señora Marlita needs your support to fulfill her dream.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Vender comida y dar una buena atención a sus clientes es el trabajo diario que realiza la señora Marlita de 30 años de edad, quién tiene 03 hijas, que se han convertido en el motor de su progreso.Ella vende comida de manera ambulante y su objetivo instalar un local para construir un kiosco para la venta ordenada y armoniosa de sus comidas, por lo que requiere de un capital de trabajo, el cual la ayudará en el cumplimiento de su propósito. La señora Marlita necesita de tu apoyo, para cumplir su deseo.

loans.use: Construction of a kiosk to offer her delicious dishes with more comfort and cleanliness

loans.name: Lady

texts.es:
Lady Isabel is 33 years old and has two small children. They are the reason for her progress and she would like to give them the best she can so their development will be successful. Currently she works retail sales selling sodas, an activity that allows her to live peacefully, with the noble desire to increase her space soon in order to offer a larger quantity of beverages. Lady Isabel requests this loan as work capital in order to begin the expansion of her business. We can make her request possible, so that soon her business can be the biggest distributor in her beautiful city, Pucallpa.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Lady Isabel tiene 33 años de edad, ella es madre de dos pequeños niños, ellos son la razón de su progreso y desea brindarles lo mejor para que su desenvolvimiento sea exitoso. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de bebidas gaseosas al por menor actividad que le permite vivir tranquilamente, con el noble deseo de acrecentar sus espacios a corto plazo para ofertar mayor cantidad de bebidas. Lady Isabel solicita una suma de dinero como capital de trabajo para iniciar la expansión de su negocio. Posibilitemos su petición para que pronto se convierta en la distribuidora más grande su bella ciudad, Pucallpa.

loans.use: Increase capital to expand her business

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
Mrs. Milagros del Carmen is a great clothing vendor. She sells from a stall at the Micaela market and her good customer service and respect for her customers make this jovial and active woman the best vendor at the market. She is the mother of four children who are studying for technical careers at a prestigious training center in the city. She hopes that they finish their studies that they have begun. She would like to keep progressing with her business and in order to increase her sales she would appreciate some capital which will help her achieve her goal. With your support Mrs. Milagros del Carmen will succeed in a short time.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Milagros del Carmen, es una gran vendedora de ropas, ella vende en un puesto del mercado Micaela, su buena atención y el respeto a sus clientes hacen de esta mujer activa y jovial, la mejor vendedora del mercado. Es madre de cuatro hijos, los mismos que estudian carreras técnicas en un prestigioso centro de formación de su ciudad y su deseo es que culminen satisfactoriamente lo que se han propuesto. Desea seguir progresando con su negocio y para incrementar sus ventas estima de un capital de trabajo, el cual la ayudará a cumplir su meta. Con tu apoyo doña Milagros del Carmen logrará su propósito en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Increase capital to increase sales

loans.name: Antonia's Group

texts.en:
Flor de Maria, Antonia, and Martha have been part of the community bank “Retoño” for 1, 2, and 11 years respectively.  In their community bank they have learned to be punctual, responsible, how to invest their money, and above all to save.  FurthermO., the loans that they have received make it possible for them to start and expand their businesses.
Flor de Maria is 35 years old.  She is married and has three children.  Flor de Maria owns a car and uses it to transport people between towns in the region of Vilcas Huaman.  She has had this business for five years.  Previously, she ran a small stO. in her town, but now her mother is managing it for her.  During the upcoming carnival Flor de Maria will bring beer, paper beads, and face paints to her town and sell them.  In the future Flor de Maria hopes to buy a second car.
Antonia is also 35 years old.  She is separated and has two children.  Antonia travels to different markets around the region where she sells food staples such as sugar, and flour.  From the markets she buys whole grains and cheese that she sells in the city of Ayacucho.  Antonia is thinking of starting a new business selling roasted potatoes.
Meanwhile, Marths is 39 years old.  She lives with her partner and seven children.  Martha processes grains, which she buys from the countryside, in her home and then sells them in Ayacucho.  In addition, with the help of her children she makes and sells roasted potatoes.
Flor de Maria, Antonia, and Martha need loans of 1600, 600, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying beer, paints, beads, rice, sugar, potatoes, wheat, and barley.
The community bank emphasizes saving and each associate has an interest earning account. Flor de Maria, Antonia, and Martha plan to use their savings to buy land and improve their homes.  Their dreams are to eventually have a nice home, buy a house, see their businesses continue to develop, and that their children will be professionals.

loans.use: Flor de Maria, Antonia, and Martha need loans of 1600, 600, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying beer, paints, beads, rice, sugar, potatoes, wheat, and barley.

loans.name: Venturas Antonio

texts.es:
Venturas Antonio C. O. is a young married man who sells sodas and soft drinks in the municipality of Chichigalpa. Amongst the smoothies he serves you can find cacao, barley, rice with pineapple, and orange. He makes them together with his wife. His work demands a great effort on his part because beside making the smoothies he must also be travelling to purchase the fruits in the market and then carry them in bags to his home. Despite this situation, Venturas does not loose hope in improving his business and moving on to provide his family with a greater quality of life.

Venturas, conscious of the need to invest in his business has been working with CEPRODEL for 4 years. He is satisfied with the 19 credits he has received this far which he has used to purchase sodas and supplies to make smoothies.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Venturas Antonio C. O. es un joven casado que se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y refrescos en el municipal de Chichigalpa. Entre los refrescos que el oferta se encuentran el cacao, la cebada, el arroz con piña y la naranja siendo estos elaborados por él mismo y por su esposa en conjunto. Su trabajo le obliga a que se esfuerce grandemente por el hecho de que todos los días realiza los refrescos y además debe de estar viajando a comprar las frutas al mercado por lo que debe cargar con todas estas bolsas hasta llevarlas a su hogar de habitación. A pesar de esta situación, Venturas no pierde las esperanzas de mejorar su negocio y salir adelante ara brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Venturas, consiente de la necesidad de invertir en su negocio, trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 4 años y se siente muy satisfecho con los 19 créditos otorgados por lo que los ha utilizado en la compra de las gaseosas y los refrescos.

loans.use: Purchase of sodas and supplies to make smoothies

loans.name: Romualda's Group

texts.en:
Fernandina, Romualda and Esperanza have been members of the community bank “Retoño” for 2, 7, and 4 years respectively.  
Fernandina is 41 years old.  She is married and has three children.  Fernandina is a textile artisan; she learned this skill from her family.  She makes beautiful blankets and tapestries, which she sells from a stand in the artisan gallery of Ayacucho.
Romualda is forty-eight.  She is married and has six children.  Romualda is also a textile artisan.  Together with her family, Romualda makes blankets and table clothes that she sells to an intermediary.  In addition, Romualda sells fruits from a cart on the streets of Ayacucho. 
On the other hand, Esperanza is 38 years old.  She is a single mother and has one son.  Esperanza travels to different markets in the region where she buys whole grains, cheeses, animals, and other products that she sells in the markets of Ayacucho.  She has been doing this for many years.  Fernandina, Romualda, and Esperanza need loans of 800, 1400, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying primary materials such as threads, dies, corn, barley, wheat, cheese, and animals.
In their community bank they have learned how to invest their money, to be punctual, and responsible.  They also mentioned that they feel like all of the other women in the bank are their friends.  
The community bank emphasizes the importance of saving and each associate has an interest earning savings account. Fernandina, Romualda and Esperanza hope to use their savings to increase the capital of their businesses, build a home, and pay their children’s school fees.  Their dreams are to eventually have more capital for their businesses, have more comforts and conveniences in their homes, and that their children will be professionals.

loans.use: Romualda, and Esperanza need loans of 600, 1400, and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying primary materials such as threads, dies, corn, barley, wheat, cheese, and animals.

loans.name: Yadira Mercedes

texts.es:
Yadira Mercede M. is a single mother of two children; the oldest is of school age and the second is recently born. Yadira's business is the sale of vegetables in the Chinandega Municipal Market's fruit sector since 15 years ago. She is a role model. Thanks to her efforts, she has been able to put her children through private school and is making way on her dream of her little ones graduating eventually with a university degree.

Mrs. Yadira is currently in need to invest and purchase vegetables, but she does not have enough money to make the purchase. This is why she approached CEPRODEL for a credit she'll use to purchase her products and then re-sell them. She has a record of 21 credits.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Yadira Mercede M., es dama soltera y con 2 hijos uno de ellos en edad escolar el otro es recién nacido. El negocio de Yadira es la venta de verduras desde hace 15 años en el sector de las frutas en el mercado municipal de Chinandega. Es una dama digna de imitar debido a que sus esfuerzos han hecho que pueda mantener a sus hijos en el colegio y lograr así su gran sueño de que sus pequeños coronen una carrera universitaria.

La necesidad que atraviesa la señora Yadira es que debe de invertir en la compra de las verduras y actualmente no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para realizar dicha compra. Es por tal motivo que acude a CEPRODEL para obtener créditos que le sirvan para la compra de sus productos para luego comercializarlos. Ella tiene un record de 21 créditos.

loans.use: Purchasing Vegetables

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
Señora Brígida belongs to the communal bank called 'Las Aguilas' located in the district of Calleria in Ucayali. She is 50 years old and a mother of 4 children who are all independent but they still help her financially. She's married and her husband is a retired teacher. With the first loan she obtained from Manuela Ramos, she decided to open up some type of examination room that she runs from home to administer first aid assistance.

She provides services for external use only such as general treatments and injections. She gets up about 6 in the morning to prepare breakfast for her husband, and she then takes care of her patients.

With this loan, which she will repay within 5 months, she will purchase alcohol, gauzes, disposable needles, cotton, lotions for bug bites and lotions for severe burns, medical tape, etc.

Brigida is very happy of all her achievements. She has made one of her biggest dream come true and that is to have her own examination room where she can help others. She wouldn't have been able to do this without the help of Manuela Ramos whom she thanks very much.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Brígida pertenece al banco comunal Las Águilas, ubicado en Jr. Moquegua 268, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 50 años y es madre de 4 hijos, todos son independientes, pero no dejan de apoyar a su madre, es casada y su esposo es profesor jubilado. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en un pequeño botiquín de primeros auxilios. En la actualidad brinda servicios de tópico (curaciones, inyectables) en su casa. Se levanta a las 6 de la mañana para preparar el desayuno de su esposo y de ahí se dedica a la atención de sus pacientes en el tópico. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de alcohol, gasas ,jeringas descartables, algodón, cremas para picaduras de insectos y cremas para quemaduras de primer grado, esparadrapo, etc. Brígida se siente bien por los logros que ha alcanzado en su vida y que su sueño mas grande se ha cumplido, el de tener un tópico, el cual no hubiera sido posible sin el apoyo de Manuela Ramos, es por ello que está muy agradecida.

loans.use: To purchase alcohol, needles, cotton, etc.

loans.name: Ines' Group

texts.en:
Rosa, Inés, and Faustina have been part of the community bank “Retiño” for the past 1, 11, and 10 years respectively.  
Rosa is 50 years old.  She is married and has three children and one grandchild that she cares for.  Rosa sells cheeses door to door.  Previously, she sold vegetables and worked as a household servant.  She opened her new business because working as a servant was affecting her health.
Faustina is 43 years old.  She is married and also has three children.  Faustina travels to different markets twice a week, there she buys grains, and potatoes, which she sells in the city of Ayacucho.  Previously, she also brought fruit, and fish to the market but she stopped because these products often didn’t sell before going bad, and they would have to be thrown out.  
Meanwhile, Inés is 34 years old, married, and has three children.  Inés owns a car wash, which she was able to start with the help of her children.  In addition, during festivals she sells traditional foods and flowers.  Previously she had a farm where she raised chickens and guinea pigs, which are considered a delicacy in Peru.  Her home was destroyed in an accident and as a result she was forced to change businesses.  Inés is hoping to open a new business selling motor oil.
Rosa, Inés, and Faustina need loans of 400, 2000, and 1000 soles (3 soles $1), which they will invest in buying cheese, corn, wheat, barley, potatoes, and motor oil.
The community bank emphasizes the importance of saving and each associate has an interest earning savings account. Rosa, Inés, and Faustina plan to use their savings to build or improve their homes, and pay their children’s school fees.  Their dreams are to continue developing their businesses, that their children will be professionals, and to have good health.

loans.use: Rosa, Inés, and Faustina need loans of 400, 2000, and 1000 soles (3 soles $1), which they will invest in buying cheese, corn, wheat, barley, potatoes, and motor oil.

loans.name: Cludina

texts.es:
Ms. Claudina belongs to the "Women with a Future" communal bank, located in the AA. HH. Pedro Portillo Mz M Lt 3, Calleria district, Ucayali department. She is 58 years old, is separated and is the mother of 3 children. One of those is an adult and two still depend on her. With her first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos of S/.300 she decided to invest in the sales of regional fruits.

She currently sells fruits on the porch of her house. She normally wakes up at 6 am to go to the market and buy the fruit to sell it in the morning in her house and in the afternoons she goes to sell it in the street.

With the loan of S/. 1,000, which she will pay in 5 months, she will buy a larger quantity of fruit and the rest she will invest little by little.

Claudia says that Manuela Ramos is a big help to her because she is a good worker, enterprising and is always very punctual with her monthly payments. Also she feels very thankful.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer. La señora Claudina pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres con Futuro, ubicado en el AA. HH. Pedro Portillo Mz. M Lt. 3, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 58 años, es separada y madre de 3 hijos, uno de ellos es mayor de edad y dos dependen aún de ella. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300, decide invertir en venta de fruta regionales. En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de frutas en la vereda de su casa, normalmente se levanta a las 6 a.m. para ir al mercado y comprar las frutas para venderlas en la mañana en su casa y por las tardes sale a vender en la calle. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará mayor cantidad de frutas, el resto lo ira invirtiendo poco a poco. Claudina manifiesta que Manuela Ramos es una gran ayuda para ella porque es una mujer muy trabajadora, emprendedora y siempre es muy puntual en el pago de sus mensualidades y además se siente muy agradecida.

loans.use: To buy fruit

loans.name: Enith

texts.es:
Señora Enith belongs to the communal bank called 'Nuestra Senora del Carmen' located in the district of Calleria in Ucayali. She's 51 years old. She's seperated from her husband and she has 5 children who are all grown-up. With the first loan she obtained from Manuela Ramos, she decided to raise chickens for a living.

She raises chickens and then sells them at the local market. She gets up about 6:00 in the morning to go to the market and she stays there until 6:00 pm in the evening.

With this loan, which she will repay within 5 months, she will purchase more fine chickens.

Enith tells us that the support she's able to get from Manuela Ramos is very important for her because she can now work independently, take care of herself, support her children in any way, and move ahead with the help of God and with the help of her loved ones.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Enith pertenece al banco comunal Nuestra Señora del Carmen, ubicado en el AA.HH. Faustino Maldonado Mz. D Lt. 6, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 51 años, es separada y madre de 5 hijos mayores de edad. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide dedicarse a la crianza de pollos finos. En la actualidad continúa con la crianza y venta de pollos finos en el mercado, se levanta a las 6 a.m. para dirigirse a su puesto de venta que atiende todos los días hasta las 6 p.m. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará más pollos finos . Enith refiere que el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos es muy importante porque puede trabajar independientemente, valerse por si misma, apoyar a sus hijos en todo aspecto y salir adelante con la ayuda de Dios y de sus seres más queridos.

loans.use: To purchase chickens

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es:
Señora Hortencia belongs to the communal bank called 'Guadalupe' located in the district of Calleria in Ucayali. She's 42 years old and she's separated from her husband. She has one son who still depends on her financially. With the first loan she obtained from Manuela Ramos, she decided to open up a small business selling sodas/refreshments.

She currently sells sodas/refreshments and she also runs a small office for local routes for three-wheeled motocarros. She gets up about 6:00 am to prepare breakfast for her son and she then goes to the office to sell refreshments and to take care of her routing business.

With this loan, which she will repay within 5 months, she will invest it in her routing business and she will purchase 25 boxes of soda/drinks and beer.

Hortencia is very happy with the support she gets from Manuela Ramos since she's able to take care of herself and have her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Hortencia pertenece al banco comunal Guadalupe ubicado en Jr. Puno 355, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 42 años es separada y madre de un hijo que aún depende de ella. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en un negocio de venta de gaseosas. En la actualidad cuenta con un negocio de venta de gaseosas y una línea de concesión de rutas para motocarros. Se levanta a las 6 a.m. a preparar el desayuno de su hijo y luego se dedica a la venta de sus gaseosas y a la atención de su oficina. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en el pago de una cuota de concesión de rutas para motocarros y en la compra de 25 cajas de bebidas (gaseosas y cervezas). Hortencia se siente muy satisfecha con el apoyo que Manuela Ramos le brinda ya que puede valerse por si misma y puede trabajar de manera independiente.

loans.use: To invest in her routing business and to buy refreshments

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Señora Juliana belongs to the communal bank called 'Guadalupe' which is located in the district of Calleria in Ucayali. She is 55 years old and a mother of 4 children. Two of them are adults and the other two still depend on her financially. She's married and her husband is a shopkeeper. With the first loan she obtained from Manuela Ramos, she decided to open up her own business buying and selling wood.

She currently buys and sells wood of different types. She gets up about 5:00 am to go to the many sawmills where she purchases wood and then cuts it and sells it in planks at a higher price.

With this loan, which she will repay in 5 months, she will purchase different types of wood such as shihuahuaco, tornillo, moena, lupuna, cachimbo, etc.

Juliana is very happy because she works together with her sons and this gives her a piece of mind. Even though, she has had many difficulties in life, but she always finds ways to move ahead with a lot of hard work and dedication. She's very thankful to Manuela Ramos for all the support she's giving her in making her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Juliana pertenece al banco comunal Guadalupe, ubicado en Jr. 30 de Agosto 203, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 55 años y es madre de 4 hijos, dos son mayores de edad y dos aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo es comerciante. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en un negocio de compra y venta de madera. En la actualidad cuenta con un negocio de compra y venta de madera de todas las especies, se levanta a las 5 a.m. para ir a los diferentes aserraderos y comprar la madera para luego aserrarlos y venderlos en forma de tablones a un mejor precio. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de madera de diferentes especies como shihuahuaco, tornillo, moena, lupuna, cachimbo, etc. Juliana se siente muy feliz porque trabaja junto con sus hijos y eso le da mayor seguridad y tranquilidad y a pesar de las dificultades que se le presentaron en la vida siempre supo salir adelante con mucho esfuerzo y además está muy agradecida por el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos y también por la facilidades que le permiten seguir creciendo con su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase different types of wood

loans.name: Irene's Group

texts.en:
Irene, Felicitas, and Elizabeth are members of the community bank “Dignidad”.  Irene and Felicitas have been members for several years, and Elizabeth joined eight months ago.  In their community bank they have learned about punctuality, saving, self-esteem, nutrition, and how to care for their families health.
Irene is 58 years old.  She is a widow and has eight children, only one of whom lives with her.  Irene makes a variety of desserts and sells them to different stores and cafes.  She has been doing this for the past seven years.
Felicitas is 33 years old.  She lives with her partner and two children who are nine and two.  Felicitas has been selling firewood from her home for four years.  
Meanwhile, Elizabeth is 25 years old.  She lives with her partner and two young children.  Elizabeth sells prepared food from a stand that belongs to her mother.  She started this business one year ago.
Irene, Felicitas, and Elizabeth need loans of 1000, 1200, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying flour, butter, eggs, oil, wood, rice, sugar, and noodles.  
The community bank emphasizes the importance of saving, and each associate has an interest earning savings account. Rosa, Inés, and Faustina plan to use their savings to build a kitchen and make improvements on their homes.  Their dreams are to travel to another country, see their children become professionals, and have happy families.

loans.use: Irene, Felicitas, and Elizabeth need loans of 1000, 1200, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying flour, butter, eggs, oil, wood, rice, sugar, and noodles.

loans.name: Leydi Emilia

texts.es:
Señora Leydi belongs to the communal bank called 'Nuestra Senora del Carmen' lcoated in Calleria, Ucayali. She is 30 years old and she's single. With the first loan she obtained from Manuela Ramos, she decided to open up a small convenience store.

She currently sells cable for wood. She gets up about 6 in the morning to open up her convenience store and closes it about 8:00 in the evening.

With this loan, which she will repay in 5 months, she will purchase 100 meters of cable for wood.

Leydi is very happy for her growing business. Her profit keeps growing and she feels that her dreams are coming true thanks to all her hard work and dedication and for all the help Manuela Ramos has given her.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Leydi pertenece al banco comunal Nuestra Señora del Carmen, ubicado en el AA.HH. Faustino Maldonado Mz. D Lt. 2, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 30 años y es soltera. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en compra y venta de abarrotes. En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de cables para maderas. Se levanta a las 6 a.m. para abrir su negocio y atender hasta las 8.00 de la noche. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,100, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará 100 cancamos y 100 metros de cables para maderas. Leydi está muy contenta porque su negocio prospera, sus ingresos aumentan y siente que sus sueños se están realizando gracias al esfuerzo y empeño que pone para salir adelante y esta feliz de trabajar con Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: To purchase cables

loans.name: Licialan

texts.es:
Señora Licialan belongs to the communal bank called "Cesar Vallejo" located in Calleria, Ucayali. She's 52 years old. She's separated from her husband and has a son who still depends on her financially. With the first loan she obtained from Manuela Ramos, she decided to open up a little business making intimate apparel.

She currently makes purses, shoes for women and teddy bears. She gets up about 6 in the morning to prepare breakfast for her son, and she then goes from house to house selling her home-made products.

With this loan, which she will repay in 5 months, she will purchase cotton, shoe soles and insoles and thread.

Lucialan is a fortunate woman since she began working with Manuela Ramos. Her business has taken off! Her clientele is growing each day due to her great customer service and the good quality of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Licialan pertenece al banco comunal Cesar Vallejo, ubicado en el Jr Tomas Romero 159, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 52 años, es separada y madre de un hijo que aún depende de ella. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en un negocio de confección de ropa interior. En la actualidad se dedica a la confección de peluches, carteras, zapatos para damas. Se levanta a las 6 de la mañana para preparar el desayuno de su hijo y después se dedica a realizar su trabajo ya que a diario entrega los pedidos a sus clientes. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de algodón, suelas y plantillas para zapatos e hilos. Licialan es una mujer muy afortunada, desde que empezó a trabajar con Manuela Ramos todo le va bien, su negocio está yendo por muy buen camino, sus clientes aumentan cada día por el buen trato y la calidad de sus productos.

loans.use: To purchase cotton in bulk, shoe soles and insoles and thread

loans.name: Lizarda

texts.es:
Lizarda belongs to the Mujeres con Futuro community bank located at Jr. Arenal 1210, Calleria, Ucayali. She is 65 years old, a widow, and a mother of 6. Her children are all older now, but still keep an eye on her. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, totaling 300 sols, she decided to start selling soft drinks out of her home.

She has continued selling refreshments as well as popsicles, ice, jello and mineral water. She wakes up at 7 a.m. to make her breakfast and await and tend to her clients throughout the day.

With the loan valued at 1,700 sols ($600), which she will pay back in 5 months, she will purchase 4 boxes of carbonated beverages and use the rest little by little for jello and other drinks.

Lizarda is a hard-working woman and, despite her age, she has the energy to move forward and support herself. She is very thankful for the support Manuela Ramos has provided her.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

La señora Lizarda pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres con Futuro, ubicado en el Jr. Arenal 1210, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 65 años, es viuda y madre de 6 hijos, todos mayores de edad, pero que siempre están pendiente de ella. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de gaseosas en su domicilio.
